TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections and Plugins in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet sets up the configuration for the Ensembl REST API, including database connections, plugin settings, and API-specific configurations. It defines the structure and behavior of the API endpoints, including content types, documentation, and rate limiting. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/associated_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using => ['Config::Plugin::Licenses'], default_view => 'HTML', service_name => 'Ensembl REST API', service_logo => 'ensembl_logo.png', service_parent_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org', copyright_footer => '

Â© EMBL-EBI 2023 | Ensembl REST API

', # API Documentation api_help_template => 'See here for general documentation', jsonp => 1, enable_jsonp => 1, # Content type definition content_type_header_regexp => qr/^application\/(?:json|javascript)$/, # Compress output by default compress => 1, # Enable CORS on all endpoints "/**" => { "Access-Control-Allow-Origin" => "*", "Access-Control-Allow-Methods" => "GET", "Access-Control-Allow-Headers" => "*", } , # Plugins Plugin => { 'Cache' => { use_plugins => ['Base'], driver => 'CHI', driver_options => { namespace => 'ensrest', storage => '/path/to/file/storage/directory', }, }, 'Cache::Memcached' => { use_plugins => ['Base'], 'servers' => ['127.0.0.1:11211'], 'debug' => 0, 'compress_threshold' => 10_000, }, 'EnsEMBL::REST::Throttle::Limiter::Memcached' => { 'servers' => ['127.0.0.1:11211'], 'debug' => 0, 'compress_threshold' => 10_000, }, }, # Limit by IP # IP_address => Number of requests per hour throttle_max_requests => { '0.0.0.0' => 1000, }, # Documentation URL documentation_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/documentation/info/lookup', # Database connection details connection_details => { biompd => { ALL => { dbname => 'ensembl_metadata', host => 'mysql-eg-mirror.ebi.ac.uk', port => 4157, user => 'anonymous', pass => '', }, }, }, # Species database connections species => { default => { biompd => 'biompd', }, }, # API-specific settings reference_data_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/sequence/reference-data', lookup_features_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/features', variation_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/variation', regulation_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/regulation', ontology_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/ontology', assembly_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/assembly', comparative_genomics_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/comparative_genomics', # Additional configuration options... } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Human HGNC Gene Symbol to Ensembl ID with curl DESCRIPTION: A shell command that demonstrates how to convert a human gene symbol (BRCA2) to its corresponding Ensembl ID using the Ensembl REST API's /xrefs/symbol endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/protein_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -X GET "https://rest.ensembl.org/xrefs/symbol/homo_sapiens/BRCA2?content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Cache Expiration in Catalyst Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration example showing how to set cache expiration time in seconds for the Memcached backend in a Catalyst application. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` expires 3600 # 1 hour in seconds ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Retry Logic for Ensembl REST API Requests in Python DESCRIPTION: This code implements a robust HTTP request function with retry logic for the Ensembl REST API. It handles transient errors, includes exponential backoff, and processes both successful responses and failure conditions appropriately. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests import time def fetch_endpoint(server, ext): max_retries = 3 retry_delay = 1 # seconds for attempt in range(max_retries): try: r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}) if r.ok: return r.json() elif r.status_code == 429: # Too Many Requests # Extract retry time from headers if available if 'Retry-After' in r.headers: retry_delay = int(r.headers['Retry-After']) print(f"Rate limit hit, waiting {retry_delay} seconds...") time.sleep(retry_delay) continue else: r.raise_for_status() except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f"Request failed: {e}") if attempt < max_retries - 1: print(f"Retrying in {retry_delay} seconds...") time.sleep(retry_delay) retry_delay *= 2 # Exponential backoff else: print("Max retries reached. Giving up.") raise return None # Example usage server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?" result = fetch_endpoint(server, ext) if result: print(result['display_name']) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API Server with Custom Configuration in Bash DESCRIPTION: This bash script provides functionality to start, stop, and restart the Ensembl REST API server with various configuration options. It includes functions for managing the server process, checking its status, and displaying help information. The script uses environment variables and command-line arguments to customize the server's configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/gene_archive.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env bash DIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" CONFIG=ensrest.conf SRV="$DIR/ensembl-rest_server.pl" PORT=5000 PIDFILE=$DIR/ensembl-rest.pid LOGFILE=$DIR/ensembl-rest.log MAX_WORKERS=1 IOWORKERS="" CREATOR="" DETACH="" ROLES="web" WORKERS="" function usage { echo -e "Usage: ensembl-rest [arguments]" echo -e "Commands:" echo -e " start Start the REST server" echo -e " stop Stop the REST server" echo -e " restart Restart the REST server" echo -e " status Check if the server is running" echo -e " help This message" echo -e "See ensembl-rest start --help for additional options" } function start_usage { echo -e "Usage: ensembl-rest start [arguments]" echo -e "Arguments:" echo -e " --port Port to start the server on (default: 5000)" echo -e " --pidfile File to store the server process ID" echo -e " (default: ensembl-rest.pid)" echo -e " --logfile File to log the server output" echo -e " (default: ensembl-rest.log)" echo -e " --maxworkers Number of worker processes to run" echo -e " (default: 1)" echo -e " --ioworkers Number of I/O worker processes to run" echo -e " (default: none)" echo -e " --workers Number of worker processes to run" echo -e " (default: none, use this instead of --maxworkers)" echo -e " --config Config file to read from, if different from the default" echo -e " (default: ensrest.conf)" echo -e " --creator Class to use for starting the server" echo -e " (default: use built-in start process)" echo -e " --detach Detach the server from the shell" echo -e " (default: keep attached to the shell)" echo -e " --roles Roles to run the server in, comma-separated" echo -e " (default: web)" echo -e " --dir Directory to start the server in" echo -e " (default: current directory)" } function start { if [ "$1" == "--help" ]; then start_usage return 0 fi # Process command line arguments while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do key="$1" case $key in --port) PORT="$2" shift ;; --pidfile) PIDFILE="$2" shift ;; --logfile) LOGFILE="$2" shift ;; --maxworkers) MAX_WORKERS="$2" shift ;; --ioworkers) IOWORKERS="--io_workers $2" shift ;; --workers) WORKERS="--workers $2" shift ;; --config) CONFIG="$2" shift ;; --creator) CREATOR="-creator $2" shift ;; --detach) DETACH="--detached" ;; --roles) ROLES="$2" shift ;; --dir) DIR="$2" shift ;; *) # unknown option ;; esac shift done cd "$DIR" # Check if the server is already running if [ -f "$PIDFILE" ]; then PID=$(cat "$PIDFILE") if ps -p "$PID" > /dev/null; then echo "Server is already running with PID $PID" return 1 else echo "Removing stale PID file for non-existent process $PID" rm "$PIDFILE" fi fi # Start the server perl "$SRV" -config "$CONFIG" -port "$PORT" -pid_file "$PIDFILE" -maxworkers "$MAX_WORKERS" "$DETACH" "$IOWORKERS" "$WORKERS" "$CREATOR" -roles "$ROLES" if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo "Server started on port $PORT (Log: $LOGFILE)" if [[ -z "$DETACH" && -n "$LOGFILE" ]]; then cat "$LOGFILE" fi return 0 else echo "Failed to start server" return 1 fi } function stop { if [ ! -f "$PIDFILE" ]; then echo "No PID file found, server may not be running" return 1 fi PID=$(cat "$PIDFILE") if ! ps -p "$PID" > /dev/null; then echo "Process $PID not found, removing stale PID file" rm "$PIDFILE" return 1 fi echo "Stopping server with PID $PID" kill "$PID" rm "$PIDFILE" return 0 } function restart { stop sleep 2 start "$@" } function status { if [ ! -f "$PIDFILE" ]; then echo "No PID file found, server is not running" return 1 fi PID=$(cat "$PIDFILE") if ps -p "$PID" > /dev/null; then echo "Server is running with PID $PID" return 0 else echo "Process $PID not found, server may have crashed" rm "$PIDFILE" return 1 fi } # Main script if [ "$#" -eq 0 ]; then usage exit 1 fi COMMAND="$1" shift case "$COMMAND" in start) start "$@" exit $? ;; stop) stop exit $? ;; restart) restart "$@" exit $? ;; status) status exit $? ;; help) usage exit 0 ;; *) echo "Unknown command: $COMMAND" usage exit 1 ;; esac ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Variant Effects using Ensembl REST API in Python DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use the Ensembl REST API to analyze the effects of a genetic variant. It checks the impact of a specific SNP on the BRCA2 gene. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` variant = client.variant_effect('human', 'rs80359550') for transcript in variant[0]['transcript_consequences']: if transcript['gene_symbol'] == 'BRCA2': print(f"Impact: {transcript['impact']}") print(f"Consequence: {', '.join(transcript['consequence_terms'])}") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections and Caching in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for database connections, caching, and API endpoints for the Ensembl REST API. It includes settings for database aliases, caching mechanisms, and specific API endpoint configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/simple_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { # Database settings databases => { DATABASE_CORE => { driver => 'mysql', port => 3306, user => 'ensro', pass => '', }, DATABASE_USERDATA => { driver => 'sqlite', file => 'user_upload.sqlite' }, }, # Database aliases DATABASE_ALIASES => { ALIAS_NAME => 'DATABASE_CORE' }, # Caching no_cache => 0, cache_dir => '/tmp/ensembl_rest', memcached => '127.0.0.1:11211', ttl => 3600, # API settings content_type_header => 'text/plain', jsonp_callback_param => 'callback', api_root_path => '/api', # API endpoint configurations endpoints => [ 'Example::Endpoint', 'Feature::Region', 'Sequence::Region', ], # Optional log4perl settings log4perl => 'log4perl.conf', } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching variant consequences with curl DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to use curl to fetch variant consequences from the Ensembl REST API. It performs a POST request to the variant effect predictor endpoint with a JSON payload containing variant data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" -X POST \ -d '{ "hgvs_notations" : ["ENST00000526603.1:c.1431_1433delTTC","ENST00000528897.1:c.1431_1433delTTC"] }' \ https://rest.ensembl.org/vep/human/hgvs | jq . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections and Server Settings in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API, including database connections for various species and data types, as well as server-specific settings like authentication and compression. It sets up multiple database connections and configures server parameters such as content types, rate limiting, and logging. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/ontology_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { default => { databases => { compara => 'mysql://ensro@compara1/ensembl_compara_108', ontology => 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ensembl_ontology_108', taxonomy => 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ncbi_taxonomy', otherfeatures => [ 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/homo_sapiens_otherfeatures_108_38', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/mus_musculus_otherfeatures_108_39', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/rattus_norvegicus_otherfeatures_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/felis_catus_otherfeatures_108_9', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/bos_taurus_otherfeatures_108_31', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/gallus_gallus_otherfeatures_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/canis_lupus_familiaris_otherfeatures_108_3', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/danio_rerio_otherfeatures_108_11', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/sus_scrofa_otherfeatures_108_111', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ovis_aries_otherfeatures_108_31' ], variation => [ 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/homo_sapiens_variation_108_38', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/mus_musculus_variation_108_39', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/rattus_norvegicus_variation_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/felis_catus_variation_108_9', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/bos_taurus_variation_108_31', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/gallus_gallus_variation_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/canis_lupus_familiaris_variation_108_3', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/danio_rerio_variation_108_11', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/sus_scrofa_variation_108_111', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ovis_aries_variation_108_31' ], core => [ 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/homo_sapiens_core_108_38', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/mus_musculus_core_108_39', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/rattus_norvegicus_core_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/felis_catus_core_108_9', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/bos_taurus_core_108_31', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/gallus_gallus_core_108_6', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/canis_lupus_familiaris_core_108_3', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/danio_rerio_core_108_11', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/sus_scrofa_core_108_111', 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ovis_aries_core_108_31' ], }, # ontology_db_url => 'mysql://ensro@mysql-ensembl-mirror.ebi.ac.uk:4240/ensembl_ontology_108', compress_content => 1, shared_content_types => 1, rate_limit_key => 'SCRIPT_FILENAME', rate_limit_proxy => 1, debug_config_file => 0, logging => 0, # debug_log_file => '/nfs/public/nobackup/ensembl/mnuhn/rest.ebi.ensembl.org.log', # #Access-Control-Allow-Origin header # allowed_cors_origins => '(https?:\\/\\/(?:.*\\.)?ensembl\\.org)', allowed_cors_origins_regex => 1, handle_cors => 1, #Allow credentials in CORS, disabled by default # allow_credentials => 0, strict_content_type => 1, # Enable content_type extensions everywhere content_type_use_ext => 1, # Set the maximum post size to 1MB. A large post body will make Catalyst crash max_request_size => 1048576, # Global JSON serializer options json_serialiser_options => { pretty => 1, indent => 2, }, # Extend the timeout for the variaiton beacons endpoint. # If it was not included here, then 'Controller::ga4gh::Beacons' => { # 30 minutes _OPTIONS => { request_timeout => 1800 }, }, # This is the global session encryption key. Please change me session_cookie_key => 'wibble.mouse.king', # You must change the name of the HMAC key. # It will refuse to start with the default value set. 'Authentication::Hmac' => { key => 'ctQnYDMDm5u3qZJIUysYyWzJ', }, 'Plugin::Cache' => { backend => { class => "Cache::Memcached::Fast", servers => [ '127.0.0.1:11211', ], debug => 0, namespace => 'ensrest:', }, }, jsonp => { callback_key => 'callback', callback_pattern => '^[\w\.]+$', }, }, # Provide a custom default here if needed # production => { # service_config => { # # production-specific configuration here # } # }, # Provide a custom default here if needed # staging => { # service_config => { # # staging-specific configuration here # } # }, # Provide a custom default here if needed # development => { # service_config => { # # development-specific configuration here # } # }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server. It includes database connections, plugins, and various server settings such as logging, caching, and compression. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using => ['Plack::Middleware::ReverseProxy'], default_view => 'JSON', 'Plugin::Cache' => { backend => 'CHI', config => { driver => 'Memory', global => 1 } }, # Enable CORS for all responses 'Plugin::CORS' => { allow_origin => '*', allow_methods => ['GET','OPTIONS'], allow_headers => ['content-type'], max_age => 180, }, service_name => 'Ensembl REST API', service_logo => 'ensembl_logo.png', service_parent_url => 'https://www.ensembl.org', default_content_type => 'text/html' } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Ensembl REST API Cache Configuration in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the caching mechanism for the Ensembl REST API. It sets up CHI caching with file-based storage, specifying the root directory and namespace for the cache. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/prediction_exon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub chi_cache { my ($self) = @_; return { driver => 'File', root_dir => $self->o('ENSEMBL_REST_CACHE_ROOT_DIR').'/chi', namespace => 'ensembl:rest' }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Environment and Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the environment variables, database connections, and plugin configurations for the Ensembl REST API server. It includes database host, port, and user settings, as well as plugin configurations for various Ensembl features. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; use Config::General; { name => 'EnsemblRest', using_mysql => 1, default_view => 'HTML', encoding => 'UTF-8', enable_jsonview => 1, enable_cors => 1, cors_origin => '*', timeout => 900, # Config::General for read_dir() support in config files. 'Plugin::ConfigLoader' => { file => 'conf/ensrest.conf', driver => 'Config::General', substitution => { vars => 1 }, config_local_suffix => 'local' }, # RDF Plugin, format defaults to turtle # default_serializer_type => 'text/turtle', # default_rdf_writer_class => 'Turtle', # default_format_type => 'turtle', # Allow overriding the default serialization format via query # parameters. # format_query_parameter => 'rdf_fmt', 'Model::Registry' => { skip_infer_schema => 1, use_new_assembly => 1, host => $ENV{ENS_REST_HOST} || 'useastdb.ensembl.org', port => $ENV{ENS_REST_PORT} || 5306, user => $ENV{ENS_REST_USER} || 'anonymous', pass => $ENV{ENS_REST_PASS} || '', version => $ENV{ENS_REST_VERSION} || 108, verbose => $ENV{ENS_REST_VERBOSE} || 0, no_cache => $ENV{ENS_REST_NO_CACHE} || 0, scratch_space => $ENV{ENS_REST_SCRATCH} || '/tmp', dont_wait => 1, }, 'Plugin::Static::Simple' => { include_path => ['root/'], dirs => ['static'], ignore_extensions => [ qw// ], debug => 1, }, 'Plugin::Cache' => { backend => $ENV{CACHE_MEMORY} || { class => 'Cache::Memcached::Fast', servers => ['127.0.0.1:11211'], debug => 0, }, }, enable_stats => 1, stats_class => 'Statistics::Descriptive::LogScale', 'Controller::Root' => { no_cache_control => 1 }, no_example => 'test', # SpeciesList Plugin for LD endpoint 'Plugin::SpeciesList' => { lists => { defaults => ['http://www.ensembl.org/info/genome/compara/species_sets.xml'], } }, # CORS plugin 'Plugin::CORS' => { allow_headers => ['X-Requested-With'], allow_methods => ['GET', 'POST', 'OPTIONS'], header_field_name => 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin', }, log4perl => { category_style => 'clustered', conf => 'catalyst.log4perl.conf', }, # Ontology Plugin 'Model::Ontology' => { ontology_service_url => 'http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/api', }, # XMLRPC Plugin 'Plugin::XMLRPC' => { DTDPath => '/usr/share/soap-lite/', }, 'Plugin::ProxyPath' => { path => '/api', }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API using curl in Bash DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API using curl in Bash. It retrieves information about the human BRCA2 gene. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl 'http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/symbol/homo_sapiens/BRCA2?content-type=application/json' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Dependencies and Settings in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the required Perl modules, database connections, and API settings for the Ensembl REST API project. It includes version requirements, database configurations, and various API-specific settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` name = EnsEMBL::REST version = 7.1.0 [PruneCaches] [PruneNeedsRestart] [Prereqs] Catalyst = 5.90050 Catalyst::Action::RenderView = 0 Catalyst::Authentication::Credential::HTTP = 0 Catalyst::Component::InstancePerContext = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::ConfigLoader = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::Static::Simple = 0 Catalyst::View::TT = 0 Config::General = 0 Data::Printer = 0 DBD::SQLite = 1.42 DBI = 0 File::Spec = 0 Hash::Merge = 0 HTML::Entities = 0 HTTP::Headers = 0 HTTP::Request = 0 JSON = 2.90 Log::Log4perl::Catalyst = 0 LWP::Protocol::https = 0 LWP::Simple = 0 Moose = 2.0604 MooseX::Types = 0 MooseX::Types::Moose = 0 Namespace::autoclean = 0 Net::FTP = 0 Perl::Critic = 1.130 Plack::Middleware::Assets = 0 Plack::Middleware::Deflater = 0 Plack::Middleware::CrossOrigin = 0 Plack::Middleware::ReverseProxy = 0 Plack::Middleware::SizeLimit = 0 Perl::Critic::Progressive = 0 Plack::Test = 0 Sereal = 0 Star::Studded = 0 Star::Wars = 0 Readonly = 0 URI::Escape = 0 URI::PathAbstract = 0 WWW::REST::Google::Apps::Gmail = 0 [Prereqs / TestRequires] Catalyst::Test = 0 Error = 0 Guard = 0 Data::Dumper = 0 IO::Scalar = 0 LWP::Protocol::PSGI = 0 Test::Differences = 0 Test::Deep = 0 Test::Exception = 0 Test::MockObject = 1.09 Test::More = 0 Test::Warnings = 0 Test::XML::Simple = 0 [Prereqs / RuntimeRequires] DBIx::Class::Cursor::Cached = 0 Catalyst::Model::DBIC::Schema = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::Cache = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::StackTrace = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::PageCache = 0 Catalyst::View::JSON = 0 Devel::Cycle = 0 MooseX::ClassAttribute = 0 PadWalker = 0 Plack::Handler::Starman = 0 Plack::Middleware::Debug = 0 Redis = 0 REST::Client = 0 MooseX::Log::Log4perl = 0 [Prereqs / RuntimeRecommends] MooseX::NonMoose = 0 Test::Pod::Coverage = 0 Test::Perl::Critic = 0 Log::Dispatch::FileRotate = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::Session = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::Session::Store::File = 0 Catalyst::Plugin::Session::State::Cookie = 0 Test::HTTP::Server::Simple = 0 Devel::Cover = 0 Pod::Coverage::TrustPod = 0 DBD::mysql = 4.025 DBIx::Class::Schema::Loader = 0 Plack::App::FakeApache = 0 Cache::FileCache = 0 Cache::Memcached = 0 Cache::Memcached::Fast = 0 Plack::Middleware::Debug::Ajax = 0 Catalyst::TraitFor::Component::DBIC::Schema::QueryLog = 0 Class::Load = 0 Go::Workbench = 0 Google::Analytics::Data::V1alpha = 0 JSON::XS = 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding Human Genomic Variants with VEP in Python DESCRIPTION: A Python script that uses the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) endpoint of the Ensembl REST API to analyze the effects of genomic variants. It sends a POST request with variant data in the required format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/protein_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/vep/human/hgvs" hgvs_notations = ['ENST00000380152:c.2309C>T', 'ENST00000544455:c.1376C>T', 'ENST00000269305:c.6146G>A'] headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json", "Accept" : "application/json"} r = requests.post(server+extension, json={'hgvs_notations':hgvs_notations}, headers=headers) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Catalyst for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This Perl script configures the Catalyst framework for the Ensembl REST API. It sets up various plugins, middleware, and application-specific settings. ', markdown_pod_formatter => ' ', enabled_plugin_list => [qw/Cache Static::Simple/], # The following lines are needed if you use the CHI cache disable_middleware => [ 'Debug' ], # They ensure that debug panels are *not* appended to HTML # responses (it would break non-HTML response parsers) 'Plugin::Static::Simple' => { include_path => ['/'], dirs => ['static'], }, 'Controller::Root' => { # Set to 0 if the site is under heavy load clear_cached_api_key => 1 }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Gene Information in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the Ensembl REST API to retrieve information about a specific gene. It uses the LWP::UserAgent module to make an HTTP GET request and JSON module to parse the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/object_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use LWP::UserAgent; use JSON; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new; my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?'; my $response = $ua->get($server.$ext, 'Content-Type' => 'application/json'); die "" . $response->status_line . "\n" unless $response->is_success; my $hash = decode_json($response->content); print "$hash->{id}\t$hash->{display_name}\t$hash->{description}\n"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server. It includes information about API paths, parameters, responses, and components. The schema defines endpoints for accessing genomic data and specifies expected request formats and response structures. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dependent_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` openapi: 3.0.0 info: description: | Ensembl REST API version: "1.0.0" title: Ensembl REST API contact: email: helpdesk@ensembl.org license: name: Apache 2.0 url: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html servers: - url: https://rest.ensembl.org tags: - name: sequence description: Sequence related endpoints - name: overlap description: Overlap related endpoints paths: /sequence/region/{species}/{region}: get: tags: - sequence summary: Returns the genomic sequence of the specified region operationId: getSequenceByRegion parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/species' - name: region in: path description: Query region. A maximum of 10Mb is allowed to be requested at any one time required: true schema: type: string - name: strand in: query description: Strand of requested sequence. Default is the forward (positive) orientation required: false schema: type: integer enum: [1, -1] default: 1 - name: expanded in: query description: Request the sequence padded either side of the region by the specified number of basepairs required: false schema: type: integer default: 0 example: 100 - name: format in: query description: Response format required: false schema: type: string enum: [fasta, json] default: json responses: '200': description: A successful response content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/SequenceResponse' text/x-fasta: schema: type: string '400': description: Bad request content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/Error' '404': description: Not found content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/Error' /overlap/region/{species}/{region}: get: tags: - overlap summary: Returns features overlapping a region operationId: getOverlapByRegion parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/species' - name: region in: path description: Query region. A maximum of 5Mb is allowed to be requested at any one time required: true schema: type: string - name: feature in: query description: Feature type to retrieve required: true schema: type: string enum: [gene, transcript, cds, exon, repeat, simple, misc, variation, somatic_variation, structural_variation, somatic_structural_variation, constrained, regulatory, motif, chip_peak, array_probe] responses: '200': description: A successful response content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/OverlapResponse' '400': description: Bad request content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/Error' '404': description: Not found content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/Error' components: parameters: species: name: species in: path description: Species name/alias required: true schema: type: string schemas: SequenceResponse: type: object properties: seq: type: string description: The sequence id: type: string description: The input region OverlapResponse: type: array items: type: object properties: id: type: string description: Feature identifier start: type: integer description: Start coordinate end: type: integer description: End coordinate strand: type: integer description: Strand orientation Error: type: object properties: error: type: string ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating MySQL Database Connection Pool for AWS Lambda in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Establishes a connection pool to a MySQL database using the mysql2 package with configuration read from environment variables. The pool is created with specific parameters for connection limits and timeouts. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/object_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` var mysql = require('mysql2'); var pool = mysql.createPool({ host: process.env.RDS_HOSTNAME, user: process.env.RDS_USERNAME, password: process.env.RDS_PASSWORD, port: process.env.RDS_PORT, database: process.env.RDS_DATABASE, connectionLimit: 10, queueLimit: 0, waitForConnections: true }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching region features with curl DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to use curl to fetch region features from the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the overlap/region endpoint to retrieve all features in a specified genomic region on human chromosome 7. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \ https://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene\;feature=transcript\;feature=cds\;feature=exon | jq . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: REST Server Health Check Script for EBI Production Environment DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive shell script that checks the health of an EBI Production REST server instance by making HTTP requests to various API endpoints and validating the responses. The script performs checks on species listing, archives, and specialized endpoints to ensure proper server functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh echo "Content-type: text/plain" echo PHOST=http://rest.ensembl.org fail=0 echo "Testing $PHOST" echo "Testing Archive" if curl -s "$PHOST/archive/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json" | grep -q BRCA2 ; then echo " OK" else echo " NO $PHOST/archive/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json" fail=1 fi echo "Checking species list" curl -s "$PHOST/info/species?content-type=application/json" | grep -q Homo > /dev/null && echo " OK" || (echo " NO" ; fail=1) echo "Checking species" curl -s "$PHOST/info/rest?content-type=application/json" | grep -q service > /dev/null && echo " OK" || (echo " NO" ; fail=1) echo "Checking LD" curl -s "$PHOST/ld/human/pairwise/rs1042779/rs10744000?content-type=application/json" | grep -q r2 > /dev/null && echo " OK" || (echo " NO" ; fail=1) echo "Checking variation" curl -s "$PHOST/variation/human/rs56116432?content-type=application/json" | grep -q MAF > /dev/null && echo " OK" || (echo " NO" ; fail=1) if [ $fail -eq 1 ]; then echo "FAILED" exit 1 fi echo "OK" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Gene Information via Ensembl REST API Using curl DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use curl to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API to retrieve information about the BRCA2 gene in JSON format. It shows the proper URL structure and includes a header to specify the content type. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/density_type.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" https://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id/ENSG00000139618?format=full ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API with Ruby DESCRIPTION: Ruby implementation for connecting to the Ensembl REST API. This example demonstrates how to use Ruby's Net::HTTP and JSON libraries to make a request and parse the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/associated_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Ruby CODE: ``` require 'net/http' require 'uri' require 'json' server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org' path = '/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;feature=transcript;feature=cds;feature=exon' url = URI.parse(server + path) http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port) http.use_ssl = true request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url.request_uri) request.content_type = 'application/json' response = http.request(request) if response.code != "200" puts "Invalid response: " + response.code puts response.body exit end result = JSON.parse(response.body) puts result.inspect ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Perl Library Paths for Ensembl API DESCRIPTION: Perl code to add necessary Ensembl API libraries to the Perl library path. It sends a GET request to the map/human/GRCh37 endpoint to convert coordinates from human assembly GRCh37 to mouse assembly GRCm38. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/map/human/GRCh37/7:140424943-140424943:1/mouse?'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' } }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $response->{content}; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Rate Limiting for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure rate limiting for the Ensembl REST API. It defines default limits, blacklisted addresses, and how to handle different types of users with varying rate limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Rate limiting configuration RateLimiter: # switch to turn rate limiting on and off enabled: 1 # Default amount of requests per second default_limit: 15 # Hard limit for all requests max_limit: ~ # Store to use storage: EnsEMBL::REST::RateLimitStorage::Redis # Addresses to blacklist blacklist: [] # Path for socket socket: /tmp/redis.sock # redis information redis_host: 127.0.0.1 redis_port: 6379 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API using requests in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the requests library in Python to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API. Databases to connect to Model::Registry => { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', verbose => 0, version => 104, databases => { human => { core => 'homo_sapiens_core_104_38', variation => 'homo_sapiens_variation_104_38', funcgen => 'homo_sapiens_funcgen_104_38', otherfeatures => 'homo_sapiens_otherfeatures_104_38', rnaseq => 'homo_sapiens_rnaseq_104_38', }, mouse => { core => 'mus_musculus_core_104_39', variation => 'mus_musculus_variation_104_39', funcgen => 'mus_musculus_funcgen_104_39', otherfeatures => 'mus_musculus_otherfeatures_104_39', rnaseq => 'mus_musculus_rnaseq_104_39', }, # Plugin configuration Plugin::Cache => { backend => 'Memory', expires_in => 3600, }, # Versioning api_version => 'v1', # Rate limiting max_requests => 15, timeframe => 3600, blacklist => ['192.168.0.1'], , } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving gene information from Ensembl REST API using Python and requests DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to fetch information about the BRCA2 gene from the Ensembl REST API.
