It validates input parameters, fetches the sequence data, and formats the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_region : Chained('/') PathPart('sequence/region') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') Does('RegionLength') {} sub get_region_GET { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $region = $c->stash()->{region}; my $slice = $c->stash()->{slice}; my $seq_obj = $self->_seq_obj($slice); $self->status_ok($c, entity => $seq_obj); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Development Environment Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: A configuration example for development environments showing debug settings, CORS configuration, and other options useful during development including database connection details. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` ---\nname: EnsEMBL::REST\nservice_name: rest\nseqlevels:\n - chromosome\n - supercontig\n - primary_assembly\nwww_root: http://rest.ensembl.org\nensembl_rest:\n default:\n compara: multi\n compara_grch37: multi_grch37\n compara_mouse: multi_mouse\n debug: 1\n ontology: multi\n regulation: homo_sapiens\n variation: homo_sapiens\n multi:\n ce:\n alias: c_elegans\n compara: multi\n core: caenorhabditis_elegans_core_84_250\n otherfeatures: caenorhabditis_elegans_otherfeatures_84_250\n rnaseq: caenorhabditis_elegans_rnaseq_84_250\n variation: caenorhabditis_elegans_variation_84_250\n dm:\n alias: fruitfly\n compara: multi\n core: drosophila_melanogaster_core_84_602\n otherfeatures: drosophila_melanogaster_otherfeatures_84_602\n variation: drosophila_melanogaster_variation_84_602\nCors:\n Origins: '*'\nshow_data_structure_failures: 1\n\nspecies: homo_sapiens\nmouse: mus_musculus\nzebrafish: danio_rerio\ncompara: multi\nstarman_config:\n listen:\n - :5000\n pid: /tmp/restapi.pid\n #Access log format\n daemonize: 0\n error_log: /tmp/restapierror.log\n #access_log: /tmp/restapiajp.log\n #Minimum number of workers at start-up\n workers: 5\n #Maximum number of worker processes\n max_workers: 5\n max_requests: 10000\nlog4perl:\n logger: console\n console:\n layout: %M %p %n %m%n\n class: Log::Log4perl::Appender::Screen\n#Uncomment to generate docs for swagger\n#documentation:\n# paths:\n# - %paths\n# out: rest.app\n# host: rest.ensembl.org ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections and Settings in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API, including database connections, caching options, and API-specific settings. It sets up connections to various Ensembl databases and configures content types and compression for API responses. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/exon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', default_view => 'HTML', using_frontend_proxy => 1, jsonp_callback_parameters => ['callback', 'jsonp'], # Disable compression on *everything* # N.B. This is a bit of a hack. We should probably disable this on a per-endpoint basis disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1, compression => 0, encoding => 'UTF-8', version_check => 'strict', # Set max number of threads for any Catalyst based responses # This is needed to prevent server overload in high traffic conditions psgi_keep_alive => 0, psgi_workers => 16, # API Cache configuration cache_on_key => 1, # Allow access to our API from any server, we will control who can do what # at an API level # The default connection details for Ensembl databases default_connection = { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => '5306', user => 'anonymous' } # Access to GRCh37 version_check = strict warn_if_cores_inconsistent = 1 species_groups = [ 'vertebrates', # 'Vertebrates (65)' in the VEP web interface 'arthropods', # 'Metazoa (7)' in the VEP web interface 'microbes', # 'Bacteria (22)' in the VEP web interface 'fungi', # 'Fungi (11)' in the VEP web interface 'protists', # 'Protists (4)' in the VEP web interface 'plants', # 'Plants (51)' in the VEP web interface 'virus', # 'Viruses (1)' in the VEP web interface ] grch37 = { host => 'grch37.ensembl.org', port => '3306', user => 'anonymous', } # Control if nested linked hash lookups are allowed. Say we lookup a Gene # EG: /lookup/id/ENSG00000... # The user can traverse into other linked information such as transcripts # EG: /lookup/id/ENSG00000...?expand=1;format=full allow_nested_lookup=1 max_post_size=1000 # JSON format config exposeable_keys_only => 1 allow_blessed => 1 convert_blessed => 1 json_encoder_class => "CBOR::XS" # Cache configuration class = CHI # We can't use BerkeleyDB and Memcached because of CPAN dependency issues # Memcached's module isn't installed because it's uninstallable and BerkeleyDB is not installed in production driver = Memory global = 1 # store => '/path/to/file/based/store' # servers => ['memcached.example.com:11211'] paths = [root/documentation] cache_ttl = 3600 cache_class = Memory max_post_size=1000 include_path = [root/static] ignore_extensions = [] minify = 0 ignore_extensions = [] max_post_size=1000 max_post_size=100000 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: POSTing to REST server using HTTP::Request in Perl DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use HTTP::Request with LWP::UserAgent in Perl to send POST requests to the Ensembl REST API. Shows creating a request object with headers and a JSON payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Request; use LWP::UserAgent; use JSON; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/vep/human/hgvs'; my $request = HTTP::Request->new('POST', $server.$ext, ['Content-type' => 'application/json']); $request->content('{"hgvs_notations":["ENST00000494142:c.48C>A","ENST00000313050:c.136G>A"]}'); my $response = $ua->request($request); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->is_success; if(length $response->decoded_content) { my $hash = decode_json($response->decoded_content); foreach my $entry (@{$hash}) { print $entry->{transcript_id}, ":", $entry->{most_severe_consequence}, "\n"; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Overlapping Features with Feature Type Filtering in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to retrieve overlapping features of specific types (gene, transcript, cds) from a genomic region. Multiple feature types can be specified in a single request. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;feature=transcript;feature=cds;content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Making HTTP GET Request to Ensembl API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This function performs an HTTP GET request to the Ensembl API. It constructs the URL using the _url function, sets up headers including content type and user agent, and handles the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get { my ($self, $path, $params) = @_; my $url = $self->_url($path, $params); my $response = $self->http_get($url, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json', %{$self->extra_headers}, } } ); my $content; if (exists $response->{content}) { $content = $response->{content}; } else { $content = $response->content; } return $self->json->decode($content); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API with Python requests DESCRIPTION: Example of using Python's requests library to access the Ensembl REST API. This code shows how to make a GET request with proper headers and process the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/assembly.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/info/ping" r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() print(r.json()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Ensembl REST API Development Environment DESCRIPTION: A Docker Compose configuration that sets up a development environment for the Ensembl REST API. It defines services for the REST API and a Swagger UI container, with volume mappings for local development and network configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3' services: rest: build: context: ../ dockerfile: ./docker/Dockerfile volumes: - "../:/app" ports: - "3000:3000" networks: - ens-net environment: - SRV_HOST="0.0.0.0" - SRV_PORT=3000 swagger-ui: image: swaggerapi/swagger-ui ports: - 8080:8080 environment: - SWAGGER_JSON=/specs/rest_dev.json volumes: - "../root/documentation:/specs" networks: - ens-net networks: ens-net: external: false ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl Elasticsearch API endpoint using curl DESCRIPTION: Example of using curl to query the Ensembl Elasticsearch endpoint. This basic request demonstrates how to search for the gene 'BRCA2' using the Ensembl REST API's search endpoint with JSON format specified. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/unconventional_transcript_association.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: curl CODE: ``` curl 'https://rest.ensembl.org/search/BRCA2' -H 'Content-type:application/json' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Track Hub Endpoint for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines a REST endpoint to generate track hub information. This method validates parameters, processes track hub requests, and returns a properly formatted response with appropriate content type. It handles errors, formats URLs, and manages the response structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub trackhub : Chained('experiment') PathPart('trackhub') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') { } sub trackhub_GET { my ( $self, $c ) = @_; # optional parameter to specify whether to use a subdomain, default is 1 # (/experiment/trackhub?subdomain=0) my $subdomain = $c->request->param('subdomain') // 1; # validate boolean parameter if ($subdomain !~ /^[01]$/) { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{subdomain parameter must be 0 or 1, if specified}]); } my $hub_info = {}; my $url = $c->request->base; $url->path_query(""); # remove '/experiment/trackhub' from url # remove subdomain from url if specified if ( $subdomain ) { my $host = $url->host; $host =~ s/^[^\.]+\.(.*)/\1/; $url->host($host); } # build hub info with full URIs $hub_info->{url} = $url->as_string; $hub_info->{trackhub} = $c->request->base->as_string; $self->status_ok( $c, entity => $hub_info ); $c->response->header( 'Content-Type' => 'text/plain' ); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: A Perl example showing how to access the Ensembl REST API using the HTTP::Tiny module. It demonstrates making a request to retrieve genetic data and handling the response, including proper setting of headers and content-type specification. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/qtl_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'http://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/sequence/id/ENSG00000157764?'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' } }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { print "Query returned: ".$response->{content}."\n"; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resource Package and Controller Class Definition DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to define a controller package for an Ensembl REST API endpoint. It demonstrates the proper naming convention and inheritance structure for resource controllers in the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Sequence; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; BEGIN { extends 'Catalyst::Controller::REST'; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Variation Data in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: A controller method for handling genetic variation queries in the Ensembl REST API. It specifies how to extract variation information for a given transcript ID, handling species and population filters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/seq_region_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub get_transcript_haplotypes_GET { my ($self, $c, $species, $id) = @_; my $population_name = $c->request->param('population_name'); try { my $tr_haps = $c->model('ga4gh::TranscriptHaplotypes')->fetch_by_transcript($id, $population_name); $self->status_ok($c, entity => $tr_haps); } catch { $c->go('ReturnError', 'from_ensembl', [$_]); }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring CORS and Rate Limiting for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) and rate limiting for the Ensembl REST API. It defines allowed origins, headers, and methods for CORS, as well as rate limiting parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker_map_location.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` allow_origins = * allow_headers = Content-Type allow_methods = GET OPTIONS use = 1 use = 1 max_unshared_size_in_kb = 120000 min_shared_size_in_kb = 2000 max_process_size_in_kb = 200000 check_every_n_requests = 10 [Plugin::Cache] use = 1 [Plack::Middleware::EnsThrottle::MemcachedBackend] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Sequence Data from Ensembl REST API in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to fetch sequence data for a specific genomic region using the Ensembl REST API. It retrieves the sequence for a portion of the BRCA2 gene. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` sequence = client.sequence_region('human', 'BRCA2', start=32316461, end=32316470) print(f"Sequence: {sequence['seq']}") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Routes in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the routes for an Ensembl REST API endpoint. It maps various URL patterns to specific controller actions, allowing access to genetic data such as variations, phenotypes, and genomic features. The configuration uses the Catalyst framework's chained dispatch type for flexible routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/qtl.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; sub endpoints { my ($self) = @_; my $parent = $self->next::method(); my $dba_check = sub { my $c = shift; $c->stash(variation_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'Variation', 'Variation')); $c->stash(transcript_variation_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'Variation', 'TranscriptVariation')); $c->stash(vep_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'variation', 'VariationFeature')); $c->stash(phenotype_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'variation', 'phenotype')); $c->stash(population_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'variation', 'population')); $c->stash(variation_feature_adaptor => $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor($c->stash->{species}, 'variation', 'variationfeature')); }; push @{$parent}, ( # Variation related Endpoints [qw/variation species/, [qw/id/, [qw/GET/, 'Lookup'], ['sources', [qw/GET/, 'Sources']], ['phenotypes', [qw/GET/, 'Phenotypes']], ['populations', [qw/GET/, 'Populations']], ['genotypes', [qw/GET/, 'Genotypes']], ] ], [qw/vep species/, [qw/region/, [qw/POST/, 'RegionVEP']], [qw/id/, [qw/POST/, 'IdVEP']], ], [qw/variation_feature species/, [qw/region/, [qw/GET/, 'VariationFeatureRegionGet']], ], [qw/structural_variation species/, [qw/id/, [qw/GET/, 'StructuralVariationIdGet'], ], ], [qw/phenotype species region/, [qw/GET/, 'PhenotypeRegionGet'], ], [qw/gene species/, [qw/id/, [qw/haplotypes/, [qw/GET/, 'HapStatGet']], [qw/variation_graph/, [qw/GET/, 'VariationGraphGet']], ], ], ); return $parent; } 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Overlapping Features by Region in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to retrieve all gene features that overlap with a specific genomic region. The request specifies the species, chromosome, start and end positions of the region. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Executing GET Request with cURL to Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve data from an Ensembl REST API endpoint using cURL. It makes a GET request to the lookup endpoint for a specific genome ID, passing content-type and accept headers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" -H "Accept:application/json" \ http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764? ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting coordinates between species with Python DESCRIPTION: This Python code demonstrates how to convert genomic coordinates between species using the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the map/human/GRCh37 endpoint to convert coordinates from human assembly GRCh37 to mouse assembly GRCm38. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/map/human/GRCh37/7:140424943-140424943:1/mouse?" r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() printable = r.json() print(printable) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Variant Effect Prediction Endpoint in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the variant effect prediction endpoint in the Ensembl REST API. It shows the URL structure, required parameters, and an example of the expected JSON response format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` GET /vep/:species/region/:region/:allele/ Required Parameters: species : Species name/alias region : Query region e.g 9:22125503-22125502:1 allele : Variation allele # Example Response: { "variant_consequences" : [{ "variant_allele" : "C", "consequences" : [ { "consequence_terms" : [ "downstream_gene_variant" ], "impact" : "MODIFIER", "gene_id" : "ENSG00000178188", "gene_symbol" : "THBD" } ] }] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Custom Authentication for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Sets up custom authentication for the Ensembl REST API using Catalyst::Authentication. It defines authentication realms, credential validation, and user storage methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/exon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` __PACKAGE__->config( 'Plugin::Authentication' => { default => { credential => { class => 'Password', password_field => 'password', password_type => 'self_check', }, store => { class => 'Minimal', users => { admin => { password => "admin", }, }, }, }, no_user => { credential => { class => 'Password', password_field => 'password', password_type => 'none', }, store => { class => 'Minimal', users => {}, }, }, } ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Assembly Accession in Ensembl REST API (Perl) DESCRIPTION: This function retrieves the assembly accession for a given species. It uses the Ensembl API to access the species' meta container and fetch the assembly accession number. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub _assembly_accession { my ($self, $species) = @_; my $dba = $self->_get_DBAdaptor($species); return $dba->get_MetaContainer()->single_value_by_key('assembly.accession'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining API Endpoints for Ensembl REST in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code block specifies the API endpoints for the Ensembl REST service. It includes various endpoints for different functionalities such as info, lookup, and overlap. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker_map_location.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` [Controller::Info] [Controller::Lookup] [Controller::Assembly] [Controller::Overlap] [Controller::Map] [Controller::Sequence] [Controller::Variation] [Controller::Regulatory] [Controller::Homology] [Controller::VEP] [View::GFF3] [View::HTML] [View::YAML] [Model::Documentation] [Plugin::Cache] use = 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying VEP with GET request using bash curl DESCRIPTION: Example of querying the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) REST API endpoint using curl in bash to analyze a genomic variant. Shows how to use the GET method to retrieve data about a specific variant. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl "https://rest.ensembl.org/vep/human/hgvs/ENST00000494142:c.48C>A?content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Authentication for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up authentication for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the authentication realm, credential store, and session configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/karyotype.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` $c->config->{Authentication} = { default_realm => 'ensembl', realms => { ensembl => { credential => { class => 'Password', password_field => 'password', password_type => 'clear' }, store => { class => 'DBIx::Class', user_model => 'DB::User', } } } }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Feature IDs with Additional Parameters in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to request feature information with expanded details by setting the 'expand' parameter to 1. This returns additional information about the feature including its parent and child objects. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json;expand=1" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Genomic Features with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to fetch genomic features using the Ensembl REST API. It shows an example request to retrieve features within a specific genomic region for the human genome. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene HTTP/1.1 Host: rest.ensembl.org Content-Type: application/json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ensembl API dependencies via Git DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone Ensembl API repositories from GitHub into a specified directory structure. This sets up the required Ensembl API modules that the REST server depends on. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl.git git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-io.git git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-variation.git git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-funcgen.git git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-compara.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Endpoint Path in Perl with Catalyst DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to define a RESTful endpoint path in Perl using Catalyst's chained dispatch system. It defines a parent chain with versioning and shows how to create a Lookup endpoint that will respond to GET requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Archive; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; __PACKAGE__->config(PROMETHEUS_INSTRUMENTATE => 1); BEGIN { extends 'Catalyst::Controller::REST'; } # This creates the basis for the REST URL # e.g. /archive/ # The /** creates a chained matching meaning we will try to capture # any endpoint that is prefixed with /archive/ sub id_GET : Chained('') Path('/archive/id') Args(1) ActionClass('REST') {} sub id_GET_GET { # Rest of code } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Variant Effect Predictions with cURL from Ensembl VEP Endpoint DESCRIPTION: This cURL command demonstrates how to use the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) REST endpoint. It sends a POST request with variant data to predict the effects of chromosome 7 variants on the BRAF gene. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" -H "Accept:application/json" -X POST -d '{ "variants": ["7 140453136 140453136 A/T 1"] }' \ http://rest.ensembl.org/vep/homo_sapiens/region? ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Gene Homology with Target Species Filter in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates requesting homology data for a specific gene with a target species filter. It uses the Ensembl REST API and appends the 'target_species' parameter to restrict results. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?target_species=human;sequence=none" r = requests.get(server+extension, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Formatting HGVS Notation for VEP Processing in Perl DESCRIPTION: This function formats HGVS notation for use with the Variant Effect Predictor. It processes the input HGVS string and prepares it in the format required by the VEP, handling both genomic and transcript-based notations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/karyotype.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub _format_hgvs { my ($self, $c, $hgvs, $version) = @_; my ($id_part, $syn_part) = split ':', $hgvs, 2; my ($first_part, $second_part); if($id_part =~ /^ENST/) { $first_part = 't'; } elsif($id_part =~ /^ENSP/) { $first_part = 'p'; } elsif($id_part =~ /^(ENS[A-Z]+)?[0-9]+$/ || $id_part =~ /^([0-9]+|[XY]|MT?):g$/) { $first_part = 'g'; $hgvs =~ s/:g/:/ if $hgvs =~ /:g/; #If we don't have an assembled piece of genomic sequence (a region), don't continue return { id => $hgvs }; } else { Catalyst::Exception->throw(message => "HGVS notation not supported: $hgvs"); } # Version specified when transcript ID doesn't have it if($hgvs !~ /\.[0-9]+:/ && $version) { $hgvs =~ s/:/\.$version:/; } return { id => $hgvs }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing JSON Data Type Coercions in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines a method to handle JSON data type coercions for the Ensembl REST API. This method processes different field types and applies appropriate transformations to ensure data consistency. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub write_type_coercions { my ($self, $fields) = @_; my $coercions = {}; foreach my $field (@{$fields}) { my $type = $field->{type}; my $key = $field->{name}; if($type eq 'json') { my $code = sub { my ($t) = @_; return $t if ref($t); return undef if ! defined $t; my $decoded_json; eval { $decoded_json = decode_json($t); }; if($@) { die {message => "Could not decode json for field $key", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } return $decoded_json; }; $coercions->{$key} = $code; } elsif($type eq 'boolean') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return 0 if ! defined $t; if($t eq 'false' || $t == 0) { return 0; } if($t eq 'true' || $t >= 1) { return 1; } return $t; }; } elsif($type eq 'enum') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return if ! defined $t; return $t }; } elsif($type eq 'numeric') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return if ! defined $t; return $t; }; } elsif($type eq 'integer') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return if ! defined $t; return $t; }; } elsif($type eq 'string') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return if ! defined $t; return $t; }; } elsif($type eq 'object') { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return if ! defined $t; if($field->{model} eq 'gene') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Gene->new_from_json($t); } elsif($field->{model} eq 'transcript') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Transcript->new_from_json($t); } elsif($field->{model} eq 'exon') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Exon->new_from_json($t); } elsif($field->{model} eq 'variation') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Variation->new_from_json($t); } elsif($field->{model} eq 'variation_feature') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::VariationFeature->new_from_json($t); } elsif($field->{model} eq 'transcript_variation') { return EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::TranscriptVariation->new_from_json($t); } else { die "model $field->{model} could not be found"; } }; } else { $coercions->{$key} = sub { my ($t) = @_; return $t; }; } } return $coercions; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Ensembl REST API on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes deployment and service configuration for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the deployment strategy, resource allocation, and exposes the service. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/qtl_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: YAML CODE: ``` --- apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: ensembl-rest-deployment labels: app: ensembl-rest spec: replicas: 3 selector: matchLabels: app: ensembl-rest template: metadata: labels: app: ensembl-rest spec: containers: - name: ensembl-rest image: ensemblorg/ensembl-rest:release-110 ports: - containerPort: 3000 resources: limits: cpu: "1" memory: 4Gi requests: cpu: 500m memory: 2Gi --- apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: name: ensembl-rest-service spec: selector: app: ensembl-rest ports: - protocol: TCP port: 80 targetPort: 3000 type: LoadBalancer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Sequence Data from Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to use the sequence retrieval endpoint in the Ensembl REST API. It shows the URL structure, required parameters, and an example of the expected JSON response format for sequence data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` GET /sequence/id/:id Required Parameters: id : Stable ID of the feature to retrieve sequence for # Example Response: { "seq" : "ATGCTTGAAGGTGAGCTGGCCTCTCTCTGCCTGGTGGCTGGCATTGCTGCTAC...", "id" : "ENST00000377001" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Rate Limiting for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up rate limiting for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the maximum number of requests allowed per second and the path to exempt from rate limiting. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use = NoPassword max_requests_per_second = 15 # Use this to tailor a response on breach max_requests_message = "You have exceeded the limit of 15 requests per second" paths_exempt_from_rate_limiting = "/healthcheck|/archive" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Regulatory Features with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response for regulatory feature data from the Ensembl REST API. The response includes details about regulatory elements such as enhancers and transcription factor binding sites in a specific genomic region. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/stable_id_history.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "binding_matrix": { "length": 6, "name": "MA0139.1", "source": "JASPAR" }, "end": 1054765, "score": 6.868, "stable_id": "ENSM00000000080", "start": 1054760, "strand": "+", "transcription_factor": "CTCF" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Ensembl Variation Data in JSON Format DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to request variation data from the Ensembl REST API using curl. The request targets a specific human variant (rs116035550) and specifies the JSON output format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/mapping_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" 'http://rest.ensembl.org/variation/human/rs116035550' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Starman Server Configuration for Production DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST API server in a production environment with more detailed configuration, including number of workers, host, port, and daemonization options. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ensembl-rest starman --workers 10 --pid ensrest.pid --daemonize --listen :8080 --error-log ensrest.error.log bin/production/start_rest_server.pl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Variant Consequence DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the Ensembl REST API to get the consequences of a specific variant. It uses the 'vep/human/hgvs' endpoint with an HGVS notation for the variant and specifies JSON as the response format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_transcript_pair.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` GET /vep/human/hgvs/AGT:c.803T>C?content-type=application/json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying for Gene Symbol Information in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to query for a specific gene by its symbol (BRCA2) in human. The endpoint returns information about the gene including its stable ID and other relevant details. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/symbol/homo_sapiens/BRCA2?content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Taxonomy Filter with Homology Endpoint in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code example queries the Ensembl REST API for homology data with a taxonomy filter. It uses a target taxonomy ID of 9526 to focus results on specific taxonomic groups, demonstrating how to refine orthology searches. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?target_taxon=9526;sequence=none" r = requests.get(server+extension, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Gene Information from Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the gene lookup endpoint in the Ensembl REST API. It includes the URL structure, required parameters, and an example of the expected JSON response format for gene information. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` GET /lookup/id/:id Required Parameters: id : Gene stable ID # Example Response: { "source" : "ensembl", "object_type" : "Gene", "logic_name" : "ensembl_havana_gene", "species" : "homo_sapiens", "description" : "thrombomodulin [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:11784]", "display_name" : "THBD", "biotype" : "protein_coding", "strand" : -1, "end" : 22125508, "id" : "ENSG00000178188", "start" : 22098013, "version" : 14, "name" : "THBD", "seq_region_name" : "20" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Epigenomes REST Controller Module in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines the EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Epigenomes package with Moose, setting up the controller's namespace, chained actions, and dependencies. It establishes the base path for all epigenome-related endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/peptide_archive.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Epigenomes; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Utils::Scalar qw/wrap_array/; requires 'epigenomes_adaptor'; __PACKAGE__->config( map => { 'text/x-gff3' => [qw/View GFF3/], } ); begin { extends 'Catalyst::Controller::REST'; } # This will be the basis for the rest of the paths sub epigenomes :Chained('/') PathPart('epigenomes') CaptureArgs(0) {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Ensembl REST API Docker Image DESCRIPTION: Dockerfile instructions for building the Ensembl REST API image. It sets up the base environment, installs dependencies, and configures the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/qtl_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Dockerfile CODE: ``` FROM ensemblorg/ensembl-base:release-110 LABEL maintainer="dev@ensembl.org" ENV PERL5LIB_DEFAULT ${PERL5LIB} RUN apt-get update && \ apt-get install -y curl && \ cpanm --force Catalyst::Action::REST::AddContentTypeHeader Catalyst::Component::InstancePerContext Catalyst::Controller::REST@1.21 Catalyst::Plugin::Cache::FastMmap CHI::Driver::Memcached DateTime::Format::Strptime@1.77 Digest::MD5::File File::Temp HTTP::Tiny JSON::XS List::MoreUtils Lingua::EN::Inflect Module::Build Readonly::XS Starman@0.4014 SQL::Translator Text::Unidecode URI::Escape XML::Writer@0.625 ENV OPT_USE_APPEND_ASSEMBLY_ID 0 ADD . /opt/ensembl-rest WORKDIR /opt/ensembl-rest RUN ln -sf /ensembl-plugins /opt/ensembl-rest/ensembl-plugins CMD ["/bin/bash"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting coordinates between species with curl DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to use curl to convert genomic coordinates between species using the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the map/human/GRCh37 endpoint to convert coordinates from human assembly GRCh37 to mouse assembly GRCm38. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \ https://rest.ensembl.org/map/human/GRCh37/7:140424943-140424943:1/mouse? | jq . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Logging in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the logging configuration for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the log level, file path, and format for the application logs. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/translation_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` log4perl => { logger => { ROOT => { level => 'WARN', appender => 'Screen', }, }, appender => { Screen => { plugin => 'Log::Log4perl::Appender::Screen', stderr => 1, layout => 'EnsEMBL::REST::PatternLayout', }, DebugFile => { plugin => 'Log::Log4perl::Appender::File', filename => 'debug.log', mode => 'append', layout => 'EnsEMBL::REST::PatternLayout', }, }, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Gene Filtering Functionality in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to test gene filtering functionality in the Ensembl REST API. It creates a list of test genes with different biotypes and tests the filtering process based on those biotypes and other criteria. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` my $genes = [ #should pass bless({'biotype' => 'protein_coding', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'ensembl'}), #shouldn't since version 70 bless({'biotype' => 'ensembl', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'nonsense'}), #filter_biotype should reject this bless({'biotype' => 'pseudogene', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'ensembl'}), #filter_biotype should reject this bless({'biotype' => 'LRG_gene', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'ensembl'}), #should let LRG through because we only filter when source is ensembl bless({'biotype' => 'LRG_gene', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'non_ensembl_source'}), #but this will also go since status is KNOWN and source is ensembl (and can_filter is set to true) bless({'biotype' => 'RNA', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'ensembl'}), #filter_biotype should reject this bless({'biotype' => 'processed_transcript', 'status' => 'KNOWN', 'source' => 'ensembl'}), #Has a null status and should be let through bless({'biotype' => 'processed_transcript', 'status' => undef, 'source' => 'ensembl'}), ]; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Variant Lookup Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet implements an endpoint for looking up variant information. It includes parameter validation and error handling. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/unmapped_reason.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` post '/variant/lookup' => sub { my $c = shift; my $params = $c->req->json; unless ($params && ref($params) eq 'HASH') { $c->render(status => 400, json => { error => 'Invalid request format' }); return; } # Further implementation }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Ensembl REST API with Starman DESCRIPTION: Perl script for deploying the Ensembl REST API using Starman. It sets up the server environment, defines startup parameters, and launches the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/CAFE_gene_family.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; use Daemon::Control; my $root_dir = '/ensembl/ensembl-rest'; my $starman = '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/bin/starman'; my $workers = 10; my $port = 8080; my $init = Daemon::Control->new( name => "ensrest", lsb_start => '$syslog $remote_fs', lsb_stop => '$syslog', lsb_sdesc => 'Ensembl REST server control', lsb_desc => 'Ensembl REST server control', path => '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/ensrest.pl', program => $starman, program_args => [ '--workers', $workers, '--listen', ":${port}", '--env', 'production', "${root_dir}/ensrest.psgi" ], pid_file => '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/ensrest.pid', stderr_file => '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/logs/error.log', stdout_file => '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/logs/access.log', fork => 2, ); $init->run; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Ensembl REST API tests with Test::More framework in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up a test environment for the Ensembl REST API using the Test::More and Test::Deep frameworks. It initializes the test with a plan for 66 tests and loads the necessary Ensembl configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use Test::More; use Test::Deep; use Test::Differences; use Test::Warnings; use JSON; use URI::Escape; use FindBin qw($Bin); use lib "$Bin/lib"; use RestHelper; use Test::Warnings; my $conf_file = "$Bin/../ensembl_rest.conf"; my $live = 0; my ($conf, $dba, $multi); plan tests => 66; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing POST Method in REST Controller with Perl DESCRIPTION: Example implementing a POST method for a REST endpoint. Demonstrates proper request body handling and response formatting for POST requests in the Ensembl REST API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub id_POST { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $body = $c->req->body_parameters->{id}; # Implementation here } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Memcached Caching in a Controller DESCRIPTION: Example of using caching in a controller to store and retrieve data. Demonstrates checking for cached data, retrieving from cache, and setting data in cache when needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_gene : Chained('/') Args(1) { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $key = 'get_gene:'.$id; my $cached_content = $c->cache->get($key); if ($cached_content) { $c->stash->{data} = $cached_content; } else { my $gene = $c->model('Gene')->get($id); $c->stash->{data} = $gene; $c->cache->set($key, $gene); } $self->status_ok($c); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Ensembl REST API Response and Printing Results in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet checks the HTTP status code of the API response, decodes the JSON content if successful, and prints the formatted result. It includes error handling for failed requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/protein_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: This Perl code configures an Ensembl REST API endpoint. It sets up database connections, caching parameters, and request handling settings. The configuration includes options for controlling the number of worker processes, connection timeouts, and rate limiting. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/prediction_exon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; sub setup_rest_api { my $self = shift; $self->{'general'} = { # Number of workers and worker-specific options daemonise => 1, max_workers => 20, pid_file => '/nfs/ensembl/ensembl/rest_test/ensrest.%d.pid', status_file => '/nfs/ensembl/ensembl/rest_test/ensrest.%d.status', access_log => '/nfs/ensembl/ensembl/rest_test/ensrest.%d.access.log', error_log => '/nfs/ensembl/ensembl/rest_test/ensrest.%d.error.log', # Connection timeouts read_timeout => 60, write_timeout => 600, keep_alive_timeout => 600, # Rate limiting max_requests_per_hour => 15000, max_requests_per_second => 15, # Proxy settings proxy => { proxy_set => 0, proxy_url => '', proxy_http_port => '', proxy_https_port => '', no_proxy => '', } }; $self->{'log'} = { config => 'log4perl.conf' }; $self->{'database'} = { user => 'anonymous', host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 3306, soap_db_host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', soap_db_port => 3306, }; $self->{'mt'} = { # Mandatory settings production_name => 'homo_sapiens', genomic_sequence_adaptor => '/nfs/ensembl/your_mountpoint/adaptor', # Optional settings # mt_codon_table => 2, # mt_genetic_code => 2, }; $self->{'cache'} = { enabled => 1, backend => 'Memcached', host => '127.0.0.1:11211', expires => '24 hours', compress => 1, serialiser => 'JSON', reconnect => 5, timeout => 5, }; $self->{'sequence'} = { cache => { type => 'memcached', host => 'localhost:11211', expires => '24 hours', compress => 1, serialiser => 'Storable', enabled => 1, }, }; $self->{'vep'} = { cache => { enabled => 1, dir => '/nfs/ensembl/your_mountpoint/vep_cache', version => 91, }, bam => { enabled => 1, dir => '/nfs/ensembl/your_mountpoint/bam_files', url => 'http://example.com/bam_files', }, fasta => { enabled => 1, dir => '/nfs/ensembl/your_mountpoint/fasta_files', }, plugin => { enabled => 1, dir => '/nfs/ensembl/your_mountpoint/vep_plugins', }, }; return $self; } 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines database connection parameters for the Ensembl REST API. It includes settings for multiple databases, specifying host, port, user, and pass for each connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker_map_location.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` user = ensro pass = host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 3306 [compara] user = ensro pass = host = compara.ensembl.org port = 3306 [websitedbs] user = ensro pass = host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 3306 [genomicalign] user = ensro pass = host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 3306 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Caching Options in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the caching options for the Ensembl REST API server. It sets up CHI caching with file-based storage and defines cache expiration times for different types of data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/data_file.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` chi_root => root_dir().'/ensembl_rest', chi => { driver => 'File', root_dir => root_dir().'/ensembl_rest/chi', }, # Setting CacheControl headers expires_header => "expires", cache_expires_mapping => { "application/json" => "86400", "text/plain" => "86400", "application/xml" => "86400", "default" => "86400" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing genome assembly accession endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/info/genomes/accession' endpoint of the Ensembl REST API. It verifies that filtering genomes by assembly accession works correctly and returns the expected genome data. It specifies the route, HTTP method, and includes documentation for the endpoint. The endpoint supports various parameters for filtering and customizing the variant data retrieval. It sends a GET request to the homology/id endpoint to retrieve homology information for ENSG00000157764. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?format=condensed;type=orthologues'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' } }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $response->{content}; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring MySQL connection in ensembl_rest.conf DESCRIPTION: Perl configuration snippet showing how to set up MySQL database connections for different Ensembl species in the REST API configuration file.
