'solanum_tuberosum', 'tri' => 'triticum_aestivum', 'vit' => 'vitis_vinifera' } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Sequence Retrieval Endpoint in Perl for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a REST API endpoint for retrieving sequence information. It specifies the route, HTTP method, and documentation for the endpoint. The endpoint supports various parameters for customizing the sequence retrieval. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/misc_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub sequence_GET {\n my $c = shift;\n my $slice = $c->stash()->{slice};\n my $seq_edits = $c->request->param('seq_edits');\n my $expand_3prime = $c->request->param('expand_3prime');\n my $expand_5prime = $c->request->param('expand_5prime');\n my $type = $c->request->param('type') || 'genomic';\n my $format = $c->request->param('format') || 'fasta';\n #...\n} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing API Endpoint for Retrieving ID-based Sequence in Perl DESCRIPTION: This function handles requests for retrieving sequence information based on a specific identifier. It supports various types of identifiers and fetches the corresponding sequence data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_id : Chained('/') PathPart('sequence/id') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') Does('IDTypeValidator') {} sub get_id_GET { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $id = $c->stash()->{id}; my $type = $c->stash()->{id_type}; my $object = $c->model('Lookup')->find_object_by_stable_id($id); my $seq_obj = $self->_seq_obj($object); $self->status_ok($c, entity => $seq_obj); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Ensembl REST API Controller in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the Ensembl::REST::Controller::Sequence package and sets up the base path for API endpoints. It also imports necessary modules and defines the allowed HTTP methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package Ensembl::REST::Controller::Sequence; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; __PACKAGE__->config( map => { 'text/html' => [qw/View JSON/], 'text/plain' => [qw/View Text/], 'text/x-fasta' => [qw/View FASTA/], 'application/json' => [qw/View JSON/], 'application/jsonp' => [qw/View JSONP/], 'application/xml' => [qw/View XML/] } ); BEGIN { extends 'Catalyst::Controller::REST'; } # This allows us to define all our allowed methods once and re-use them my $allowed_methods = ['GET']; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing taxonomy descendants endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/taxonomy/descendants' endpoint which returns taxonomic descendants for a given ID. It verifies that the endpoint correctly filters results by a specific taxonomic subtree. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Taxonomy descendants endpoint { my $taxon_id = 9605; # Homo genus my $taxonomy_json = RestHelper->get_json("taxonomy/descendants/$taxon_id"); ok(scalar(@{$taxonomy_json}) >= 1, 'Descendants endpoint returned some results'); my @scinames = map { $_->{scientific_name} } @{$taxonomy_json}; ok((grep { $_ eq 'Homo sapiens' } @scinames), 'Homo sapiens found'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Transcript Sequence Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines an endpoint for retrieving the sequence of a transcript. It supports parameters for controlling UTR expansion and sequence retrieval. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub sequence : Chained('transcript') PathPart('sequence') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') {} sub sequence_GET { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $transcript = $c->stash()->{transcript}; my $transcript_id = $c->stash->{transcript_id}; my $expand_3prime = $c->stash->{expand_3prime}; my $expand_5prime = $c->stash->{expand_5prime}; my $no_seq = $c->stash->{no_seq}; $self->status_ok( $c, entity => { id => $transcript_id, seq => $c->model('Sequence')->get_transcript_sequence($transcript, $expand_3prime, $expand_5prime, $no_seq), } ); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Package and Importing Dependencies for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines the package namespace and imports required modules for the Ensembl REST API experiment endpoints. Sets up inheritance from EnsEMBL::REST::Controller and configures the chain action for handling experiment-related requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Experiment; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Experiment; requires 'experiment_adaptors'; __PACKAGE__->config( action => { experiment => { Args => 1 }, source => { Args => 0 }, } ); sub experiment : Chained('/') PathPart('experiment') CaptureArgs(0) {} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving sequence data from Ensembl REST API using Python and requests DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to fetch the genomic sequence for human chromosome 13 coordinates. It demonstrates making a GET request with specific sequence region parameters and handling the response data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/external_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/sequence/region/human/13:32889611..32973805:1?" r = requests.get(server+extension, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Sequence Data using curl DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use curl to fetch sequence data from the Ensembl REST API. It includes headers to specify the response format as JSON and makes a GET request to retrieve the coding sequence of a specific human gene. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/qtl_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \ 'http://rest.ensembl.org/sequence/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=text/plain' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Species and Assembly Information in Ensembl REST API (Perl) DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a subroutine for retrieving species and assembly information. It processes the species name, checks for aliases, and returns relevant data including assembly and accession details. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_species_and_assembly { my ($self, $species) = @_; $species = $self->_clean_species_name($species); $species = $self->_alias_species($species); my $info = { species => $species, }; if (my $assembly = $self->_assembly($species)) { $info->{assembly} = $assembly; } if (my $accession = $self->_assembly_accession($species)) { $info->{assembly_accession} = $accession; } return $info; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Elasticsearch Connection and Settings in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Configuration settings for connecting to an Elasticsearch server from the Ensembl REST API. Specifies the nodes to connect to, the maximum result window size, and the default result size. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` [Search] elasticsearch_host = localhost:9200 elasticsearch_max_result_window = 100000 elasticsearch_result_size = 100 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Perl HTTP::Tiny for POST requests to REST API DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use HTTP::Tiny in Perl to make POST requests to the Ensembl REST API. Demonstrates configuring headers and content, and handling the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/vep/human/hgvs'; my $response = $http->post_form($server.$ext, { 'hgvs_notations' => '["ENST00000494142:c.48C>A","ENST00000313050:c.136G>A"]' }, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json', 'Accept' => 'application/json'} }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); foreach my $entry (@{$hash}) { print $entry->{transcript_id}, ":", $entry->{most_severe_consequence}, "\n"; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Caching for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This configuration block sets up caching for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the cache type, expiration time, and namespace for storing cached data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` class = CHI driver = Memory global = 1 class = CHI driver = Memory global = 1 expires_in = 24h namespace = endpoint ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections in YAML DESCRIPTION: Example YAML configuration file that defines database connection parameters for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies database hosts, ports, and user credentials for accessing Ensembl databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` databases: DATABASE_CORE: host: ensembldb.ensembl.org port: 3306 user: anonymous verbose: 0 DATABASE_VARIATION: host: ensembldb.ensembl.org port: 3306 user: anonymous verbose: 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Variant Phenotype Data with Content-Type Specification DESCRIPTION: A curl command example demonstrating how to query the Ensembl REST API for variant phenotype data with a specific content type (JSON). This shows the proper headers to use when making requests to the API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "https://rest.ensembl.org/variation/homo_sapiens/rs2299222/phenotypes" -H "Content-Type: application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Service for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This Service configuration exposes the REST API deployment to the network, making it accessible both within the Kubernetes cluster and externally. It maps port 80 to the container's port 3000 and is set up for load balancing. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/hmm_profile.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: name: rest labels: app: rest spec: ports: - port: 80 targetPort: 3000 selector: app: rest type: ClusterIP ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing taxonomy siblings endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/taxonomy/siblings' endpoint which returns taxonomic siblings (same parent) for a given ID. It checks if the endpoint correctly identifies sibling taxa of the same taxonomic rank. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Taxonomy siblings endpoint { my $taxon_id = 9606; # Homo sapiens my $taxonomy_json = RestHelper->get_json("taxonomy/siblings/$taxon_id"); cmp_ok(scalar(@{$taxonomy_json}), '>=', 2, 'Siblings endpoint returned at least 2 results'); my @scinames = map { $_->{scientific_name} } @{$taxonomy_json}; ok((grep { $_ eq 'Homo sapiens neanderthalensis' } @scinames), 'Homo sapiens neanderthalensis found'); ok((grep { $_ eq 'Homo sapiens ssp. Denisova' } @scinames), 'Homo sapiens ssp. Denisova found'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Ensembl REST API Endpoints in Perl DESCRIPTION: This Perl code defines REST API endpoints for the Ensembl project. It sets up routes for various genomic data queries, including sequence retrieval, variant information, and gene annotations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/associated_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Sequence; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Utils::Scalar qw/wrap_array/; __PACKAGE__->config(namespace => 'sequence'); with 'EnsEMBL::REST::Role::Content'; sub sequence : Chained('/') PathPart('sequence') Args(1) ActionClass('REST') {} sub sequence_GET { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $sequence = $self->_fetch_sequence($c, $id); $self->status_ok($c, entity => { seq => $sequence }); } sub _fetch_sequence { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $db = $c->model('Registry')->get_adaptor('Human', 'Core', 'Slice'); my $slice = $db->fetch_by_region('chromosome', $id); return $slice->seq(); } __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes ConfigMap for Ensembl REST API Configuration DESCRIPTION: This ConfigMap defines various configuration parameters for the Ensembl REST API service such as database connections, timeout settings, and server configurations. It sets up server name, port, pidfile, and several connection timeout parameters for the API deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/hmm_profile.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: v1 kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: rest-config data: # Server Setting serverName: "rest.ensembl.org" port: "3000" pidfile: "/ensembl/REST/ensrest.pid" timeout: "180" # connection timeout timeout_connection: "120" timeout_idle_connection: "120" timeout_search: "120" timeout_per_sequence: "120" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Routes in YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration block that defines routing paths for the Ensembl REST API. It maps various endpoints to their corresponding controller actions, specifying the HTTP methods and formats supported. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- # Controller that handles lookup operations '/lookup/id/:id': get: to: 'Lookup#id' params: id: type: 'Str' pattern: '[\w\.]+' default_: description: 'ID lookup' examples: - /lookup/id/ENSG00000157764 parameters: - name: db_type description: 'Retrieves features from the given database type. Default core. Available - [core, otherfeatures, rnaseq, cdna, vega]' example: [core, otherfeatures, rnaseq, cdna, vega] required: 0 type: String - name: expand description: 'Expands the search to include any connected features. e.g. If the object is a gene, its transcripts, translations and exons will be returned as well.' example: 'true' type: Boolean required: 0 - name: format description: 'Format of the data' example: ['full', 'condensed'] required: 0 type: Enum[full, condensed] - name: species description: 'Preferred species. Used when a stable ID is available in multiple species.' required: 0 type: String example: 'human' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Gene Sequence from Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to fetch the genomic sequence for a specific gene using the Ensembl REST API. It uses the 'sequence/id' endpoint with the gene ID 'ENSG00000157764' and includes additional parameters to retrieve masked sequence and expand 5' and 3' ends. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_transcript_pair.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` GET /sequence/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=text/plain;mask=soft;expand_5prime=60;expand_3prime=60 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Variant Data with Perl for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use Perl to retrieve variant data from the Ensembl REST API. It uses HTTP::Tiny to make a GET request to the variant lookup endpoint with specific arguments and processes the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/homology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/variant/human/rs56116432?content-type=application/json'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $hash->{most_severe_consequence}, "\n"; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Allowed Species and Types from Registry DESCRIPTION: This function queries the Registry to determine which species and database types are available. It checks which combinations are accessible and returns the information structured as lists of allowed species, groups, and types. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_node_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub registry_species_and_types { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $reg = 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Registry'; my $adaptors = $reg->get_all_available(); my %species_hash; my %types_hash; foreach my $dba_list (values %{$adaptors}) { foreach my $dba (values %{$dba_list}) { $species_hash{lc($dba->species)} = 1; $types_hash{lc($dba->group)} = 1; } } # get the values sorted and ready for return my @allowed_species = sort keys %species_hash; my @allowed_types = sort keys %types_hash; # if a DBAdaptor method exists, it needs to be exposed as an allowed group my %allowed_groups = map { $_ => 1 } qw/dna sequence archive core regulation gene transcript variation/; my @allowed_groups = keys %allowed_groups; return (\@allowed_species, \@allowed_groups, \@allowed_types); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching homologues for a gene with Python DESCRIPTION: This Python code demonstrates how to fetch homologues for a specific gene from the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the homology/id endpoint to retrieve homology information for ENSG00000157764. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?format=condensed;type=orthologues" r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() printable = r.json() print(printable) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Exception Package for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines the EnsEMBL::REST::Exception Perl package which extends Bio::EnsEMBL::Utils::Exception to handle REST-specific error conditions. The module sets up package variables for exception classes and exports exception-related functions. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/mapping_session.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` =head1 LICENSE Copyright [1999-2015] Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute and the EMBL-European Bioinformatics Institute Copyright [2016-2023] EMBL-European Bioinformatics Institute Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. =cut package EnsEMBL::REST::Exception; use strict; use warnings; use parent qw/Bio::EnsEMBL::Utils::Exception/; our @EXPORT; our @EXPORT_OK; our %EXPORT_TAGS; Init(); sub throw_REST_exception { my $c = shift; my $ex = shift; my $message = shift; my $verbose = shift || 0; $c->log->info($ex->stack_trace()->as_string()) if $verbose; $c->log->error($message); $c->go('ReturnError', $ex->status, [{ msg => $message}]); $c->detach(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Caching for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up caching for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the cache implementation, expiration time, and cache size for various API endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/karyotype.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` $c->config->{Model::Documentation} = { cache_implementation => 'CHI', cache_expires => '1 day', cache_chi => { driver => 'Memory', global => 1, max_size => 100*1024*1024 } }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching region features with Perl DESCRIPTION: This Perl code demonstrates how to fetch region features from the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the overlap/region endpoint to retrieve all features in a specified genomic region on human chromosome 7. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;feature=transcript;feature=cds;feature=exon'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' } }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $response->{content}; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Starman Servers for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Bash script that starts multiple instances of Starman server to serve the Ensembl REST API application. It specifies worker count, port assignments, and process management with background execution. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_root.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/bash cd /ensembl/ensembl-rest source ~/perl5/perlbrew/etc/bashrc starman -I lib -I ../ensembl/modules -I ../ensembl-compara/modules -I ../ensembl-variation/modules -I ../ensembl-funcgen/modules -I ../ensembl-io/modules -I ../ensembl-vep/modules --workers 10 --pid ensrest.starman.pid --access-log logs/access.log --error-log logs/error.log --listen :5000 configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi & starman -I lib -I ../ensembl/modules -I ../ensembl-compara/modules -I ../ensembl-variation/modules -I ../ensembl-funcgen/modules -I ../ensembl-io/modules -I ../ensembl-vep/modules --workers 10 --pid ensrest.starman.5001.pid --access-log logs/access.5001.log --error-log logs/error.5001.log --listen :5001 configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi & starman -I lib -I ../ensembl/modules -I ../ensembl-compara/modules -I ../ensembl-variation/modules -I ../ensembl-funcgen/modules -I ../ensembl-io/modules -I ../ensembl-vep/modules --workers 10 --pid ensrest.starman.5002.pid --access-log logs/access.5002.log --error-log logs/error.5002.log --listen :5002 configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi & starman -I lib -I ../ensembl/modules -I ../ensembl-compara/modules -I ../ensembl-variation/modules -I ../ensembl-funcgen/modules -I ../ensembl-io/modules -I ../ensembl-vep/modules --workers 10 --pid ensrest.starman.5003.pid --access-log logs/access.5003.log --error-log logs/error.5003.log --listen :5003 configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi & ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Transcript Object Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: Implements a handler for retrieving the actual transcript object from the database. This method populates the transcript data based on the ID provided in the request path. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub transcript : Chained('/') PathPart('transcript') CaptureArgs(1) { my ( $self, $c, $id ) = @_; $c->stash->{transcript_id} = $id; $c->log->debug('Retrieving transcript from database'); my $transcript = try { $c->model('Lookup')->find_transcript_by_stable_id($id); } catch { $c->log->error("Failed to search for transcript $id: $_"); $c->go('ReturnError', 'from_ensembl', ["Given ID does not exist in our system: $id"]); }; my $params = $c->req->params; my $expand_3prime = $params->{expand_3prime_utr}; my $expand_5prime = $params->{expand_5prime_utr}; my $no_seq = $params->{no_seq}; $c->stash(transcript => $transcript, expand_3prime => $expand_3prime, expand_5prime => $expand_5prime, no_seq => $no_seq); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Sequence Operations in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This script tests various sequence-related operations using the Ensembl REST API. It includes tests for retrieving genomic sequences and performing sequence manipulations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use Test::More; use Test::Differences; use Test::Deep; use JSON; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::TestUtils; my $dba = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('homo_sapiens'); my $multi = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('multi'); my $json = JSON->new->allow_nonref; my $base = '/sequence/region/homo_sapiens'; # Test basic sequence retrieval my $region = '6:1000000..1000100'; { my $seq = json_GET("$base/$region", 'Get genomic sequence'); ok($seq->{seq}, 'Sequence is present'); is(length($seq->{seq}), 101, 'Sequence length is correct'); } # Test reverse complement my $region = '6:1000000..1000100'; { my $seq = json_GET("$base/$region?strand=-1", 'Get reverse complement sequence'); ok($seq->{seq}, 'Sequence is present'); is(length($seq->{seq}), 101, 'Sequence length is correct'); isnt($seq->{seq}, json_GET("$base/$region")->{seq}, 'Reverse complement is different from original'); } # Test masked sequence my $region = '6:1000000..1000100'; { my $seq = json_GET("$base/$region?mask=soft", 'Get masked sequence'); ok($seq->{seq}, 'Sequence is present'); is(length($seq->{seq}), 101, 'Sequence length is correct'); like($seq->{seq}, qr/[a-z]/, 'Sequence contains lowercase (masked) bases'); } # Test multiple regions my $regions = '6:1000000..1000100,6:2000000..2000100'; { my $seqs = json_GET("$base?region=$regions", 'Get multiple sequences'); is(scalar @$seqs, 2, 'Two sequences returned'); for my $seq (@$seqs) { ok($seq->{seq}, 'Sequence is present'); is(length($seq->{seq}), 101, 'Sequence length is correct'); } } done_testing(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Experiment Objects to Hash Structure in Ensembl REST API Perl DESCRIPTION: Helper method that converts experiment objects to hash structures for API responses. Maps various properties from the experiment object to a structured hash format, including metadata like source, type, experimental factors, and associated data files. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub experiment_to_hash { my ($self, $c, $experiment, $source) = @_; my $result = { source => $source, id => $experiment->dbID, accession => $experiment->accession, secondary_accession => $experiment->secondary_accession, display_label => $experiment->display_label, description => $experiment->description, archive => $experiment->archive, experiment_type => $experiment->experiment_type, epigenome => $experiment->epigenome, project => $experiment->project, feature_type => $experiment->feature_type, }; # add experimental group if defined if ($experiment->experimental_group) { $result->{experimental_group} = $experiment->experimental_group; } # add pubmed ID if defined if ($experiment->pubmed_id) { $result->{pubmed_id} = $experiment->pubmed_id; } # add experimental factor if defined my $ef = $experiment->experimental_factor; if ($ef) { $result->{experimental_factor} = { name => $ef->name, value => $ef->value, }; } # add result file count if any my @result_files = @{$experiment->get_ResultFiles()}; if (@result_files) { $result->{result_files} = scalar @result_files; } return $result; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the host, port, and user for different database types including core, variation, and funcgen. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', verbose => 0, # The lines below are needed if you want to access the otherfeatures, variation, or funcgen databases 'DATABASE_CORE' => [ { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', db_version => 103 }, ], 'DATABASE_VARIATION' => [ { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', db_version => 103 }, ], 'DATABASE_FUNCGEN' => [ { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', db_version => 103 }, ], ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Swagger API Documentation for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the configuration for Swagger API documentation in the Ensembl REST API project. It includes API information, external documentation links, and security schemes. The configuration is set up as a Perl hash structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/unmapped_reason.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { info => { version => '7', title => 'Ensembl REST API', description => 'Access Ensembl data using REST URLs', contact => { name => 'Ensembl', email => 'helpdesk@ensembl.org', url => 'http://www.ensembl.org' }, license => { name => 'Apache 2.0', url => 'http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html' }, 'x-logo' => { url => 'https://ensembl.org/i/e-ensembl.png' } }, externalDocs => { description => 'GitHub Wiki', url => 'https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki' }, security => [ { APIKey => [] } ], securityDefinitions => { APIKey => { type => 'apiKey', in => 'header', name => 'api_key', description => 'Obtain an API key from https://www.ensembl.org/account/user/login.' } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Ensembl REST API Client in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to import the Ensembl REST API client in Python. It also sets up a client instance for making API requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` from ensembl_rest import EnsemblRestClient client = EnsemblRestClient() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Ensembl Variation Data in XML Format DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to request variation data from the Ensembl REST API using curl. The request targets a specific human variant (rs116035550) and specifies XML as the output format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/mapping_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:text/xml" 'http://rest.ensembl.org/variation/human/rs116035550' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server Settings in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server, including plugin loading, authentication settings, and rate limiting. It sets up the server name, plugins to be used, and various server-specific options. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/density_type.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using => ['Catalyst::Plugin::ConfigLoader', 'Catalyst::Plugin::Static::Simple', 'Catalyst::Plugin::Cache', 'Catalyst::Plugin::Gzip', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Role::PostLimiter', ], authentication => { default_realm => 'user', realms => { user => { credential => { class => 'Password', password_field => 'password', password_type => 'clear' }, store => { class => 'DBIx::Class', user_model => 'DB::User', } } } }, # Enable CORS (javascript must be able to bring back content from other domains) 'Plugin::CrossOriginResource' => { # allow all origins origins => '*', # allow only GET, POST, OPTIONS methods methods => ['GET', 'POST', 'OPTIONS'], # allow content_type and x-requested-with headers headers => ['content-type', 'x-requested-with'], # cache preflight request for 604800 seconds max_age => '604800', }, # Set limit based on time=3600 (1 hour), unit=900 (15 minutes), or no. page views. # default time limit can be overriden in the Rate_limit plugin definition below # use page to limit by no. of page views default_view => 'HTML', disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1, 'default_time_limit' => '3600', 'enable_rate_limit' => 1, 'enable_schema_cache' => 1, 'log4perl_config' => 'log4perl.conf', 'Model::Registry' => { use_ftp => 1 }, 'View::JSON' => { expose_stash => 'json' }, 'Controller::Root' => { # Set the actions in this controller to be registered with no prefix # so they function identically to actions created in MyApp.pm namespace => '' }, 'root_documentation' => 'documentation/info.tt', 'wrapper' => 'wrapper.tt', 'species_common' => {} } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Transcript Lookup Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines an endpoint for looking up transcript information. This handles requests to find transcripts based on various attributes and parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Single Experiment Retrieval Endpoint in Ensembl REST API Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines an endpoint to fetch a specific experiment by ID. This method validates input parameters, searches multiple adaptors for the requested experiment, and returns detailed experiment information. It handles error cases for non-existent experiments. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub experiment_id : Chained('experiment') PathPart('') ActionClass('REST') Args(1) { } sub experiment_id_GET { my ( $self, $c, $id ) = @_; # empty id is not allowed if (!$id) { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{experiment id must be specified}]); } my $result; for my $adaptor (@{$self->experiment_adaptors($c)}) { my $experiment = $adaptor->fetch_by_accession($id); # try to fetch by dbID in case accession did not work if (!$experiment && $id =~ /^\d+$/) { $experiment = $adaptor->fetch_by_dbID($id); } if ($experiment) { $result = $self->experiment_to_hash($c, $experiment, $adaptor->db->species); last; } } if ($result) { $self->status_ok($c, entity => $result); } else { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{experiment $id not found}]); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Making HTTP POST Request to Ensembl API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This function performs an HTTP POST request to the Ensembl API. It constructs the URL, sets up headers, and encodes the data as JSON before sending. It also handles the response and decodes the JSON content. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub post { my ($self, $path, $params, $data) = @_; my $url = $self->_url($path, $params); my $response = $self->http_post($url, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json', %{$self->extra_headers}, }, content => $self->json->encode($data) } ); my $content; if (exists $response->{content}) { $content = $response->{content}; } else { $content = $response->content; } return $self->json->decode($content); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Python requests library with proxy configuration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to configure the Python requests library to use the EBI proxy server. This example shows both the dictionary-based configuration and the environment variable approach. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/assembly_exception.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env python import requests # Either configure the proxy in your request proxies = { 'http': 'http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128', 'https': 'http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128' } r = requests.get('http://rest.ensembl.org/info/ping', headers={ 'Content-Type' : 'application/json'}, proxies=proxies) # Or set the environment variables HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY import os os.environ['HTTP_PROXY'] = 'http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128' os.environ['HTTPS_PROXY'] = 'http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128' r = requests.get('http://rest.ensembl.org/info/ping', headers={ 'Content-Type' : 'application/json'}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API using LWP in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the LWP library in Perl to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API. It retrieves information about the human BRCA2 gene and prints the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use LWP::UserAgent; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new; my $server = 'http://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/lookup/symbol/homo_sapiens/BRCA2?'; my $response = $ua->get($server.$ext, 'Content-Type' => 'application/json'); die "Failed!", $response->status_line unless $response->is_success; print $response->content; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Gene ID Endpoint in Perl for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a REST API endpoint for retrieving gene information by ID. It specifies the route, HTTP method, and includes documentation for the endpoint. The endpoint supports parameters for customizing the gene data retrieval and handles different types of gene identifiers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/misc_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub id_GET {\n my $c = shift;\n my $id = $c->stash()->{id};\n my $eg_dbname = $c->stash()->{eg_dbname};\n my $object = $c->stash()->{object};\n my $type = $c->request->param('type');\n my $fields = $c->request->param('fields');\n my $expand = $c->request->param('expand');\n #...\n} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Gene Information DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API to retrieve information about a specific gene. It uses the 'lookup' endpoint with the gene ID 'ENSG00000157764' and specifies JSON as the response format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_transcript_pair.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` GET /lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Genomic Features by Region in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Example URL for retrieving genomic features from a specific region of human chromosome 7 using Ensembl REST API. The query targets the GRCh37 assembly and filters for features on the positive strand with expansion of 500bp. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/homology_member.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` http://grch37.rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;feature=transcript;feature=exon;feature=variation;strand=1;expand=1;biotype=protein_coding;so_term=SO:0001650;logic_name=havana_homo_sapiens;variant_set=ph_variants;content-type=application/json;db_type=core ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Serializer Function in Perl for REST API DESCRIPTION: Function that selects the appropriate serialization format based on the content type. It takes a serializer object, content type, and optional type parameter, and returns the right serialization method to convert data to the requested format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unconventional_transcript_association.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_serialiser { my ($class, $serialiser, $content_type, $type) = @_; $content_type = $class->map_content_type($content_type); return sub { my (@args) = @_; if($content_type eq 'json') { return $serialiser->json(@args); } if($content_type eq 'xml') { return $serialiser->xml(@args); } if($content_type eq 'yaml') { return $serialiser->yaml(@args); } if($content_type eq 'seqxml') { return $serialiser->seqxml(@args); } if($content_type eq 'orthoxml') { return $serialiser->orthoxml(@args); } if($content_type eq 'phyloxml') { return $serialiser->phyloxml(@args); } if($content_type eq 'nh') { return $serialiser->newick(@args); } if($content_type eq 'fasta') { return $serialiser->fasta(@args); } if($content_type eq 'gff3') { return $serialiser->gff3(@args); } if($content_type eq 'bed') { return $serialiser->bed(@args); } if(defined $type) { my $method = lc($type); if( $serialiser->can($method) ) { return $serialiser->$method(@args); } } return $serialiser->text(@args); }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Plugin Directories for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to specify additional plugin directories for the Ensembl REST API. It enables loading plugins from custom locations outside the standard plugin directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` Plugin: # List of directories containg Plugin modules. Perl's path resolution will be # used to locate the directory. directories: - EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the type of databases to connect to and the parameters for each connection. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/translation_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub connection_details { return { compara => { TYPE => 'Compara' }, otherfeatures => { TYPE => 'Core', SPECIES => 'multi' }, variation => { TYPE => 'Variation' }, funcgen => { TYPE => 'Funcgen' }, rnaseq => { TYPE => 'Core', SPECIES => 'multi' } }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Ensembl REST API Caching Configuration in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the caching mechanism for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the cache implementation, storage details, and expiration times for different types of data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/misc_feature_misc_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` #Default default_expires_in 60 #Memcached class CHI driver Memcached namespace RestEnsembl servers localhost:11211 debug 0 #Explicit Expiry Settings getVEP 3600 getBulkVEP 3600 getVariation 1800 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Variation Information Retrieval in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This script tests the retrieval of variation information using the Ensembl REST API. It checks for the presence of specific fields in the response and validates the content type. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use Test::More; use Test::Differences; use Test::Deep; use JSON; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::TestUtils; my $dba = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('homo_sapiens'); my $multi = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('multi'); my $json = JSON->new->allow_nonref; my $base = '/variation/homo_sapiens'; # Test basic variation my $id = 'rs142276873'; { my $get_args = { action => $base, id => $id, }; my $json_output = json_GET($base.'/'.$id, 'Basic variation info'); my $variation = $json->decode($json_output); cmp_ok(scalar(@{$variation->{mappings}}), '==', 3, 'Mapping check'); my @alleles = sort @{$variation->{alleles}}; cmp_ok(scalar @alleles, '==', 2, 'Allele count'); my $expected_alleles = [qw/A G/]; is_deeply([sort @{$variation->{alleles}}], $expected_alleles, 'Allele check'); ok($variation->{MAF}, 'MAF'); cmp_ok($variation->{MAF}, '==', 0.0014, 'MAF check'); } # Test genotype my $id = 'rs67521280'; { my $get_args = { action => $base, id => $id, genotypes => 1, }; my $json_output = json_GET($base.'/'.$id.'?genotypes=1', 'Genotype data'); my $variation = $json->decode($json_output); ok($variation->{genotypes}, 'Genotypes present'); cmp_ok(scalar @{$variation->{genotypes}}, '==', 3, 'Genotype count'); my $expected_genotype = { individual => "NA18637", genotype => ["C", "C"] }; is_deeply($variation->{genotypes}->[0], $expected_genotype, 'Genotype check'); } # Test population_genotypes my $id = 'rs67521280'; { my $get_args = { action => $base, id => $id, population_genotypes => 1, }; my $json_output = json_GET($base.'/'.$id.'?population_genotypes=1', 'Population genotype data'); my $variation = $json->decode($json_output); ok($variation->{population_genotypes}, 'Population genotypes present'); cmp_ok(scalar @{$variation->{population_genotypes}}, '==', 3, 'Population genotype count'); my $expected_pop_genotype = { population => "1000GENOMES:phase_1_ASW", genotypes => { "C|C" => 0.4666666666666667, "C|T" => 0.4666666666666667, "T|T" => 0.06666666666666667 } }; is_deeply($variation->{population_genotypes}->[0], $expected_pop_genotype, 'Population genotype check'); } done_testing(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Making Ensembl REST API Requests Using Perl Client DESCRIPTION: Example of using Perl's REST::Client to query the Ensembl REST API endpoint. This snippet shows how to set up the client, make a GET request to fetch region information, and process the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/associated_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use REST::Client; use JSON; my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=gene;feature=transcript;feature=cds;feature=exon'; my $client = REST::Client->new(); $client->GET($server.$ext, { 'Content-Type' => 'application/json' }); die $client->responseContent() if $client->responseCode() != 200; my $decoded = decode_json($client->responseContent()); print Dumper($decoded); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining REST Endpoint for Feature Retrieval in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a REST endpoint for retrieving feature information. It specifies the HTTP method, route, and documentation for the endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/unmapped_reason.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` get '/feature/:id' => sub { my $c = shift; my $id = $c->param('id'); # Implementation details }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing assembly region endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/info/assembly/:species/:region' endpoint of the Ensembl REST API. It ensures the endpoint returns the correct information for a specific genomic region including coordinate systems. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { my $species = 'homo_sapiens'; my $region = '6:1000000..2000000'; my $assembly_json = RestHelper->get_json("info/assembly/$species/$region"); is($assembly_json->{id}, $region, "Region in response"); is_deeply($assembly_json->{coord_system}, {name => 'chromosome', version => 'GRCh37'}, 'Checking coordinate system'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Image Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Dockerfile instructions to build a container image for the Ensembl REST API, based on the ensemblorg/ensembl-vep-web image and setting up the necessary environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: dockerfile CODE: ``` FROM ensemblorg/ensembl-vep-web:release-102.0 COPY . /opt/ensembl-rest/ WORKDIR /opt/ensembl-rest RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get -y install libdbi-perl libcgi-pm-perl && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* && cpanm --installdeps . && cpanm Starman ENV ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensrest.conf ENV ENSEMBL_REST_PORT=3000 EXPOSE 3000 CMD starman --listen :${ENSEMBL_REST_PORT} --workers 10 ensembl_rest.psgi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Production Environment in Perl DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet defines production settings for the Ensembl REST API server, including connection parameters, compression settings, authentication methods, and deployment options. It specifies how the application should handle requests, manage resources, and secure connections in a production environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using_frontend_proxy => 1, user => 'ensembl', group => 'ensembl', user_home => '/nfs/ensembl/ensembl-rest', # The majority of these inputs are assumed to be from internal sources # and that we're not aiming to be excessively paranoid. max_request_size => 50_000_000, pid_locking => 1, admin_email => 'dev-team@example.org', admin_email_regexps => '(admin|error)s', session_expires => 3600, # 1hr # You can increase workers here if needed but check in with sysops first # if setting this on production servers workers => 10, # Can we gzip output? This adds CPU load enable_compression => 1, # Init script allows us to set the following variables # init_config => { # port => '5000', # starman_config => 'prod', # }, starman_config => { prod => { preload_app => 1, daemonize => 1, pid_file => 'ensrest.pid', }, }, # Authentication auth => { auth_codes => { dev => { key => 'ensembl_dev', name => 'dev', }, }, # Default auth code default_auth_code => 'dev', # Default expiry time in days token_expiry => 30, # Disable the ticket system entirely disable_tickets => 0, # Set to 1 to prevent multiple tickets per user disable_multiple_tickets => 0, }, # Content Deployment content => { # Create URLs to the right tools in such a way to minimise the need to create plugin objects # e.g.: http://www.ensembl.org/Homo_sapiens/Location/View?r=1:1-1000 # e.g.: http://grch37.ensembl.org/Homo_sapiens/Variation/Explore?v=rs123 # e.g.: http://fungi.ensembl.org/Saccharomyces_cerevisiae/Gene/Summary?g=YBR040W # e.g.: http://bacteria.ensembl.org/Escherichia_coli_str_k_12_substr_mg1655/Gene/Summary?g=b2001 # Override default deployments deployments => { prod => 'http://www.ensembl.org', grch37 => 'http://grch37.ensembl.org', # These need to be real URLs in the future plants => 'http://plants.ensembl.org', fungi => 'http://fungi.ensembl.org', bacteria => 'http://bacteria.ensembl.org', protists => 'http://protists.ensembl.org', metazoa => 'http://metazoa.ensembl.org', # Others vep => 'http://www.ensembl.org/Homo_sapiens', pre => 'http://pre.ensembl.org', }, }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying VEP with LWP::UserAgent in Perl DESCRIPTION: Example of using LWP::UserAgent in Perl to send a GET request to the Variant Effect Predictor REST API. Shows how to configure the request headers and process the response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use LWP::UserAgent; use JSON; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/vep/human/hgvs/ENST00000494142:c.48C>A?'; my $response = $ua->get($server.$ext, 'Content-type' => 'application/json'); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->is_success; if(length $response->decoded_content) { my $hash = decode_json($response->decoded_content); print $hash->[0]{most_severe_consequence}, "\n"; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Extensions Function for Content-Type Mapping in Perl DESCRIPTION: Function that returns a hash mapping of content types to their corresponding file extensions for the Ensembl REST API. This mapping is used to determine the appropriate serialization format based on the requested content type in HTTP requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unconventional_transcript_association.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_extensions { my ($self) = @_; return { 'application/json' => 'json', 'text/xml' => 'xml', 'application/xml' => 'xml', 'text/x-yaml' => 'yaml', 'text/x-seqxml+xml' => 'seqxml', 'text/x-orthoxml+xml' => 'orthoxml', 'text/x-phyloxml+xml' => 'phyloxml', 'text/x-nh' => 'nh', 'text/x-fasta' => 'fasta', 'text/x-gff3' => 'gff3', 'text/x-bed' => 'bed', }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ensembl REST Server with Starman for Production DESCRIPTION: Command for running the Ensembl REST API in production using Starman, a high-performance web server for Perl applications. This setup uses multiple workers to handle concurrent requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature_misc_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=conf/ensembl_rest.conf starman --listen :3000 --workers 10 bin/app.psgi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Dependencies in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the required dependencies for the Ensembl REST API project. It specifies the Ensembl and EnsEMBL::REST versions, as well as other necessary Perl modules. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` requires 'Catalyst::Runtime' => '5.90040'; requires 'Moose'; requires 'namespace::autoclean'; requires 'Config::General'; requires 'Log::Log4perl'; requires 'Hash::Merge'; requires 'Catalyst::Plugin::ConfigLoader'; requires 'Catalyst::Plugin::Static::Simple'; requires 'Catalyst::Action::RenderView'; # Ensembl stuff requires 'Bio::EnsEMBL::LookUp' => '2.3'; requires 'Ensembl'; requires 'EnsEMBL::REST' => '1.6.1'; requires 'Test::More' => '0.88'; requires 'Test::Differences'; requires 'Test::JSON'; requires 'Test::XML::Simple'; requires 'Test::XPath'; catalyst; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It includes configuration for various Ensembl databases, such as core, variation, and regulation. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { user => $SiteDefs::USER || "ensro", port => $SiteDefs::PORT || 3306, pass => $SiteDefs::PASS || "", host => $SiteDefs::HOST || "ensembldb.ensembl.org", version => $SiteDefs::VERSION || 105, databases => { DATABASE_CORE => { user => undef, port => undef, pass => undef, host => undef, }, DATABASE_VARIATION => { user => undef, port => undef, pass => undef, host => undef, }, DATABASE_FUNCGEN => { user => undef, port => undef, pass => undef, host => undef, }, DATABASE_COMPARA => { user => undef, port => undef, pass => undef, host => undef, }, } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing taxonomy endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/taxonomy/id' endpoint, verifying that it returns the correct taxonomic information for a given ID including scientific name, common name, and classification. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Taxonomy ID endpoint { my $taxon_id = 9606; my $taxonomy_json = RestHelper->get_json("taxonomy/id/$taxon_id"); cmp_ok($taxonomy_json->{id}, '==', $taxon_id, 'ID in the resource as expected'); cmp_ok($taxonomy_json->{scientific_name}, 'eq', 'Homo sapiens', 'Scientific name as expected'); cmp_ok($taxonomy_json->{common_name}, 'eq', 'human', 'Common name as expected'); cmp_ok($taxonomy_json->{scientific_name_authorship}, 'eq', 'Linnaeus, 1758', 'Scientific name authorship as expected'); ok(length($taxonomy_json->{synonyms}) >= 1, 'Synonyms in JSON') if defined $taxonomy_json->{synonyms}; ok(exists $taxonomy_json->{parent}, 'Parent exists in response') if defined $taxonomy_json->{parent}; ok(exists $taxonomy_json->{children}, 'Children exists in response') if defined $taxonomy_json->{children}; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring LWP Timeout for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the LWP timeout for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the timeout in seconds for HTTP requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # LWP timeout lwp_timeout => 15, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring URL Pattern Matching for Ensembl REST API Endpoints DESCRIPTION: Defines URL patterns for various Ensembl REST API endpoints, mapping them to specific controller actions. This configuration determines how incoming requests are routed to the appropriate handlers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/exon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` __PACKAGE__->config( 'Plugin::URLMap' => { '.well-known' => { 'Path' => '/well-known', 'Controller' => 'WellKnown', }, 'info' => { 'Path' => '/info', 'Args' => '1', 'Controller' => 'Info', }, 'archive' => { 'Path' => '/archive', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Archive', }, 'sequence' => { 'Path' => '/sequence', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Sequence', }, 'genetree' => { 'Path' => '/genetree', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'GeneTree', }, 'overlap' => { 'Path' => '/overlap', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Overlap', }, 'variation' => { 'Path' => '/variation', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Variation', }, 'vep' => { 'Path' => '/vep', 'Args' => '3', 'Controller' => 'VEP', }, 'ld' => { 'Path' => '/ld', 'Args' => '3', 'Controller' => 'LD', }, 'lookup' => { 'Path' => '/lookup', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Lookup', }, 'analysis' => { 'Path' => '/analysis', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Analysis', }, 'homology' => { 'Path' => '/homology', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Homology', }, 'map' => { 'Path' => '/map', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Map', }, 'ontology' => { 'Path' => '/ontology', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Ontology', }, 'taxonomy' => { 'Path' => '/taxonomy', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Taxonomy', }, 'assembly' => { 'Path' => '/assembly', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Assembly', }, 'biotype' => { 'Path' => '/biotype', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Biotype', }, 'xrefs' => { 'Path' => '/xrefs', 'Args' => '3', 'Controller' => 'Xrefs', }, 'ga4gh' => { 'Path' => '/ga4gh', 'Args' => '3', 'Controller' => 'ga4gh', }, 'cafe' => { 'Path' => '/cafe', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Cafe', }, 'phenotype' => { 'Path' => '/phenotype', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Phenotype', }, 'var' => { 'Path' => '/var', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'Var', }, 'variant_recoder' => { 'Path' => '/variant_recoder', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'VariantRecoder', }, 'linkage_disequilibrium' => { 'Path' => '/linkage_disequilibrium', 'Args' => '2', 'Controller' => 'LDFeatureContainer', }, } ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Base Schema Class for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines the EnsEMBL::REST::Schema package which provides core schema functionality for the Ensembl REST API. It extends Moo and implements JSON field handling and type coercion methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Schema; use Moo; use Types::Standard qw/Str Int ArrayRef HashRef Bool/; use JSON; use Scalar::Util qw/looks_like_number/; use HTTP::Status qw/:constants/; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::TranscriptVariation; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::VariationFeature; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Variation; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Exon; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Transcript; use EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblModel::Gene; use feature qw/switch/; no if $] >= 5.018, warnings => "experimental::smartmatch"; sub validate_ref { my ($self, $data, $field, $type) = @_; #Don't need to check if the field isn't required if(exists $field->{validate_if} && defined $field->{validate_if}) { my $required = $field->{validate_if}; my $value = $data->{ $required->{field} }; if(defined $value) { if( exists $required->{value} ) { unless ($value eq $required->{value}) { return; } } } else { return; } } #Field exists my $key = $field->{name}; if(!exists $data->{$key} && $field->{required}) { die { message => "$key is a required field", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST }; } if(!exists $data->{$key}) { return; } #Check field value against data type my $value = $data->{$key}; my $class = ref($value); if($type eq 'json') { unless( (!$class || $class eq 'ARRAY' || $class eq 'HASH') ) { die { message => "$key needs to be a json string or a HashRef/ArrayRef already", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST }; } } elsif($type eq 'array') { unless($class eq 'ARRAY') { die { message => "$key needs to be an array of values", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'hash') { unless($class eq 'HASH') { die { message => "$key needs to be a hash of values", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'uri') { #Urg; importing things can hurt but I don't want to force deps of HTTP::Request etc. unless(!$class && (substr($value,0,4) eq 'http' || substr($value,0,1) eq '/')) { die { message => "$key needs to be either an absolute URI or a root path", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'boolean') { if($class) { die { message => "$key needs to be a boolean", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'integer') { if($class || ! looks_like_number($value)) { die { message => "$key needs to be an integer", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } if($value != int($value)) { die { message => "$key needs to be an integer", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'string') { if($class) { die { message => "$key needs to be a string", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif(substr($type, 0, 7) eq 'enum::(') { my @enum = eval $type; if($class || !grep { $_ eq $value } @enum) { die { message => "$key must be one of the following: ".join(', ', @enum), code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'enum') { if($class || !grep { $_ eq $value } @{$field->{enum}}) { die { message => "$key must be one of the following: ".join(', ', @{$field->{enum}}), code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'numeric') { if($class || !looks_like_number($value)) { die { message => "$key needs to be a number", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } elsif($type eq 'file') { unless($class eq 'HASH' && exists $value->{tempname}) { die { message => "$key must be a HashRef with a 'tempname' key", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } my $tmp = $value->{tempname}; unless(-f $tmp) { die { message => "Cannot find $tmp. Upload failure?", code => HTTP_BAD_REQUEST}; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing JSONP Callback with Ensembl REST API in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the JSONP callback parameter with the Ensembl REST API. It wraps the JSON response in a JavaScript function call named 'process_data', allowing for cross-domain API usage in web applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?callback=process_data" r = requests.get(server+extension, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.text print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring VEP Runner with Plugin Options in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to configure the VEP Runner with plugin options in the Ensembl REST API. It includes logic for handling plugin parameters and formatting them correctly for the VEP runner configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/karyotype.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub _configure_plugins { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $plugins = $c->request->param('plugins'); return [] if ! $plugins; my @plugin_config; foreach my $plugin_string (split(',', $plugins)) { my $string_copy = $plugin_string; my @split = split('=', $plugin_string); my %config = ( name => $split[0] ); if($split[1]) { my @params = split('&', $split[1]); foreach my $param(@params) { my @param_details = split(':', $param); $config{params}->{$param_details[0]} = $param_details[1]; } } push(@plugin_config, \%config); } return \@plugin_config; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Documenting REST Endpoints with POD in Perl DESCRIPTION: Example of proper documentation for a REST endpoint using POD (Plain Old Documentation) format in Perl. Shows how to document the purpose, parameters, and expected responses of an endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` =head2 /type/id/:id Fetch an entry by its given database identifier =cut ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Get Mime Type Function in Perl for REST API DESCRIPTION: Function that returns the MIME type corresponding to a given serialization format in the Ensembl REST API. It maps extensions like 'json' and 'xml' to their appropriate MIME types to be used in HTTP Content-Type headers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unconventional_transcript_association.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_mime_type { my ($class, $reference) = @_; my $default = $class->default_content_type(); my %mime_types = %{ $class->suffix_to_type() }; return $default unless $reference; return $mime_types{$reference} || $default; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Converting Experiment Result Files to Array in Ensembl REST API Perl DESCRIPTION: Helper method that processes experiment result files and converts them to an array structure. It handles file limits, formats file information including paths and metadata, and organizes files by their relation to the experiment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub result_files_to_array { my ($self, $experiment, $max_files) = @_; # extract all result files my @result_files = @{$experiment->get_ResultFiles()}; my @result; # limit number of files if requested if ($max_files > 0 && @result_files > $max_files) { @result_files = @result_files[0..$max_files-1]; } # convert each result file to a hash entry for my $rf (@result_files) { my $entry = { name => $rf->name, md5sum => $rf->md5sum, dbID => $rf->dbID, file => $rf->file, experiment_id => $experiment->dbID, analysis_method => $rf->analysis_method, }; # add file size if defined if ($rf->size) { $entry->{size} = $rf->size + 0; # ensure numeric format } push @result, $entry; } return @result; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet sets up various configuration options for the Ensembl REST API server, including database connections, caching, and compression settings.
