variation config variation => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the variation endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default variation => 0, }, # variation consequence config variation_consequence => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the variation_consequence endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default variation_consequence => 0, }, # variation recoder config variation_recoder => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the variation_recoder endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default variation_recoder => 0, }, # vcf config vcf => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the vcf endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default vcf => 0, }, # vep config vep => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the vep endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default vep => 0, }, # xrefs config xrefs => { # set this to 1 to enable the use of the xrefs endpoint # this endpoint is currently disabled by default xrefs => 0, }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Documentation and Plugins in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up documentation-related settings and plugin configurations for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the documentation root, enables plugins, and configures CORS settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/splicing_transcript_pair.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Documentation doc_root => '/ensembl/ensembl-rest/root/documentation', # Plugins plugins => [ 'Cache', 'Throttle', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Compara', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Variation', ], # CORS cors => { allow_origin => '*', allow_methods => ['GET', 'POST', 'OPTIONS'], allow_headers => ['Content-Type', 'X-Requested-With'], max_age => 86400, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Highlight.js Implementation in HTML DESCRIPTION: The minimal setup required to implement Highlight.js on a web page, including stylesheet loading, script inclusion, and initialization. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/root/static/js/highlight/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Dockerfile for EnsEMBL REST API DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile sets up the environment for the EnsEMBL REST API. It uses a base image, installs system dependencies, sets up the application directory, installs Perl dependencies, and configures the application for deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Dockerfile CODE: ``` FROM ensemblorg/ensembl-base:5.0 LABEL maintainer="Web Team " # Install system dependencies RUN apt-get update && \ apt-get install -y \ cpanminus \ libdbd-sqlite3-perl \ libcgi-pm-perl \ sqlite3 \ liblwp-protocol-https-perl \ pkg-config && \ rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* # Setup application directory RUN mkdir -p /opt/rest WORKDIR /opt/rest # Install ensembl-rest RUN git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest.git -b release/114 ensembl-rest # Install perl dependencies RUN cpanm --installdeps --with-recommends --notest --cpanfile /opt/rest/ensembl-rest/cpanfile . # Setup ensembl-rest configuration RUN cp /opt/rest/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensembl_rest.conf.default /opt/rest/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensembl_rest.conf # Set env variables ENV ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=/opt/rest/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensembl_rest.conf ENV PERL5LIB=${PERL5LIB}:/opt/rest/ensembl-rest/lib # Expose port EXPOSE 3000 # Start server CMD ["/opt/rest/ensembl-rest/script/ensembl_rest_server.pl"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing All Epigenomes in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Implements an endpoint that returns all available epigenomes from the database. This action is chained to the base epigenomes path and dispatches the list of epigenome objects to the appropriate serializer. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/peptide_archive.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Return a list of all epigenomes sub list_all_GET :Chained('epigenomes') PathPart('') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') {} sub list_all_GET_REST { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $epigenomes = $self->epigenomes_adaptor($c)->fetch_all(); $self->status_ok($c, entity => $epigenomes); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Experiment Result File Retrieval Endpoint in Ensembl REST API Perl DESCRIPTION: Creates an endpoint for retrieving result files associated with an experiment. This method fetches experiment data by ID, validates its existence, and returns information about all related result files including paths and metadata. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub experiment_file : Chained('experiment') PathPart('file') ActionClass('REST') Args(1) { } sub experiment_file_GET { my ( $self, $c, $id ) = @_; # empty id is not allowed if (!$id) { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{experiment id must be specified}]); } my $max_files = $c->request->param('max_files') // 0; if ($max_files !~ /^\d+$/) { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{max_files parameter must be an integer, if specified}]); } my $result; for my $adaptor (@{$self->experiment_adaptors($c)}) { my $experiment = $adaptor->fetch_by_accession($id); # try to fetch by dbID in case accession did not work if (!$experiment && $id =~ /^\d+$/) { $experiment = $adaptor->fetch_by_dbID($id); } if ($experiment) { my @results = $self->result_files_to_array($experiment, $max_files); $result = \@results; last; } } if ($result) { $self->status_ok($c, entity => $result); } else { $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', [qq{experiment $id not found}]); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ensembl REST API with Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST API using Docker Compose, which sets up all necessary services defined in the docker-compose.yml file. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose up ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Documentation Links for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up documentation links for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies URLs for various documentation resources including the REST API documentation and the Ensembl browser. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Documentation docs_url => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/documentation/', rest_api_page => 'https://rest.ensembl.org/', ensembl_url => 'https://www.ensembl.org', ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: OpenAPI Specification for User Account Endpoints in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines the OpenAPI specification for user account endpoints in the Ensembl REST API. It includes paths for retrieving user information, registering new users, updating user details, and managing user groups and group memberships. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/ditag_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` paths: /user/whoami: get: summary: Who am I description: If you are a user of this Ensembl REST API instance, then this function returns some basic information about you. tags: - User account - Current development responses: 200: description: OK content: application/json: examples: whoami: value: |- { "user": "ben", "administrator": 1 } /user/en/register: post: tags: - User account - Current development summary: Register a user in Ensembl description: Registers a user in Ensembl responses: 201: description: Register successful 401: description: Authentication failure; provided credentials rejected 409: description: Conflict; that username is already in use, or that email address is already registered 403: description: Self-registration is disabled; your request has been forwarded to an administrator /user/en/$USER/by_username: get: summary: Retrieve a user's details description: Retrieves a user's details by username parameters: - name: USER in: path required: true description: The username of the user you want information about schema: type: string tags: - User account - Current development responses: 200: description: OK content: application/json: examples: user_details: value: |- { "user_id": "7", "username": "ben", "email": "bs@example.org" } /user/en/change_details: post: tags: - User account - Current development summary: Change user details. description: Changes various user details. Must be authenticated. responses: 201: description: Updated OK 401: description: Authentication failure; provided credentials rejected /user/en/groups: get: summary: List user groups description: Lists user groups tags: - User account - Current development responses: 200: description: OK content: application/json: examples: groups: value: |- ["Ensembl 106 users", "Ensembl 107 users"] /user/en/groups/$GROUP: get: summary: List group members description: Lists the members of a user group parameters: - name: GROUP in: path required: true description: The name of the user group you want information about schema: type: string tags: - User account - Current development responses: 200: description: OK content: application/json: examples: members: value: |- ["ben","andy"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Species Aliases in Ensembl REST API (Perl) DESCRIPTION: This function checks if a given species name is an alias and returns the correct species name. It uses a predefined hash of aliases to map alternative names to their correct counterparts. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub _alias_species { my ($self, $species) = @_; my $aliases = $self->aliases; return $aliases->{$species} if exists $aliases->{$species}; return $species; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Variant Phenotype Associations DESCRIPTION: Example URL for requesting phenotype data associated with the variant rs2299222. The query demonstrates the structure of the API endpoint for variant phenotype associations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` https://rest.ensembl.org/variation/homo_sapiens/rs2299222/phenotypes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server, including database connections, caching settings, and logging options. It sets up the necessary parameters for connecting to Ensembl databases and configuring the server's behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/dependent_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', default_view => 'JSON', # User Agent to be used for requests to the plant's ensembl plant_user_agent => 'EnsemblREST', controller_class => 'EnsEMBL::REST::Controller', species => [], # Debug configs enable_jsonp => 1, log_level => 'info', log_dir => '/ensembl/logs', jsonp_callback_param => 'callback', # Middleware configs # ...x-xss-protection header must be set to 0 or it plays havoc with GET requests containing %26 (as used # in gene symbol search) 'Plugin::Plack::Builder' => { '\$app' => { 'enable "XSS"', 'header_field "x-xss-protection"', 'value "0"' } }, # Compress configs 'View::JSON' => { encode_json => 0, }, 'View::GFF3' => { sub_Type => 'gff3', content_type => 'text/plain', }, 'Plugin::Cache' => { backend => { class => 'Cache::Memcached::libmemcached', servers => ['localhost:11211'], debug => 0, compress_threshold => 10_000, }, set_http_header => 1, expires => 6*3600, #6hr default }, 'Model::Registry' => { # Disable multi-db mode if you have only 1 database for all species # and the registry files will discover them # use_multidb => 0, # Remove all species or add them all species => [], # Uncomment to enable indexing of Vega as well as Ensembl databases # Use vdba to create this connection # vega => { # user => 'username', # host => 'server.where.vega.lives.com', # port => 3306, # pass => 'password', # }, # The key for this hash must match the final portion of the URLs you wish to use compara => { vertebrates => { user => 'username', host => 'server.where.vertebrates.compara.lives.com', port => 3306, pass => 'password', }, plants => { user => 'username', host => 'server.where.plants.compara.lives.com', port => 3306, pass => 'password', }, pan_homology => { user => 'username', host => 'server.where.pan.homology.compara.lives.com', port => 3306, pass => 'password', }, } }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Caching for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the caching settings for the Ensembl REST API. It sets up memory-based caching with a maximum size and expiration time. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub cache { my ($self) = @_; return { default => { class => 'CHI', driver => 'Memory', driver_config => { global => 1, max_size => 1000000, }, expires_in => '1 day', } }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Variant Information with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to retrieve variant information using the Ensembl REST API. It demonstrates a request to get details about a specific variant in the human genome. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /variation/human/rs56116432 HTTP/1.1 Host: rest.ensembl.org Content-Type: application/json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Subclasses with Moose in Perl DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to create a Moose subclass of REST::Controller using the 'extends' directive and declaring a 'registry' attribute. This demonstrates proper class inheritance structure for REST controllers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package Namespace::Controller::Type; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'REST::Controller'; has 'registry' => ( is => 'ro', isa => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Registry', ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing genome division filtering in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the division filtering functionality of the '/info/genomes/division' endpoint in the Ensembl REST API. It ensures the endpoint correctly filters genomes based on the specified division parameter. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { my $division = 'ensembl'; my $division_json = RestHelper->get_json("$base/division/$division"); my ($genome) = grep { $_->{name} eq 'homo_sapiens'} @{$division_json}; ok($genome, "Asserting division filtering works"); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Authentication for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to set up authentication for the Ensembl REST API. It includes configuration for enabling authentication, setting up lookup services, and defining allowed domains for CORS. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Authentication configuration Authentication: # Set to 1 to explicitly enable (or explicitly disable) the X-Auth-Token header use_auth_header: ~ # Configure the key lookup service # Enable support for authentication enable: 0 #If we want data to be served as JSON disable the redirect to the ID disable_auth_on_jsonp: 0 #If looking for users they can be found here cache_user_details: 1 user_details_ttl: 86400 # 24 hour cache user_details_lookup_class: "EnsEMBL::REST::User" user_details_lookup_method: "find_user" # Allow CORS access to all domains allow_all_domains: ~ # Used to specify the domains we will allow requests to come from allowed_domains: [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Moose Class for Ensembl REST API Controller in Perl DESCRIPTION: Finalizes the Moose class definition for the experiment controller. This is a standard Moose pattern that ensures proper class initialization and cleanup, and completes the class definition for the REST API controller. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/data_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Tests in Ensembl REST API Docker Environment DESCRIPTION: Command to execute tests within the Docker container for the Ensembl REST API. This runs the test suite to verify the functionality of the API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose run --rm app prove -l ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API server in development mode DESCRIPTION: Command to launch the Ensembl REST API server in development mode using the script/ensembl_rest_server.pl script. This runs the server with debugging enabled for development purposes. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ensembl-rest script/ensembl_rest_server.pl -D ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing GET Method in REST Controller with Perl DESCRIPTION: Example implementing a GET method for a REST endpoint. Shows proper parameter handling, error checking, and response formatting according to the Ensembl REST API standards. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub id_GET { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; # Implementation here } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the host, port, and user for accessing the Ensembl databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` name = Ensembl REST API ensembl_rest = 1 host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 5306 user = anonymous version = 108 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apache Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Apache server configuration directives for the Ensembl REST API, including virtual host setup, URL rewriting rules, logging configuration, and proxy settings to forward requests to the backend Starman server. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_root.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: apache CODE: ``` ServerAdmin webmaster@rest.ensembl.org ServerName rest.ensembl.org ServerAlias beta-rest.ensembl.org # Required for PSGI use Plack::Handler::Apache2; Plack::Handler::Apache2->preload("/ensembl/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi"); SetHandler perl-script PerlResponseHandler Plack::Handler::Apache2 PerlSetVar psgi_app /ensembl/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/psgi_ensrest.psgi ErrorLog logs/rest.ensembl.org_error.log CustomLog logs/rest.ensembl.org_access.log combined ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections and Settings in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API, including database connections, API version, and content type settings. It specifies the databases to connect to, sets the API version, and defines content types for different data formats. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', default_view => 'HTML', # API api_version => 1, api_subprefix => 'api', service_name => 'Ensembl REST API', species_url => 'http://www.ensembl.org/info/about/species.html', jsonp => { callback_param => 'callback', callback_regexp => '^[\w\.]+$', }, # Documentation (pod2html) license_text => '
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License', # Order these in reverse preference content_type_pref => [qw/json xml stark sereal msgpack/], # Enable CORS 'Plugin::CrossOrigin' => { allow_origin => '*' }, # Response compressor 'Plack::Middleware::Deflater' => { #content_type => [qw/text/html text/plain text/javascript text/css application/javascript application/json/], #memory_level => 5, }, # Enable staticly hosted documentation 'Plugin::Static::Simple' => { include_path => ['root'], dirs => ['static'], }, # Configure/override messenging 'Model::Documentation' => { paths => [qw/root/documentation/], index => 'index.md', }, # These are the core databases default_dbs => [qw/ core otherfeatures presite variation compara funcgen /], # Found in Ensembl Genomes eg_dbs => [qw/ core otherfeatures presite variation funcgen compara /], meta_dbs => [qw/ core /], # Allowed characters for the simple_features parameters simple_features_valid_chars => [qw/a c g t n/i], # Controller/Model configuration controller_conf => { 'TestExternalDb' => { databases => [qw/test_external_db/], }, }, model_conf => { 'GenomicFeatures' => { allowed_feature_types => [qw/gene transcript exon intron/], } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Compression for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the compression options for the Ensembl REST API responses. It enables gzip compression for specific content types. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub compress { return { enabled => 1, types => [ 'text/plain', 'text/html', 'text/xml', 'application/json', 'application/xml', ] }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API Server with Starman DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST API server using the Starman web server, specifying the port, the PSGI file to execute, and the number of workers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ensembl-rest starman -l :$ENSEMBL_REST_PORT ensembl_rest.psgi --workers 10 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ensembl REST API Dependencies on Ubuntu/Debian DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the required system packages on Ubuntu/Debian-based systems before setting up the Ensembl REST API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install git cpanminus npm nodejs libpng-dev libgd-dev libssl-dev libdb-dev sudo npm install -g coffee-script nodemon ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing version loading in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Tests that the Ensembl REST API properly loads version information from configuration. It checks whether the version information can be successfully loaded from the configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/dnafrag_region.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub test_version : Test(5) { my ($self) = @_; my $cfg = $self->app_config(); my $version = $cfg->{service_version}; ok(defined $version, 'Version is defined'); note("Version is $version"); cmp_ok($version, '>', 0, 'Version is greater than 0'); my $major_version = $cfg->{service_major_version}; ok(defined $major_version, 'Major version is defined'); note("Major version is $major_version"); my $minor_version = $cfg->{service_minor_version}; ok(defined $minor_version, 'Minor version is defined'); note("Minor version is $minor_version"); my $expected_version = $major_version . '.' . $minor_version; is($version, $expected_version, 'Major and minor add up to main version'); return; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Assembly Information in Ensembl REST API (Perl) DESCRIPTION: This function retrieves the assembly information for a given species. It uses the Ensembl API to access the species' meta container and fetch the assembly version. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub _assembly { my ($self, $species) = @_; my $dba = $self->_get_DBAdaptor($species); return $dba->get_MetaContainer()->single_value_by_key('assembly.default'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing taxonomy ancestors endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/taxonomy/ancestors' endpoint which returns taxonomic ancestors for a given ID. It verifies that important taxonomic ranks like Mammalia and Chordata are included in the result. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Taxonomy ancestors endpoint { my $taxon_id = 9606; my $taxonomy_json = RestHelper->get_json("taxonomy/ancestors/$taxon_id"); cmp_ok(scalar(@{$taxonomy_json}), '>', 20, 'Got back at least 20 ancestors'); ok((grep { $_->{id} == 9605 } @{$taxonomy_json}), 'Expected taxon id found'); ok((grep { $_->{id} == 1 } @{$taxonomy_json}), 'Root taxon id found'); my @scinames = map { $_->{scientific_name} } @{$taxonomy_json}; ok((grep { $_ eq 'Homo' } @scinames), 'Homo genus found'); ok((grep { $_ eq 'Mammalia' } @scinames), 'Mammalian class found'); ok((grep { $_ eq 'Chordata' } @scinames), 'Chordata phylum found'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ensembl REST API via git clone DESCRIPTION: Command for cloning the Ensembl REST API repository from GitHub, which is the first step in setting up the API for local use. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/gene_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Coordinate Systems for Ensembl REST API (TSV) DESCRIPTION: This TSV (Tab-Separated Values) data defines three coordinate systems: contig, scaffold, and chromosome. Each row specifies properties such as version, rank, and attributes for a coordinate system. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/coord_system.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsv CODE: ``` 1 1 contig \N 3 default_version,sequence_level 2 1 scaffold Galgal4 2 default_version 3 1 chromosome Galgal4 1 default_version ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connection for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure database connectivity for the Ensembl REST API. It shows how to set up connections to Ensembl databases with specific parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` Model::Registry: host: ensembldb.ensembl.org port: 3306 user: anonymous verbose: 0 # Extra optional arguments for connecting to a database. # Will use the given arguments for Database.connect() # connection_timeout: 3 # disconnect_when_inactive: 1 # reconnect_when_lost: 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Ancestral Segment Configuration in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This line defines configuration parameters for an ancestral segment in the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the segment ID, version, type, and additional attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/coord_system.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1 1 ancestralsegment \N 1 default_version,sequence_level ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extended Production Environment Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: A more comprehensive configuration example for production deployments, showing various settings including databases, caching, and starman server configuration with environment variable references. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` ---\nname: EnsEMBL::REST\n# Disable compression in Plack/Starman because we are getting the nginx proxy to do gzip.\n# If you're not exposing the app via nginx then set these values to 1.\ndisable_compression: ${DISABLE_COMPRESSION-1}\nplack_middlewares:\n - name: Deflater\n options:\n - varies\n - \"${PLACK_GZIP-0}\"\nservice_name: ${SERVICE_NAME-ensembl}\nstarman_config:\n listen:\n - ${LISTEN-:5000}\ndo_not_deploy:\n - plugin\n# For a production environment file\nwww_root: ${WWW_ROOT-http://localhost:${PORT-5000}}\nshow_data_structure_failures: 0\n# Database access information\nspecies: # Homo sapiens core 75\nmouse: # Mus musculus core 75\nrat: # Rattus norvegicus core 75\nzebrafish: # Danio rerio core 75\n# Log4perl configuration\nlog4perl:\n config: ${HOME}/log4perl.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: TSV Data Table with Genomic Identifiers and Statistical Values DESCRIPTION: This is a tab-separated values (TSV) file containing genomic or biological data with numeric identifiers and statistical measurements.
