Limiting in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up caching and rate limiting parameters for the Ensembl REST API. It configures cache drivers, cache expiration times, and rate limiting rules for different endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/splicing_transcript_pair.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Caching cache => { driver => 'CHI', driver_args => { root_dir => '/tmp/ensembl_rest_cache', namespace => 'ensembl_rest', }, global_ttl => '6 hours', default_ttl => '1 hour', routes => { '/sequence/id' => { ttl => '1 day', }, '/vep' => { ttl => '1 day', }, }, }, # Rate limiting rate_limit => { default => { limit => 15, period => 60, }, '/vep' => { limit => 5, period => 60, }, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Catalyst Application in YAML DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration file sets up the Catalyst application for the Ensembl REST API. It defines various plugins, middleware, and application-specific settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/simple_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: YAML CODE: ``` name: EnsEMBL::REST default_view: HTML Plugin::Cache: backend: class: CHI driver: Memory global: 1 Plugin::Session: expires: 3600 rewrite: 0 storage: /tmp/ensrest/session Controller::Root: # Set the actions in this controller to be registered with no prefix # so they function identically to actions created in MyApp.pm namespace: '' View::HTML: TEMPLATE_EXTENSION: .tt WRAPPER: wrapper.tt Model::Documentation: schema_class: EnsEMBL::REST::Model::Documentation::Schema Model::Registry: host: ensembldb.ensembl.org port: 3306 user: anonymous version: 81 Plugin::Static::Simple: dirs: - static include_path: - root ignore_extensions: - tt index_gene_by_type: 1 disconnect_if_inactive: 1 disconnect_if_inactive_interval: 1200 truncation_length: 1000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating MySQL Database for Sequence Ontology - Bash DESCRIPTION: Creates a new MySQL database to store Sequence Ontology data using the specified environment variables for MySQL host, user, and password. It sets DB name based on the user's name. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/ontology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Create the DB. export MYSQL_HOST='127.0.0.1' export MYSQL_USR='root' export MYSQL_PASS='' export DB="${USER}_so_ontology" mysqladmin --host=$MYSQL_HOST --user=$MYSQL_USR --password=$MYSQL_PASS create $DB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Project Dependencies in requirements.txt DESCRIPTION: This requirements.txt file lists the project dependencies, including specific versions of the requests library and other packages needed for the Ensembl REST API client. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/protein_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Plain Text CODE: ``` requests==2.25.1 certifi==2020.12.5 chardet==4.0.0 idna==2.10 urllib3==1.26.4 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Schema Data in REST API Endpoints in Perl DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to access schema data within a REST API endpoint implementation. The code shows pattern for database interaction and data retrieval using the schema. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/gene_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub get_alignment_by_region { my ($self, $species, $region, $alignment_type, $alignment_id) = @_; my $c = $self->context(); my $schema = $c->model('Registry')->schema(); my $genomic_align = $schema->resultset('GenomicAlignment')->find( { 'species.name' => $species, 'region' => $region, 'type' => $alignment_type, 'id' => $alignment_id, }, { join => ['species', 'alignment'], } ); return $genomic_align; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Disabling Highlighting with HTML Class DESCRIPTION: Example of preventing syntax highlighting on a specific code block using the no-highlight class. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/root/static/js/highlight/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` 
...
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up database connection parameters for the Ensembl REST API, including host, port, and user credentials. It also defines species aliases and data access configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/operon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; sub setup_db_connections { my $self = shift; my $db_configs = { mysql_host => $self->{mysql}->{host}, mysql_port => $self->{mysql}->{port}, mysql_user => $self->{mysql}->{user}, mysql_pass => $self->{mysql}->{pass}, #mysql_dbname => $self->{mysql}->{database} }; # Set species_alias if defined if(exists $self->{species_alias}) { $db_configs->{species_alias} = $self->{species_alias}; } # Add compara if defined if(exists $self->{compara}) { $db_configs->{compara} = $self->{compara}; } # Variation DB params; if ( exists $self->{variation} ) { $db_configs->{mysql_variation_host} = $self->{variation}->{host}; $db_configs->{mysql_variation_port} = $self->{variation}->{port}; } # Funcgen DB params; if ( exists $self->{funcgen} ) { $db_configs->{mysql_funcgen_host} = $self->{funcgen}->{host}; $db_configs->{mysql_funcgen_port} = $self->{funcgen}->{port}; } return $db_configs; } 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Coordinate System Mapping TSV Data DESCRIPTION: Tab-separated values defining coordinate system configurations including system IDs, types, versions, and attributes. Maps relationships between different coordinate systems like chromosomes, contigs, and scaffolds across genome assemblies GRCh37 and GRCh38. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/coord_system.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsv CODE: ``` 2472 chromosome GRCh37 1 default_version 76_37 2 1 1 2482 clone 3 default_version 706_154444 4 1 1 2483 contig 4 default_version,sequence_level 706_154444 1 1 1 2484 supercontig GRCh37 2 default_version 706_154444 3 1 1 2485 lrg 8 default_version 706_154444 1003 1 1 2472 chromosome GRCh37 1 default_version 706_154444 2 1 1 2482 clone 3 default_version 824_141157 4 1 1 2483 contig 4 default_version,sequence_level 824_141157 1 1 1 2484 supercontig GRCh37 2 default_version 824_141157 3 1 1 2485 lrg 8 default_version 824_141157 1003 1 1 2472 chromosome GRCh37 1 default_version 824_141157 2 1 1 2472 chromosome GRCh38 1 default_version 89_38 4 1 1 2473 scaffold GRCh38 2 default_version 89_38 3 1 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines database connection settings for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the driver, host, port, user, and password for connecting to the database. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` DatabaseDSN => [ { driver => 'mysql', host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 3306, user => 'anonymous', pass => '', } ], ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Docker Image DESCRIPTION: Dockerfile for setting up the Ensembl REST API environment. It installs required dependencies, sets up the application directory, and configures the entry point. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Dockerfile CODE: ``` FROM ensemblorg/ensembl-web-libs:release-1.0.0 COPY cpanfile /root/ RUN cpanm --installdeps /root RUN groupadd -r ensembl && useradd -r -g ensembl ensembl RUN mkdir -p /opt/apache2 RUN chown ensembl:ensembl /opt/apache2 COPY . /opt/ensembl-rest WORKDIR /opt/ensembl-rest RUN chown -R ensembl:ensembl /opt/ensembl-rest USER ensembl CMD ["/opt/ensembl-rest/docker/start_ensrest.sh"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Catalyst URL Pattern Matching for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Sets up URL pattern matching for the Ensembl REST API using Catalyst::TraitFor::Request::REST. It defines patterns for various API endpoints and their corresponding controllers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/exon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Configure the TraitFor::Request::REST plugin { package EnsEMBL::REST; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Catalyst::TraitFor::Request::REST; extends 'Catalyst'; } __PACKAGE__->config( 'Plugin::Static::Simple' => { dirs => [ 'static' ], include_path => [ __PACKAGE__->path_to( 'root' ), ], debug => 1, }, # Disable deprecated behavior needed by old applications disable_component_resolution_regex_fallback => 1, ); # Start the application __PACKAGE__->setup(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining error formatting function for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a function 'format_error' that formats error responses for the Ensembl REST API. It takes an exception object and returns a hash with standardized error information. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/splicing_event_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub format_error { my ($c, $exception) = @_; my $h; if(ref($exception) eq 'ARRAY') { $h = { error => $exception->[0], msg => $exception->[1]}; } else { if(blessed($exception) && $exception->isa('EnsEMBL::REST::Exception')) { $h = { error => $exception->error_code(), msg => $exception->reason(), }; } else { $h = { error => 0, msg => 'Unspecified error', }; } } return $h; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dumping MySQL Database - Bash DESCRIPTION: Uses a script to dump the contents of the MySQL database with options for verbosity and test compatibility. The results are stored in a specified directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/ontology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Dump ensembl/misc-scripts/db/dump_mysql.pl --host $MYSQL_HOST --user=$MYSQL_USR --pass=$MYSQL_PASS --database $DB --verbose --testcompatible --directory /tmp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Ensembl REST API Endpoint and Making GET Request in Python DESCRIPTION: This code defines the Ensembl REST API endpoint and makes a GET request to retrieve gene information. It specifies the gene ID and desired response format as URL parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/protein_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" extension = "/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?" r = requests.get(server + extension, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Caching for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up caching for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the cache implementation (CHI::Driver::Memcached::libmemcached) and the memcached server details. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/transcript_supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` cache => { #use_local => 1, implementation => 'CHI::Driver::Memcached::libmemcached', memcached => [ 'server1:11211', 'server2:11211', ], }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching variant consequences with Perl and HTTP::Tiny DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use Perl with HTTP::Tiny to fetch variant consequences from the Ensembl REST API. It performs a POST request to the variant effect predictor endpoint with a JSON payload containing variant data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/vep/human/hgvs'; my $response = $http->request('POST', $server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' }, content => '{ "hgvs_notations" : ["ENST00000526603.1:c.1431_1433delTTC","ENST00000528897.1:c.1431_1433delTTC"] }' }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $response->{content}; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading OBO File into MySQL Database - Perl DESCRIPTION: Uses a Perl script to load the downloaded OBO file into the MySQL database. Requires Perl and the load_OBO_file.pl script to be available. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/ontology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Load perl ensembl/misc-scripts/ontology/scripts/load_OBO_file.pl -host $MYSQL_HOST -user $MYSQL_USR -pass $MYSQL_PASS -name $DB -f so.obo -o SO ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching variant consequences with Python and requests DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use Python with the requests library to fetch variant consequences from the Ensembl REST API. It performs a POST request to the variant effect predictor endpoint with a JSON payload containing variant data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/vep/human/hgvs" headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"} data='{ "hgvs_notations" : ["ENST00000526603.1:c.1431_1433delTTC","ENST00000528897.1:c.1431_1433delTTC"] }' r = requests.post(server+ext, headers=headers, data=data) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() printable = r.json() print(printable) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Variant Recurrence Data with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code snippet illustrates how to query the Ensembl REST API for variant recurrence data. It shows a GET request to the /variation/human endpoint with a specific variant ID to retrieve population genetics information. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/density_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl 'https://rest.ensembl.org/variation/human/rs56116432?content-type=application/json' | json_pp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Ensembl REST API server DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST API server, which makes the API available for use. This starts the server with default settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/gene_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` plackup -p 3000 ensembl-rest/configurations/production/01_ensrest.conf ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Caching in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up caching options for the Ensembl REST API, including memcached servers and cache expiration times for different types of data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub cache { my ($self) = @_; return { enabled => 0, memcached => ['127.0.0.1:11211'], dir => '/path/to/cache', expires => { gene => '1 day', sequence => '1 day', compara => '1 day', variation => '1 day', regulation => '1 day', lookup => '1 day', default => '1 day' }, auto_purge => 0, }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up the Ensembl REST API service. It defines the service, build context, port mapping, and environment variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: YAML CODE: ``` version: '3' services: ensrest: build: context: . dockerfile: Dockerfile ports: - "3000:3000" environment: - ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensembl_rest.conf - ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL=/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/log4perl.conf volumes: - ./configurations:/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Logging in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up logging options for the Ensembl REST API, including log file location and logging levels for different components. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub log { my ($self) = @_; return { logger => 'console', log_file => '/path/to/log/file.log', log_format => '[%d] [%p] %m%n', log_level => 'warn', log_stats => 0, stats_file => '/path/to/stats/file.log', stats_rotation => 'weekly', log_request_parameters => 0, config => { 'Log::Log4perl::Logger' => { 'EBI::Log::Appender::File' => { Name => 'log_file', layout => 'Log::Log4perl::Layout::PatternLayout', ConversionPattern => '[%d] [%p] [%x] %m%n' } } } }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: URL Template Example for REST API DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a URL template syntax for defining an API endpoint. It includes placeholders for parameters in curly braces and indicates optional parameters with question marks, following standard RESTful conventions. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` /sequence/id/{id}?{optional_param} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Variant Consequences with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Example JSON response for variant consequence data from the Ensembl REST API. The response shows the effects of a specific genetic variant, including affected transcripts and potential impacts. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/stable_id_history.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "variant_allele": "G", "colocated_variants": [ { "frequencies": { "amr": { "g": 0.0144, "a": 0.9856 }, "eas": { "g": 0.0149, "a": 0.9851 } }, "id": "rs1333049" } ], "most_severe_consequence": "downstream_gene_variant" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Homologues of Human Gene with curl DESCRIPTION: A shell command to fetch homologues of a human gene (BRCA2) across mouse, with alignment statistics. It uses the /homology/id endpoint to retrieve evolutionary relationship data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/protein_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -X GET "https://rest.ensembl.org/homology/id/ENSG00000139618?format=condensed;type=orthologues;target_species=mus_musculus" -H "Content-Type:application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apache Load Balancing Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Apache load balancing setup for Ensembl REST API that proxies requests to multiple Starman server instances running on different ports, with health check and load balancing directives. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_root.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: apache CODE: ``` ServerAdmin webmaster@rest.ensembl.org ServerName rest.ensembl.org ServerAlias beta-rest.ensembl.org # Standard directives DocumentRoot /ensembl/ensembl-rest/root ErrorLog logs/rest.ensembl.org_error.log CustomLog logs/rest.ensembl.org_access.log combined RewriteEngine On RewriteRule ^/rhodecode(.*)$ http://host.docker.internal:5000/rhodecode$1 [P] BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5000 connectiontimeout=10 timeout=600 ttl=120 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5001 connectiontimeout=10 timeout=600 ttl=120 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5002 connectiontimeout=10 timeout=600 ttl=120 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5003 connectiontimeout=10 timeout=600 ttl=120 ProxySet lbmethod=byrequests ProxySet maxattempts=1 ProxyRequests Off ProxyPreserveHost Off ProxyPass / balancer://ensrest/ ProxyPassReverse / balancer://ensrest/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Sequence Variations with Ensembl REST API in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to query the Ensembl REST API for genomic variations using Python requests. It specifies the genomic region and requests variation data in JSON format with appropriate headers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=variation;content-type=application/json" r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decode = r.json() for record in decode: print(record['id']) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dropping MySQL Database - Bash DESCRIPTION: Drops the MySQL database once it is no longer needed, cleaning up any resources used. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/ontology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Drop DB mysqladmin --host=$MYSQL_HOST --user=$MYSQL_USR --password=$MYSQL_PASS drop $DB ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring URL Parameters for Ensembl REST API Testing DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet defines URL parameters needed to access the Ensembl REST API server during testing. It specifies base URLs, port settings, and additional parameters required for test connections. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/repeat_consensus.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { -http_root => '/ensembl-rest', -basic_auth => 0, -content_type => 'text/xml; charset=utf-8', -base_url => 'http://127.0.0.1:3000/', -port => 3000, -username => 'user', -password => 'pass', -release_suffix => 0, # don't say /ensembl-rest/v${release_version}, default is 1 -doc_root => 'http://127.0.0.1:3000', -proxy => 'http://127.0.0.1:3000', } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server. It specifies the name, connection details, plugins to be used, and various server parameters such as default content type and documentation settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/qtl_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using => ['Catalyst::Plugin::ConfigLoader'], 'Plugin::Static::Simple' => { dirs => [ 'static' ], include_path => [ __PACKAGE__->path_to('root'), ], debug => 1, }, 'Plugin::Cache' => { backend => { cache_root => '/tmp/ensrest', default_expires_in => '1 day', } }, service_name => 'Ensembl REST API', service_logo => 'static/img/e-ensembl.png', service_parent => 'Ensembl', copyright_footer => '

Copyright © 1999-2024 EMBL-EBI

', jsonp => { callback_param => 'callback', allow_callback => 1, }, enable_cors => 1, default_view => 'HTML', # List of allowed content types, using X- prefixed ones means we don't # have to generate Vary header data. Mentioning XML & JSON first forces them # to be preferred when asking for HTML as well map_content_type => { 'X-www-form-urlencoded' => ['application/x-www-form-urlencoded', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded-urlencoded'], 'X-application-javascript' => ['application/javascript', 'text/javascript', 'application/x-javascript'], 'X-text-html' => ['text/html'], 'X-text-plain' => ['text/plain'], 'X-text-xml' => ['text/xml'], 'X-application-xml' => ['application/xml'], 'X-application-json' => ['application/json'], 'X-text-yaml' => ['text/yaml'], }, default_content_type => 'application/json', # Extend caching time to 24 hours default_expires '24 hours' # Make maximum use of mod_perl setup_engine 'PSGI::Engine::Apache2' default_format json default_version 3 class = CHI driver = Memory global = 1 paths = [root/documentation] directory = root/documentation index = /index.md wrapper = wrapper.tt renderer = pod_simple content_type = text/html allow_all_path_traversals = 1 index_enabled = 0 method_link_type_homologues = ['ENSEMBL_ORTHOLOGUES'] rest_max_num_consequences = 1000 dbname = ensembl_external_db default_viewpoint_species = homo_sapiens # Set to 1 to enable the /overlap/region/:species/:region endpoint enable_feature_type = 1 default_microarray = HumanWG_6_V3 ontology_name = GO expires 3600 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Daemontools Log Service for Ensembl REST DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting up the log service for an Ensembl REST microservice using Daemontools, directing main log and error log to appropriate files. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` echo '#!/bin/bash exec setuidgid $DAEMONTOOLS_USER multilog t s10485760 n10 /path/to/logdir' > $SPATH/$SERVICE/log/run chmod +x $SPATH/$SERVICE/log/run ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Caching Options for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up caching options for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the cache type as CHI, sets the driver to Memory, and defines the global and default TTLs (Time To Live) for cached data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { use_cache => 1, cache_type => 'CHI', cache_args => { driver => 'Memory', global_expires_in => '1 day', expires_in => '1 hour', }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API Server DESCRIPTION: Shell script for starting the Ensembl REST API server. It sets up the environment, configures the server, and starts it using starman. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` #!/bin/bash cd /opt/ensembl-rest export PERL5LIB=$PERL5LIB:/opt/ensembl-rest/lib export ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=${ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG:-/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensembl_rest.conf} export ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL=${ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL:-/opt/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/log4perl.conf} plackup -s Starman --workers=10 --max-requests=10000 \ -E production -p 3000 -a /opt/ensembl-rest/ensembl_rest.psgi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: Perl configuration code for the Ensembl REST API. This snippet sets up the service parameters including the service name, default response format, and database connection details. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` lookup_model = EnsEMBL::REST::Model::Lookup taxonomy_model = EnsEMBL::REST::Model::Taxonomy allowed_integrations = [ ga4gh, ensembl_compara, ensembl_bacteria, ensembl_fungi, ensembl_metazoa, ensembl_plants, ensembl_protists ] blast_model = EnsEMBL::REST::Model::ga4gh::Blast vep_model = EnsEMBL::REST::Model::VEP ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Ensembl REST API Logging Configuration in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures logging settings for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the log file path, logging level, and log4perl configuration file location. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` log4perl => { config => { file => {__path_to(log4perl.conf)__}, }, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Retry Logic for Ensembl REST API Requests in Node.js DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to implement retry logic when making requests to the Ensembl REST API. It uses a recursive function to attempt the request multiple times with increasing delays between attempts, providing better reliability when dealing with network issues or API rate limits. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_set_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` var request = require('request'); function fetchWithRetry(uri, headers, timeout, retries, retryDelay, backoffRate, callback) { if (retries === 0) { callback(new Error('Maximum retries reached')); return; } var requestOptions = { uri: uri, headers: headers, timeout: timeout }; request(requestOptions, function(error, response, body) { if (error || response.statusCode !== 200) { console.log(`Attempt failed, retrying in ${retryDelay}ms...`); setTimeout(function() { fetchWithRetry( uri, headers, timeout, retries - 1, retryDelay * backoffRate, backoffRate, callback ); }, retryDelay); } else { callback(null, JSON.parse(body)); } }); } // Example usage fetchWithRetry( 'https://rest.ensembl.org/sequence/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json', { 'User-Agent': 'Node.js' }, 5000, // timeout in ms 3, // number of retries 1000, // initial retry delay in ms 2, // backoff rate multiplier function(error, data) { if (error) console.error(error); else console.log(data); } ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cleaning Species Names in Ensembl REST API (Perl) DESCRIPTION: This function cleans up species names by removing underscores and converting to lowercase. It's used to standardize species input for further processing in the API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub _clean_species_name { my ($self, $species) = @_; $species =~ s/[^A-Za-z0-9_]/_/g; $species = lc($species); return $species; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Apache2 for Ensembl REST API in Debian Pre-installation DESCRIPTION: This script configures Apache2 as the web server for the Ensembl REST API during Debian package pre-installation. It sets up the web server type, domain name, and automatic server start configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/density_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/bash set -e . /usr/share/debconf/confmodule db_input high ensrest/server_type || true db_go db_get ensrest/server_type SERVER_TYPE="$RET" if [ "$SERVER_TYPE" = "apache2" ]; then db_input high ensrest/server_name || true db_go db_input high ensrest/server_aliases || true db_go db_input high ensrest/start || true db_go fi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Variant Data with Python for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This Python example shows how to retrieve variant data from the Ensembl REST API. It uses the requests library to make a GET request to the variant lookup endpoint and processes the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/homology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import requests, sys server = "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext = "/variant/human/rs56116432?" r = requests.get(server+ext, headers={ "Content-Type" : "application/json"}) if not r.ok: r.raise_for_status() sys.exit() decoded = r.json() print(repr(decoded)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inserting Chicken Genome Metadata in SQL DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet inserts metadata entries for the chicken genome, including assembly information, species classification, and various database attributes. It uses the meta table structure common in Ensembl core databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/meta.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: SQL CODE: ``` INSERT INTO meta (meta_id, species_id, meta_key, meta_value) VALUES (1, 1, 'assembly.coverage_depth', 'high'), (2, 1, 'assembly.date', '2011-11'), (3, 1, 'assembly.default', 'Galgal4'), (4, 1, 'assembly.name', 'Galgal4'), (5, 1, 'genebuild.id', '40'), (6, 1, 'genebuild.start_date', '2011-12-Ensembl'), (7, 1, 'repeat.analysis', 'repeatmask'), (8, 1, 'repeat.analysis', 'dust'), (9, 1, 'repeat.analysis', 'trf'), (10, 1, 'assembly.accession', 'GCA_000002315.2'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating API version test class in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines a test class for checking API version loading with proper test configurations. It extends the EnsEMBL::REST::Test::Rest class and imports necessary test utilities. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/dnafrag_region.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package LoadingTest; use strict; use warnings; use Test::More; use Test::Differences; use Test::Deep; use JSON; use HTTP::Request; use EnsEMBL::REST::Test::Rest; use base qw(EnsEMBL::REST::Test::Rest); sub get_test_config { return { no_catalyst => 1 }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API Server DESCRIPTION: This Perl script starts the Ensembl REST API server. It sets up the necessary environment variables and executes the server with specified parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/operon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl BEGIN { use Cwd; my $root = getcwd; unshift @INC, "$root/lib"; unshift @INC, "$root/../ensembl/modules"; unshift @INC, "$root/../ensembl-variation/modules"; unshift @INC, "$root/../ensembl-funcgen/modules"; unshift @INC, "$root/../ensembl-compara/modules"; unshift @INC, "$root/../ensembl-metadata/modules"; } use Plack::Runner; use strict; use warnings; my $app = 'EnsEMBL::REST'; my $psgi = $app->psgi_app; my $runner = Plack::Runner->new(); $runner->parse_options(@ARGV); my $pid_file = '/var/run/ensrest.pid'; $ENV{ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL} = "$ENV{HOME}/ensembl-rest/log4perl.conf"; $ENV{ENS_REST_LOG_ROOT} = $ENV{HOME}; $ENV{PERL5LIB} = join ':', @INC; my $worker_connections = 100; $runner->run($psgi); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apache2 Configuration for Ensembl REST Microservice DESCRIPTION: Virtual host configuration for integrating Ensembl REST with Apache2, including proxy settings, load balancing, and worker configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: apache CODE: ``` ServerAdmin webmaster@localhost ServerName ${SERVER_NAME} DocumentRoot /path/to/ensembl/rest/root BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5000 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5001 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5002 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5003 BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:5004 ProxyPass / balancer://ensemblrestcluster/ ProxyPassReverse / balancer://ensemblrestcluster/ ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.log # Possible values include: debug, info, notice, warn, error, crit, # alert, emerg. LogLevel warn CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Ensembl REST API Environment DESCRIPTION: Shell script for setting up the Ensembl REST API environment. It exports necessary environment variables and sets up the PERL5LIB path. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` #!/bin/sh export PERL5LIB=$PWD/lib:$PWD/../ensembl/modules:$PWD/../bioperl-live export ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=$PWD/configurations/production ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Cache Settings for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines cache settings for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the default TTL (Time To Live) for cached data and sets up different cache regions with their respective TTLs. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/translation_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub cache_settings { return { default_ttl => 3600, regions => { sequence => { ttl => 86400, }, lookup => { ttl => 7200, }, info => { ttl => 7200, }, }, }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Memcached on Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing Memcached server on Ubuntu systems to support caching functionality in the Ensembl REST API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` apt-get install memcached ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the configuration for the Ensembl REST API server. It includes settings for database connections, caching, and API rate limiting. The configuration uses the Catalyst framework and sets up various plugins and middleware. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'EnsEMBL::REST', using_frontend_proxy => 1, user_agent => 'EnsemblREST/' . $SiteDefs::ENSEMBL_REST_VERSION, encoding => 'utf-8', default_view => 'HTML', session => { storage => 'Memory', }, # Order of Serialisers is important. Webpages need to go at the end # because of the Accept header mangling. enable_jsonview => 1, enable_xmlview => 1, enable_seqview => 1, enable_ioview => 1, enable_tsvview => 1, enable_vcfvcfview => 1, enable_vcfgvfview => 1, enable_gffview => 1, enable_gff3view => 1, enable_proteinfeatures_view => 1, enable_phyloxml_view => 1, enable_nhx_view => 1, enable_yaml => 1, plugins => [ 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Cache', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Gzip', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Json', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Html', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::Cors', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::EnsemblPostrequisite', 'EnsEMBL::REST::Plugin::RequestLogger', ], # Disable compression by setting to 0 compress_body => 1, # Set to 1 to force absolute URLs in stash absolute_urls => 0, # Enable CORS sharing resources accoss domains cors => { allowed_origins => ['*'], allowed_methods => ['GET', 'POST', 'OPTIONS'], allow_credentials => 0, max_age => 86400, }, # Enable HTTP request rate limiting 'Plugin::RateLimiting' => { enabled => 1, rate => "100/hour", blacklist_rate => "1000/hour", whitelist_rate => "1000/hour", authentication_required_error_message => "API key is required, obtained from https://www.ensembl.org/account/login", }, # Enable caching (memcached) service_cache_memcached_enable => 1, service_cache_memcached_servers => ['127.0.0.1:11211'], service_cache_memcached_serialiser => 'storable', service_cache_memcached_expires => 6 * 60 * 60, # expire key after 6hr service_cache_memcached_compress_threshold => 2000, # Override default database settings service_public_dbconnection => { user => 'ensro', port => '3306', dbname => 'ensembl_website', host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', driver => 'mysql', }, # Override database adaptor settings service_available_adaptors => { 'compara' => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Compara::DBSQL::DBAdaptor', 'core' => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::DBSQL::DBAdaptor', 'funcgen' => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Funcgen::DBSQL::DBAdaptor', 'variation'=> 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Variation::DBSQL::DBAdaptor', }, # Disable server-side caching service_use_cache => 0, # Logging configuration log4perl => { category_name => 'ensembl.rest', file_name => $SiteDefs::ENSEMBL_REST_LOGFILE, restart_dispatcher => 1, }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Piping Schema into MySQL Database - Bash DESCRIPTION: Executes a SQL schema file on the newly created MySQL database, preparing it for the insertion of ontology data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/ontology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` # Pipe schema in mysql --host=$MYSQL_HOST --user=$MYSQL_USR --password=$MYSQL_PASS $DB < ensembl/misc-scripts/ontology/sql/tables.sql ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Apache Configuration for Ensembl REST API with Elasticsearch DESCRIPTION: Apache configuration that sets up an environment variable for the Elasticsearch host. This allows the REST API to connect to Elasticsearch when run under Apache. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: apache CODE: ``` SetEnv ELASTICSEARCH_HOST localhost:9200 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Regulatory Features by Region in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to retrieve regulatory features that overlap with a specified genomic region. This is useful for identifying regulatory elements such as enhancers, promoters, etc. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=regulatory;content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finalizing test class with done_testing call DESCRIPTION: Completes the test class implementation with the done_testing statement, which is a common pattern in Perl test files to indicate all tests have been run. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/dnafrag_region.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` 1; # End of package ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Ensembl REST API Endpoint Tests in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code block specifies the structure for testing Ensembl REST API endpoints. It defines expected HTTP status codes, content types, and JSON schemas for various API calls, including gene, transcript, and variation data retrieval. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/prediction_exon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { endpoints => [ { path => '/gene/id/ENSG00000176515', method => 'GET', expected => { code => 200, content_type => 'application/json', json_schema => {type => 'object'}, properties => {object_type => 'Gene'} } }, { path => '/transcript/id/ENST00000320916', method => 'GET', expected => { code => 200, content_type => 'application/json', json_schema => {type => 'object'}, properties => {object_type => 'Transcript'} } }, { path => '/variation/homo_sapiens/rs56116432', method => 'GET', expected => { code => 200, content_type => 'application/json', json_schema => {type => 'object'}, properties => {name => 'rs56116432'} } } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the database connection parameters for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the driver, host, port, user, and password for connecting to the database. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/data_file.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; { name => 'DatabaseConnection', connection_class => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Utils::SqlHelper', driver => 'mysql', host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', pass => '', } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Vagrant VM for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Vagrant VM configuration settings for deploying the Ensembl REST API, specifying the VM provider, memory allocation, host-to-guest port forwarding, and shared folder mappings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_root.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` Vagrant.configure("2") do |config| config.vm.box = "hashicorp/precise64" config.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |v| v.memory = 2048 end # Configure rest ensembl to bind on 8080 on the host machine config.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 3000, host: 8080 config.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 80, host: 8000 # Port used for starman/PSGI config.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 5000, host: 5000 # Nice mount plz config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/ensembl/ensembl-rest" end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying VEP with POST request using bash curl DESCRIPTION: Example of querying the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) REST API using curl with POST method. Demonstrates how to send a payload of variant data for batch processing. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" -H "Accept:application/json" -X POST -d '{ "hgvs_notations": ["ENST00000494142:c.48C>A", "ENST00000313050:c.136G>A"]}' https://rest.ensembl.org/vep/human/hgvs ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Non-Reference DNA Collection Parameters (Perl/Ruby Hash) DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines configuration parameters for handling the non-reference species DNA collection, likely for genome alignment processing within the Ensembl pipeline. It uses a hash-like structure (common in Perl or Ruby) specifying chunk size, group set size, masking options (enabling default soft masking), and overlap size. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/method_link_species_set_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` {"chunk_size" => 10100000,"group_set_size" => 10100000,"masking_options" => "{default_soft_masking => 1}","overlap" => 100000} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Daemontools Service Monitoring with Monit DESCRIPTION: Monit configuration script for monitoring an Ensembl REST service running under Daemontools, including health checks and restart commands. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` check process ensrest with pidfile /path/to/ensrest.pid start program = "/usr/bin/svc -u /service/ensrest" stop program = "/usr/bin/svc -d /service/ensrest" # You should add other checks to monitor memory consumption etc. # See monit documentation for more details ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JSON Response Structure from Ensembl API Lookup Endpoint DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the expected JSON response structure when looking up a specific genome ID. The response includes details such as gene description, source, biotype, and related IDs. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "source": "ensembl_havana", "object_type": "Gene", "id": "ENSG00000157764", "display_name": "BRAF", "species": "homo_sapiens", "biotype": "protein_coding", "strand": -1, "seq_region_name": "7", "description": "B-Raf proto-oncogene, serine/threonine kinase [Source:HGNC Symbol;Acc:HGNC:1097]", "start": 140719327, "end": 140924764, "version": 10 } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing TSV Format Sequence Ontology Data DESCRIPTION: Tab-separated values containing sequence ontology IDs, definitions, and metadata. Each row represents a different sequence feature or element with fields for ID, version, namespace, accession, name, definition, obsolescence flag, and other attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/ontology/term.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: tsv CODE: ``` 508 1 \N SO:0000561 heptamer_of_recombination_feature_of_vertebrate_immune_system_gene "Seven nucleotide recombination site (e.g. CACAGTG), part of V-gene, D-gene or J-gene recombination feature of an immunoglobulin or T-cell receptor gene." [http://www.imgt.org/cgi-bin/IMGTlect.jv?query=7#] 0 0 509 1 \N SO:0000562 nonamer_of_recombination_feature_of_vertebrate_immune_system_gene "" [] 0 0 510 1 \N SO:0000563 vertebrate_immune_system_gene_recombination_spacer "" [] 0 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Elasticsearch Indexer Command in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Elasticsearch indexer for the Ensembl REST API. The indexer populates the Elasticsearch indices with genomic data that can be queried through the REST API. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` perl scripts/elasticsearch_indexer.pl -es_host "localhost:9200" -species homo_sapiens -index genome -production_name human ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API Using Perl with LWP DESCRIPTION: This Perl example demonstrates using LWP to interact with the Ensembl REST API. It sets up an HTTP request with proper headers, handles the server response, and includes error checking for failed requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/density_type.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use LWP::UserAgent; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/lookup/id/ENSG00000139618?'; my $response = $ua->get($server.$ext, 'Content-type' => 'application/json'); die "" . $response->status_line . "\n" unless $response->is_success; print $response->content; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Alignment Tool Parameters (Command Line) DESCRIPTION: This snippet represents command-line parameters passed to a genome alignment tool (potentially LASTZ, given the parameters like T, K, M, L, H, O, E). It configures settings like temperature (T), seed K-mer size (K), match score matrix parameters (M, L, H), gap penalties (O, E), and how ambiguous bases (IUPAC codes) are handled. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/method_link_species_set_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` T=1 K=3000 M=50 L=3000 H=2200 O=400 E=30 --ambiguous=iupac ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic YAML Configuration for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: A simple configuration example for the Ensembl REST API server showing basic settings including the name and connection information. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` ---\nname: EnsEMBL::REST\nstarman_config:\n port: 5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting HTTP_PROXY environment variable for command line tools DESCRIPTION: Shows how to set the HTTP_PROXY environment variable to route HTTP requests through the EBI proxy server. This is useful for command-line tools that respect this environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/assembly_exception.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` export HTTP_PROXY=http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Ensembl REST API Documentation Routes in YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration defining the routes for API documentation endpoints. It maps the documentation URLs to their corresponding controller actions and specifies the supported HTTP methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` '/documentation/info/:id': get: to: 'Documentation#info' params: id: type: 'Str' pattern: '[\w\.]+' '/documentation/info': get: to: 'Documentation#info_root' '/documentation/routes': get: to: 'Documentation#routes' '/documentation/versions': get: to: 'Documentation#versions' '/documentation/resources_by_plugin': get: to: 'Documentation#resources_by_plugin' '/swagger.json': get: to: 'Documentation#swagger' '/analysis': get: to: 'GenomeAssembly#list_analyses' description: 'list analyses' '/assembly/info/:species/:region': get: to: 'GenomeAssembly#info' params: species: type: 'Str' pattern: '[\w]+' region: type: 'Str' pattern: '[\w\.\:\-]+' description: 'Return information about the specified toplevel sequence region for the given species' examples: - /assembly/info/homo_sapiens/X - /assembly/info/homo_sapiens/ABBA01004489.1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Test Database Connection in Ensembl REST DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to set up a test database connection for the Ensembl REST API. It creates a test database using Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB and configures the registry to use this test database. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/unmapped_object.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Get a DBAdaptor for the test my $multi_db = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new; my $dba = $multi_db->get_DBAdaptor('core'); # Load registry with test adaptors my $reg = 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Registry'; $reg->add_DBAdaptor('test', 'core', $dba); # Set the species adaptor to use the test one my $sa = $dba->get_adaptor('Slice'); my $ga = $dba->get_adaptor('Gene'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: AWS CodeBuild Buildspec for Ensembl REST API Deployment DESCRIPTION: This buildspec.yml configuration defines the build, test, and deployment process for the Ensembl REST API on Amazon ECS. It includes multiple phases: install, pre-build, build, and post-build, with commands for dependency installation, testing, Docker image creation, and deployment to Amazon ECS. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: 0.2 phases: install: runtime-versions: perl: 5.32 commands: - echo Entered the install phase... - apt-get update -y - apt-get install -y apt-utils - apt-get install -y jq - apt-get install -y libmodule-install-perl - curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_12.x | bash - - apt-get install -y nodejs - npm install -g newman - export PERL5LIB=$PERL5LIB:$CODEBUILD_SRC_DIR/bioperl-live pre_build: commands: - echo Entered the pre_build phase... - echo Logging in to Amazon ECR... - aws ecr get-login-password --region $AWS_DEFAULT_REGION | docker login --username AWS --password-stdin $AWS_ACCOUNT_ID.dkr.ecr.$AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.amazonaws.com - REPOSITORY_URI=$AWS_ACCOUNT_ID.dkr.ecr.$AWS_DEFAULT_REGION.amazonaws.com/$IMAGE_REPO_NAME - COMMIT_HASH=$(echo $CODEBUILD_RESOLVED_SOURCE_VERSION | cut -c 1-7) - IMAGE_TAG=${COMMIT_HASH:=latest} - perl Makefile.PL - make - make manifest - prove -c build: commands: - echo Entered the build phase... - echo Build started on `date` - echo Building the Docker image... - docker build -t $REPOSITORY_URI:latest . - docker tag $REPOSITORY_URI:latest $REPOSITORY_URI:$IMAGE_TAG post_build: commands: - echo Entered the post_build phase... - echo Build completed on `date` - echo Pushing the Docker images... - docker push $REPOSITORY_URI:latest - docker push $REPOSITORY_URI:$IMAGE_TAG - echo Writing image definitions file... - aws ecs describe-task-definition --task-definition ${ECS_TASK_DEFINITION_FAMILY} --query taskDefinition > taskdef.json - envsubst < appspec_template.yaml > appspec.yaml - envsubst < taskdef_template.json > taskdef.json - cat appspec.yaml - cat taskdef.json artifacts: files: - appspec.yaml - taskdef.json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST Search Endpoint with Basic Text Search DESCRIPTION: An example of a basic search request to the Ensembl REST API using curl. This request searches for 'BRCA2' across all Ensembl databases with default parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/meta_coord.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl 'https://rest.ensembl.org/search/BRCA2' -H 'Content-type:application/json' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Representing Species Phylogenetic Tree (Newick Format) DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a phylogenetic tree relating three species (Meleagris gallopavo, Gallus gallus, Taeniopygia guttata) using the standard Newick format. It includes branch lengths indicating evolutionary distance between the species. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/method_link_species_set_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: newick CODE: ``` ((Meleagris_gallopavo:0.0414,Gallus_gallus:0.0414):0.1242,Taeniopygia_guttata:0.1715); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Ensembl REST API Mapping Table DESCRIPTION: Tabular data showing relationships between various IDs in the Ensembl REST API system. Each row contains 7 columns: primary key, object ID, related object ID, relationship type, and additional status flags. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/ontology/closure.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: data CODE: ``` 16721 705 87 1 6 1 0 16722 708 87 1 6 1 0 16723 713 87 1 6 1 0 [...additional rows omitted for brevity...] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kubernetes Horizontal Pod Autoscaler for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This HorizontalPodAutoscaler configures automatic scaling for the REST API deployment based on CPU utilization. It sets minimum and maximum replicas and targets 80% CPU utilization as the scaling metric. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/hmm_profile.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: autoscaling/v1 kind: HorizontalPodAutoscaler metadata: name: rest spec: scaleTargetRef: apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment name: rest minReplicas: 2 maxReplicas: 10 targetCPUUtilizationPercentage: 80 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Sequence Variations for Human Gene with curl DESCRIPTION: A shell command to fetch sequence variations for a specific region on human chromosome 9 using the Ensembl REST API. It uses the /overlap/region endpoint with parameters to filter for variations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/protein_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -X GET "https://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/9:22125500-22136000?feature=variation;content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Analyzing Protein Sequence with Identifier EC4C6BCA4433CE3BBF47FC7D14DE167F DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows a protein sequence identified by the code EC4C6BCA4433CE3BBF47FC7D14DE167F. The sequence is 537 amino acids long and features various protein motifs, including repeated amino acid stretches. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/peptide_archive.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ```  ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running REST Server with Debug Mode and Large Worker Pool DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST server with debugging enabled and an increased number of worker processes (40). This configuration is suitable for higher traffic loads. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ensembl-rest perl scripts/rest_server.pl -debug 1 -host 0.0.0.0 -port 3000 -pid_file rest_ensembl.pid -processes 40 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering a Schema with the REST Server in Perl DESCRIPTION: Code showing how to register a custom schema with the REST server by adding it to the Plugin list. This enables the server to recognize and use the schema for handling specific API endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/gene_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` __PACKAGE__->config( 'Plugin' => [ 'EnsEMBL::REST::Schema' ], ); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Environment Variables for Ensembl REST API in Production DESCRIPTION: Sample configuration showing the required environment variables for running the Ensembl REST API in a production environment, using the default ports. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` export ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=/path/to/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensrest.conf export ENSEMBL_REST_PORT=5000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sequence Ontology Term Definitions DESCRIPTION: Tab-delimited entries containing sequence ontology (SO) terms with their IDs, definitions, and metadata. Each line represents a distinct protein structure feature with detailed geometric and chemical properties. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/ontology/term.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 981 1 biosapiens SO:0001100 polypeptide_molybdenum_ion_contact_site "A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with molybdenum ions." [EBIBS:GAR, SO:cb] 0 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Caching in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up caching for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the cache type as CHI, specifies the driver as Memory, and sets the global key prefix and time to live (TTL) for cached items. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/associated_group.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` "Cache" => { "default" => { "driver" => "Memory", "global_key_prefix" => "ensrest:", "cache_objects" => { "default" => { "driver" => "Memory", "max_size" => 10000, "expires_in" => "24 hours" }, "long" => { "driver" => "Memory", "max_size" => 10000, "expires_in" => "1 week" }, } } }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Ensembl REST API Dependencies via cpanm DESCRIPTION: Command to install all necessary Perl dependencies for the Ensembl REST API using the cpanm package manager with the --installdeps flag. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cpanm --installdeps . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Ensembl REST API tests DESCRIPTION: Command to run the test suite for the Ensembl REST API, ensuring that all components are functioning correctly after installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/gene_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` prove -lv t ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Genomic Coordinates and Alignment Data Table DESCRIPTION: Tab-separated data containing genomic coordinates, feature mappings, and alignment scores. Each row represents a genomic feature or alignment with columns for IDs, positions, strands, and other metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/repeat_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: tsv CODE: ``` 31017562 27515 1765334 1765388 0 770478 770532 594541 7 0 31017563 27515 1765807 1765933 -1 3 145 594553 2 236 31017564 27515 1768803 1769010 1 1 235 595036 2 1195 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Biological Entity Mappings in SQL Format DESCRIPTION: Database records showing mappings between biological entities (Translation, Transcript, Gene) and their associated IDs. Each record contains a unique ID, entity ID, type, reference ID, and two additional reference columns with some null values (\N). SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/object_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` 14824205 725239 Translation 3656213 \N 8278 14824206 725239 Translation 3656214 \N 8278 14824207 725239 Translation 3656215 \N 8278 14824208 725239 Translation 3656216 \N 8278 [...additional records truncated for brevity...] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Docker Compose for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Command to build and run the Ensembl REST API using Docker Compose, running the services in detached mode. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose up -d ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Overlapping Features with curl DESCRIPTION: A shell command that retrieves genomic features that overlap with a specified region on human chromosome 7. It uses the /overlap/region endpoint to get regulatory features in JSON format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/protein_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -X GET "https://rest.ensembl.org/overlap/region/human/7:140424943-140624564?feature=regulatory;feature=gene;content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Sequence Ontology Terms in Plain Text Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of how Sequence Ontology (SO) terms are defined in a tab-separated format. Each line represents a single SO term with its identifier, name, and definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/ontology/term.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: plain text CODE: ``` 1377 1 \N SO:0001499 whole_genome_sequence_status "The status of whole genome sequence." [DOI:10.1126] 0 0 1378 1 \N SO:0001500 heritable_phenotypic_marker "A biological_region characterized as a single heritable trait in a phenotype screen. The heritable phenotype may be mapped to a chromosome but generally has not been characterized to a specific gene locus." [JAX:hdene] 0 0 1379 1 \N SO:0001501 peptide_collection "A collection of peptide sequences." [BBOP:nlw] 0 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping Docker Container for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the running Docker container for the Ensembl REST API, which terminates all services started with docker-compose. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker-compose down ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Plugin Configuration for VEP in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Perl scalar variable containing a hash reference for configuring VEP (Variant Effect Predictor) plugins. It specifies a plugins array with a test plugin object (RestTestPlugin) that includes configuration keys for 'key', 'params', 'available', and 'enabled'. Dependencies include a Perl interpreter and the broader VEP infrastructure. Inputs include the plugin's parameter list and activation flags; outputs are determined by how this config is used downstream. This structure enables flexible management of multiple plugins within VEP. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/testdata/vep_plugin_config.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` my $VEP_PLUGIN_CONFIG = { "plugins" => [ # test { "key" => "RestTestPlugin", "params" => [ '@*' ], "available" => 1, "enabled" => 0, }, ] }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Database Connections in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the connection parameters for different species and databases, including the host, port, user, and password. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/translation_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` species_dbs => { Multi => { database => 'ensembl_compara_108', host => 'mysql-ens-sta-1', port => 4519, user => 'ensro', pass => '', }, Human => { database => 'homo_sapiens_core_108_38', host => 'mysql-ens-sta-1', port => 4519, user => 'ensro', pass => '', }, Mouse => { database => 'mus_musculus_core_108_39', host => 'mysql-ens-sta-1', port => 4519, user => 'ensro', pass => '', }, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Content Types for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This configuration defines mappings between MIME types and Exporter modules for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies how different data formats like JSON, YAML, and various biological data formats are handled, including their file extensions and priority in content negotiation. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/stable_id_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST; use strict; use warnings; use Config::General; sub mimetypes { my $c = shift; my $mimes = { 'json' => 'application/json', 'xml' => 'text/xml', 'yaml' => 'text/x-yaml', 'text' => 'text/plain', 'nh' => 'text/x-nh', 'phyloxml' => 'text/x-phyloxml+xml', 'orthoxml' => 'text/x-orthoxml+xml', 'fasta' => 'text/x-fasta', 'seqxml' => 'text/x-seqxml+xml', 'bed' => 'text/x-bed', 'gff3' => 'text/x-gff3', 'jsonp' => 'text/javascript', 'vcf' => 'text/vcf', 'bigbed' => 'application/x-bigbed', 'bigwig' => 'application/x-bigwig', }; return $mimes; } sub content_types { my $c = shift; my $mimes = mimetypes($c); my %mime_map = reverse %{$mimes}; my %extn_map = reverse %{$mimes}; $extn_map{'text/x-seqxml+xml'} = 'xml'; $extn_map{'text/x-orthoxml+xml'} = 'xml'; $extn_map{'text/x-phyloxml+xml'} = 'xml'; my $compressor_to_encoding = { 'gzip' => 'gzip', }; my $content_types = { 'default' => 'json', 'text/html' => 'html', 'map' => \%mime_map, 'extension' => \%extn_map, 'compressors'=> $compressor_to_encoding, 'compressor_format' => { 'gzip' => 'gzip', }, 'priority' => ['gzip'], }; return $content_types; } 1; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Healthcheck Endpoint for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This code configures the healthcheck functionality for the Ensembl REST API. It enables ping checking, database connectivity monitoring, and cache status verification, allowing the system to report on its health status via an endpoint. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { startup_status => { new => 1, allow_missing_extn => 1, }, ping => { new => 1 }, database => { new => 1 }, cache => { new => 1 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing Ensembl Gene Data in Tabular Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet represents a tabular data structure containing gene information from the Ensembl database. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/prediction_exon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { host => 'localhost', port => 3306, user => 'anonymous', pass => '', databases => { homo_sapiens => { core => 'homo_sapiens_core_76_38', funcgen => 'homo_sapiens_funcgen_76_38', variation => 'homo_sapiens_variation_76_38', otherfeatures => 'homo_sapiens_otherfeatures_76_38', rnaseq => 'homo_sapiens_rnaseq_76_38', }, mus_musculus => { core => 'mus_musculus_core_76_38', funcgen => 'mus_musculus_funcgen_76_38', variation => 'mus_musculus_variation_76_38', otherfeatures => 'mus_musculus_otherfeatures_76_38', } }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Ensembl Database Records Export DESCRIPTION: Tab-delimited database export containing gene, transcript and translation records. Each row has a unique ID, object type (Gene/Transcript/Translation), reference IDs and nullable fields represented as \N. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/object_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sql CODE: ``` 14823740 430523 Gene 3655943 \N 8276 14823741 430523 Gene 3655944 \N 8276 14823742 430523 Gene 3655945 \N 8276 ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ensembl REST API server with custom configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Ensembl REST API server while specifying a custom configuration file. This allows overriding default configuration with environment-specific settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/ditag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG=mysite_ensembl_rest.conf script/ensembl_rest_server.pl ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Transcript Exons Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines an endpoint for retrieving the exons of a transcript. This returns all exons associated with the given transcript ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub exon : Chained('transcript') PathPart('exon') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') {} sub exon_GET { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $transcript = $c->stash()->{transcript}; my $exons = $c->model('Lookup')->get_exons_for_transcript($transcript); $self->status_ok($c, entity => $exons); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing CIGAR Alignment Records - Text DESCRIPTION: This snippet exemplifies a standard line from the file, containing two numeric columns (possibly sequence or position identifiers) and a CIGAR string which specifies a series of match, mismatch, deletion, or insertion operations for genomic alignment. Dependencies may include downstream code or tools capable of reading tab-separated records and parsing standard CIGAR expressions. Main parameters are the numeric IDs and the CIGAR string; inputs must adhere to this format, and outputs typically correspond to parsed CIGAR objects or annotated alignments for downstream analysis. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homology/compara/gene_align_member.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Text CODE: ``` 40664\t1467384\ ``` LANGUAGE: Text CODE: ``` 100000188\t100000065\t6M2D10MD19MD4M2D3MDM2D7M11D7M3D4MD8M25D6M ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Docker Image for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Command to build a Docker image for the Ensembl REST API. This creates a containerized version of the application with all dependencies installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker build -t ensembl-rest . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding Translation Features by ID in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to find protein domains and other translation-related features that overlap with a specific translation ID. This is useful for protein structure and function analysis. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // if there's an anchor tag in the URL, then scroll to the proper position // to account for our fixed header $(document).ready(function() { if(document.location.hash) { window.setTimeout(function() { var element = $(document.location.hash); if(element) { $('html, body').animate({ scrollTop: element.offset().top - 75 }, 10); } }, 1); } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Protein Sequence Data in FASTA-like Format DESCRIPTION: Collection of five protein sequences represented in standard amino acid single-letter notation.
