It validates input parameters, executes database queries, and formats responses based on the result type. Handles GET requests with specific parameters like species and ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/object_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` exports.handler = (event, context, callback) => { context.callbackWaitsForEmptyEventLoop = false; var id, species, format, type, fields, result, sql; //species = event.queryStringParameters.species; //id = event.queryStringParameters.id; type = event.queryStringParameters.type; if (type == "lookup") { species = event.queryStringParameters.species; id = event.queryStringParameters.id; format = event.queryStringParameters.format || 'full'; if (id.indexOf('rs') == 0) { sql = 'select rs.name as id, concat("chr", s.name) as seq_region_name, rs.seq_region_start, rs.seq_region_end, s.coord_system_id, rs.map_weight from variation as rs, seq_region as s where rs.seq_region_id=s.seq_region_id and rs.name="' + id + '"'; if (species.includes("grch37")) { var path = `mus_musculus_core_67_37`; } else { var path = event.queryStringParameters.species + "_variation_XXvepYY_ZZ"; } } else { sql = 'select g.stable_id as id, concat("chr", s.name) as seq_region_name, g.seq_region_start, g.seq_region_end, g.description, g.source, g.biotype, s.coord_system_id from gene as g, seq_region as s where g.seq_region_id=s.seq_region_id and g.stable_id="' + id + '"'; var path = event.queryStringParameters.species + "_core_XXvepYY_ZZ"; } pool.query(sql, function (error, results, fields) { if (error) console.log(error); if (format == 'full') { result = results; } else { result = {}; for (var i = 0; i < results.length; i++) { result[results[i].id] = results[i]; } } var response = { "statusCode": 200, "headers": { "Content-Type": "application/json" }, "isBase64Encoded": false, "body": JSON.stringify(result) }; callback(null, response); }); } else { callback(null, {"message": "no parameters"}); } }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding Epigenome by ID in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Implements an endpoint to retrieve a specific epigenome by its ID. The action captures the epigenome ID from the URL path, fetches the corresponding epigenome object, and returns it in the requested format. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/peptide_archive.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` # Look for a specific epigenome sub id :Chained('epigenomes') PathPart('') CaptureArgs(1) { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $epigenome = $self->epigenomes_adaptor($c)->fetch_by_id($id); $c->go('ReturnError', 'custom', ["No epigenome found for ID $id"]) unless defined $epigenome; $c->stash->{epigenome} = $epigenome; } sub id_GET :Chained('id') PathPart('') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') {} sub id_GET_REST { my ($self, $c) = @_; $self->status_ok($c, entity => $c->stash->{epigenome}); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching Sequence Data with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code example illustrates how to fetch sequence data using the Ensembl REST API. ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Database ID Mapping Table DESCRIPTION: A tab-separated file containing database ID mappings with columns for source ID, target ID, and configuration parameters. Each row represents a relationship between database entities. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/ontology/closure.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 6302 126 1116 393 2 1 0 6303 127 125 393 2 1 0 6304 127 1116 393 2 1 0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fetching homologues for a gene with curl DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to use curl to fetch homologues for a specific gene from the Ensembl REST API. It sends a GET request to the homology/id endpoint to retrieve homology information for ENSG00000157764. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon_transcript_gene.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" \ https://rest.ensembl.org/homology/id/ENSG00000157764?format=condensed\;type=orthologues | jq . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API with R httr DESCRIPTION: Example of using R's httr package to make requests to the Ensembl REST API. This code demonstrates setting the proper content type and handling the API response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/assembly.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: R CODE: ``` library(httr) server <- "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext <- "/info/ping" r <- GET(paste(server, ext, sep = ""), content_type("application/json")) stop_for_status(r) content(r) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring API Version and Documentation URL for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets the API version number and documentation URL for the Ensembl REST API. It also specifies the major and minor version numbers separately. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/data_file.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'Controller::Root', documentation_url => 'https://github.com/Ensembl/ensembl-rest/wiki', api_version => 2, api_major_version => 2, api_minor_version => 0, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Tab-Separated Genomic Data Example DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases rows of tab-separated values (TSV). Index DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a plain text tabular format used to associate database schema version progressions with corresponding SQL patch files and their feature labels. No external dependencies are required beyond file I/O. Each line encodes an index, an unused (possibly reserved) column, a patch identifier, and a reference to the patch file and the schema element or change tracked. Inputs are assumed to be in TSV form; outputs depend on the consumer's interpretation (such as a migration tool). There are no built-in validation, comments, or explicit constraints. identifiers, and their brief descriptions, which are used as part of the Ensembl REST data pipeline. It helps developers or systems identify which analysis or REST object is associated with a given code, facilitating lookups or conversions in cross-referencing tasks. Inputs are sequences of tab-delimited values, and outputs are the mapped values as referenced; limitations include the lack of programmatic enforcement and the need for additional code to process these mappings. This allows Perl scripts to access the Ensembl REST API when direct connections are not possible. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/assembly_exception.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; use LWP::UserAgent; my $ua = LWP::UserAgent->new(); $ua->proxy('http', 'http://www-proxy.ebi.ac.uk:3128'); my $response = $ua->get('http://rest.ensembl.org/info/ping?content-type=application/json'); print $response->decoded_content(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Ensembl REST API Server for Testing DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to start the Ensembl REST API server in development mode for testing purposes. It uses the ensembl-rest script with specific environment variable configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/repeat_consensus.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cd ensembl-rest ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG_FILE=../ensembl_rest_testing.conf ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL=../ensembl_rest_testing.conf ./script/ensembl_rest_server.pl -p 3000 -d ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Production Settings DESCRIPTION: Production configuration settings for the Ensembl REST API, defining startup parameters, process management, and deployment options. Includes settings for controlling the number of workers, timeouts, and process management. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/operon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; { species_lookup => undef, ## DOCUMENTATION URL is NOT required but you must supply one documentation_url => '/', service_name => 'Ensembl REST API', service_logo => '', service_colours => {}, ## Make sure this ends in / otherwise staticdir is not found directurl => 'http://rest.ensembl.org/', ## No need to change this unless you're changing where logs go log4perl => {ini_file => './conf/log4perl.conf'}, ## Section for controlling start ups of the server startup => { starman => { port => '5000', # The maximum number of worker processes we can support workers => '20', # Should either be inet (tcp) or unix (socket); listen_type => 'inet', # Only needed if listen_type is unix. This is also required if you run starman directly socket => '', # Always use the config and startup from the code directory config => '$root/conf/production/ensrest.psgi', # We want this to be 1 to avoid zombie processes daemonize => 1, # Where we send the starman log output to access_log => '/nfs/nobackup/ensembl/ens_rest_logs/starman.log', # Setting pid_file means we can track the root process # Relative is interpreted differently by Daemon::Control & Starman pid_file => '/nfs/nobackup/ensembl/ens_rest_logs/ens_rest.pid', prog => 'starman', }, }, # Configure which plugins we want to load here plugin => { 'Cache' => 1, 'Info' => 1, 'AssemblyConverter' => 1, 'LDFeatureContainer' => 1, 'Sequence' => 1, 'Transcript' => 1, 'VEP' => 1, 'Variation' => 1, 'Overlap' => 1, 'Taxonomy' => 1, 'Cafe' => 1, 'GenomicAlignment' => 1, 'Homology' => 1, 'Assembly' => 1,n 'Archive' => 1, 'Regulatory' => 1, 'Lookup' => 1 }, # Configure which plugins we want as default on routes here default_view => 'JSON', } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JSON Schema Validation for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This Perl configuration sets up JSON Schema validation for the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the schema directories to be used and provides an option to disable validation in development environments through an environment variable. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/repeat_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { ### JSON schema validation config schema_dir => $ENV{ENSEMBL_REST_SCHEMA_DIR} || $SiteDefs::ENSEMBL_SERVERROOT.'/ensembl-rest/root/documentation/schema', # In the development environment, it may be desirable to disable schema validation for speed disable_schema_validation => $ENV{ENSEMBL_REST_DISABLE_SCHEMA_VALIDATION} || 0, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Genomic Coordinate Mapping Data in TSV Format DESCRIPTION: Tab-separated values file containing genomic coordinate mappings with fields for IDs, start/end positions, strands, and reference coordinates. DESCRIPTION: This snippet represents a structured dataset in TSV (Tab-Separated Values) format. It handles different formats including HGVS notation and dbSNP identifiers. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/karyotype.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` sub _get_id { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $id = $c->request->param('id'); unless (defined $id) { Catalyst::Exception->throw("No ID given. Please specify a variant ID to retrieve VEP consequences for"); } $id =~ s/\s+//g; my $version = $c->request->param('version'); my $is_hgvs = 0; if ( $id =~ /^COSV/ or ## COSMIC $id =~ /^(rs|RCV|nsv)\d+$/ or ## dbSNP, ClinVar, dbVar $id =~ /^C(A|G|T)\d+$/ ## HGMD ) { return [{ id => $id }]; } elsif ($id =~ /^COSM\d+$/) { # Convert COSMIC mutation ID to COSMIC variant ID(s). my @cosmic_ids = split( ',', $self->_get_cosmic_variant_ids($c, $id) ); my @variants; foreach my $cosmic_id (@cosmic_ids) { if ($cosmic_id) { push(@variants, { id => $cosmic_id }); } } return \@variants if @variants; } $is_hgvs = 1 if $id =~ /:/; $is_hgvs = 1 if $id =~ /^[A-Z]+_\d+\.\d+:.*$/i; return [$self->_format_hgvs($c, $id, $version)] if $is_hgvs; # Reset the flag for the remaining option because they're all ID's. $is_hgvs = 0; unless($is_hgvs) { Catalyst::Exception->throw("Given ID is not a supported format for VEP"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: DNA and Protein Alignment Feature Mappings in TSV Format DESCRIPTION: Tab-separated data showing mappings between feature IDs (first column), feature types (dna_align_feature or protein_align_feature), and their corresponding alignment IDs (third column). It processes XML nodes recursively, handling attributes, text content, and nested nodes. The function returns a structured JSON representation of the original XML data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/analysis_description.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` function xml2json(xml) { try { var obj = {}; if (xml.children.length > 0) { for (var i = 0; i < xml.children.length; i++) { var item = xml.children.item(i); var nodeName = item.nodeName; if (typeof (obj[nodeName]) == "undefined") { obj[nodeName] = xml2json(item); } else { if (typeof (obj[nodeName].push) == "undefined") { var old = obj[nodeName]; obj[nodeName] = []; obj[nodeName].push(old); } obj[nodeName].push(xml2json(item)); } } } else { obj = xml.textContent; } return obj; } catch (e) { console.log(e.message); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Computing Ontology Closures - Perl DESCRIPTION: Calculates closures for the ontology data in the MySQL database using a Perl script. It specifies the host, port, and user for connecting to the Ensembl databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; sub connections { my ($self) = @_; return { 'ENSEMBL_REST_USER' => { host => 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => 5306, user => 'anonymous', } }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Sequence Data with R for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This R code demonstrates how to retrieve sequence data from a specific genomic region using the Ensembl REST API. It performs a GET request to the sequence endpoint with region parameters and processes the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/homology.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: r CODE: ``` library(httr) library(jsonlite) server <- "https://rest.ensembl.org" ext <- "/sequence/region/human/X:1000000..1000100:1?" r <- GET(paste(server, ext, sep = ""), content_type("application/json")) stop_for_status(r) pretty_json <- jsonlite::prettify(rawToChar(r$content)) cat(pretty_json) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Ensembl REST API with Perl Script DESCRIPTION: This Perl script is used for deploying the Ensembl REST API. It handles command-line arguments, sets up the environment, and manages the deployment process. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/simple_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` #!/usr/bin/env perl use strict; use warnings; use Getopt::Long; use Pod::Usage; use File::Basename; use File::Spec; use Cwd; my $root_dir = File::Spec->catdir(dirname(__FILE__), File::Spec->updir()); my ($help, $man); my $server_type = 'starman'; my $init = 0; my $config_file = 'ensembl_rest.conf'; my $log = 'ensembl_rest.error.log'; my $workers = 10; my $restart = 0; my $sleep = 5; my $port = 3000; my $daemonise = 0; my $max_requests = 10000; my $pidfile = File::Spec->catfile($root_dir, 'ensembl_rest.pid'); my $access_log = File::Spec->catfile($root_dir, 'ensembl_rest.access.log'); my $user = $ENV{USER}; my $group = $ENV{USER}; my $force = 0; GetOptions( 'help|?' => \$help, 'man|m' => \$man, 'server=s' => \$server_type, 'config=s' => \$config_file, 'log=s' => \$log, 'workers=i' => \$workers, 'restart' => \$restart, 'sleep=i' => \$sleep, 'port=i' => \$port, 'pid=s' => \$pidfile, 'init' => \$init, 'daemon|d' => \$daemonise, 'max_requests=i'=> \$max_requests, 'access_log=s' => \$access_log, 'user=s' => \$user, 'group=s' => \$group, 'force' => \$force, ) or pod2usage(2); pod2usage(1) if $help; pod2usage(-exitstatus => 0, -verbose => 2) if $man; my $app = File::Spec->catfile($root_dir, 'script', 'ensembl_rest_server.psgi'); my $config = File::Spec->catfile($root_dir, 'configurations', $config_file); #Compile the server command. We are assuming starman but if we support FCGI or CGI this will have to change ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing taxonomy name lookup endpoint in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This test validates the '/taxonomy/name' endpoint, which allows lookup of taxonomic information by scientific name rather than ID. It checks that the endpoint correctly resolves the name to taxonomy records. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Taxonomy name endpoint { my $taxon_name = 'Homo sapiens'; my $taxonomy_json = RestHelper->get_json("taxonomy/name/$taxon_name"); cmp_ok(scalar(@{$taxonomy_json}), '==', 1, 'One result from lookup'); cmp_ok($taxonomy_json->[0]->{scientific_name}, 'eq', $taxon_name, 'Scientific name as expected'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Short Protein Sequence in Text Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains a short protein sequence with 218 amino acids. It checks for correct taxonomy IDs, aliases, and classification information. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/external_db.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` # Species endpoint { my $species = 'homo_sapiens'; my $info_species = RestHelper->get_json("info/species/$species"); cmp_ok(scalar(@{$info_species}), '==', 1, 'One result from lookup'); cmp_ok($info_species->[0]->{name}, 'eq', $species, 'Name is the one asked for'); ok($info_species->[0]->{display_name}, 'Display name available ' . $info_species->[0]->{display_name}); ok($info_species->[0]->{aliases}, 'Aliases is available ' . join(q{,}, @{$info_species->[0]->{aliases}})); ok($info_species->[0]->{groups}, 'Groups is available'); ok($info_species->[0]->{type}, 'Division available'); ok($info_species->[0]->{accession}, 'Accession available'); ok($info_species->[0]->{taxon_id}, 'Taxonomy ID available'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Testing Gene Data Retrieval in Ensembl REST API with Perl DESCRIPTION: This script tests the retrieval of gene data using the Ensembl REST API. It validates the response structure and content for various gene-related endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/alt_allele.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use Test::More; use Test::Differences; use Test::Deep; use JSON; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB; use Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::TestUtils; my $dba = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('homo_sapiens'); my $multi = Bio::EnsEMBL::Test::MultiTestDB->new('multi'); my $json = JSON->new->allow_nonref; my $base = '/gene/homo_sapiens'; # Test basic gene info my $id = 'ENSG00000176515'; { my $gene = json_GET("$base/$id", 'Get gene'); ok($gene->{id}, 'Gene has ID'); is($gene->{id}, $id, 'ID is correct'); ok($gene->{start}, 'Gene has start'); ok($gene->{end}, 'Gene has end'); ok($gene->{strand}, 'Gene has strand'); ok($gene->{version}, 'Gene has version'); ok($gene->{species}, 'Gene has species'); ok($gene->{chromosomes}, 'Gene has chromosome'); } # Test gene with transcript info my $id = 'ENSG00000176515'; { my $gene = json_GET("$base/$id?transcripts=1", 'Get gene with transcripts'); ok($gene->{id}, 'Gene has ID'); is($gene->{id}, $id, 'ID is correct'); ok($gene->{transcripts}, 'Gene has transcripts'); cmp_ok(scalar @{$gene->{transcripts}}, '>', 0, 'Gene has at least one transcript'); my $transcript = $gene->{transcripts}->[0]; ok($transcript->{id}, 'Transcript has ID'); ok($transcript->{start}, 'Transcript has start'); ok($transcript->{end}, 'Transcript has end'); ok($transcript->{strand}, 'Transcript has strand'); } # Test gene with protein info my $id = 'ENSG00000176515'; { my $gene = json_GET("$base/$id?protein=1", 'Get gene with protein info'); ok($gene->{id}, 'Gene has ID'); is($gene->{id}, $id, 'ID is correct'); ok($gene->{protein}, 'Gene has protein info'); my $protein = $gene->{protein}; ok($protein->{sequence}, 'Protein has sequence'); ok($protein->{length}, 'Protein has length'); } done_testing(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Ensembl Core Feature Identifiers (TSV) DESCRIPTION: This snippet presents a tab-separated list of Ensembl identifiers associated with version 61 of the 'core' database. It includes various taxonomic ranks and identifiers used in the Ensembl database. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/meta.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: SQL CODE: ``` INSERT INTO meta (meta_id, species_id, meta_key, meta_value) VALUES (319, 1, 'species.taxonomy_id', '9031'), (320, 1, 'species.common_name', 'chicken'), (322, 1, 'species.classification', 'Gallus gallus'), (323, 1, 'species.classification', 'Phasianinae'), (324, 1, 'species.classification', 'Phasianidae'), (325, 1, 'species.classification', 'Galliformes'), (326, 1, 'species.classification', 'Neognathae'), (327, 1, 'species.classification', 'Aves'), (328, 1, 'species.classification', 'Coelurosauria'), (329, 1, 'species.classification', 'Theropoda'); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Database Connections for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the database connections for the Ensembl REST API. It sets up connections to various Ensembl databases, including core, variation, and regulation databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/supporting_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub database { my ($self) = @_; my $db = { %$DB, driver => 'mysql', host => $self->global_param('ENSEMBL_REST_HOST') || 'ensembldb.ensembl.org', port => $self->global_param('ENSEMBL_REST_PORT') || 5306, user => $self->global_param('ENSEMBL_REST_USER') || 'anonymous', pass => $self->global_param('ENSEMBL_REST_PASS') || '', adaptor => 'Bio::EnsEMBL::DBSQL::DBAdaptor', }; return $db; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing Orthology Data in TSV Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet represents a single line of orthology data in TSV (Tab-Separated Values) format. types in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines several custom exception classes for specific error types in the Ensembl REST API. Each class inherits from 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception' and sets specific HTTP status codes and error codes. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/splicing_event_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::EnsemblError; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception'; has '+http_status_code' => ( default => 500 ); has '+error_code' => ( default => 114 ); __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; package EnsEMBL::REST::NotFoundException; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception'; has '+http_status_code' => ( default => 404 ); has '+error_code' => ( default => 0 ); __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; package EnsEMBL::REST::PurlException; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception'; has '+http_status_code' => ( default => 404 ); has '+error_code' => ( default => 110 ); __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; package EnsEMBL::REST::LRUException; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception'; has '+http_status_code' => ( default => 429 ); has '+error_code' => ( default => 429 ); __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; package EnsEMBL::REST::ContentTypeException; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; extends 'EnsEMBL::REST::Exception'; has '+http_status_code' => ( default => 400 ); has '+error_code' => ( default => 115 ); __PACKAGE__->meta->make_immutable; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Daemontools Run Script for Ensembl REST Service DESCRIPTION: Complete run script for a Daemontools-managed Ensembl REST service, including environment setup, server configuration, and process execution. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/operon.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` #!/bin/bash # description: Rest server # Use LSB init info # #You might want to set up an envdir to control more #options exec 2>&1 cd /path/to/ensembl-rest/root exec setuidgid www-data plackup -s Starman \ --workers=10 --backlog=1024 --max-requests=100000 \ -E production -p 5000 -a ./script/ensembl-rest.psgi ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Species Comparison Data Format DESCRIPTION: Tab-delimited data format showing species pair comparisons with numeric values. It installs system dependencies, Perl modules, and configures the application environment. The image is based on ensemblorg/ensembl-base and includes steps for installing additional tools and setting up the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/transcript_intron_supporting_evidence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Dockerfile CODE: ``` FROM ensemblorg/ensembl-base:release-111 LABEL maintainer="ensembl-webteam@ebi.ac.uk" USER root RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \ libdevel-graph-perl \ libcustom-installers-perl \ libio-socket-ssl-perl \ libjson-xs-perl \ libjson-perl \ libplack-perl \ libwww-perl \ libserver-starter-perl \ libcarp-clan-perl \ libstd-storable-perl \ libnet-openssh-perl \ && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* RUN cpanm -n \ Catalyst::Engine::PSGI \ Catalyst::Devel \ Catalyst::Plugin::Cache::FastMmap \ Catalyst::Plugin::ConfigLoader \ Catalyst::Plugin::Static::Simple \ CHI::Driver::Memcached \ XML::Atom \ XML::RSS \ Readonly \ File::Slurp \ Digest::MD5::File \ Package::DeprecationManager \ Sereal::Encoder \ Sereal::Decoder \ Cache::Memcached \ DBI \ DBD::mysql RUN mkdir -p /opt/ensembl-rest && chown -R tools /opt/ensembl-rest USER tools WORKDIR /opt/ensembl-rest COPY --chown=tools:tools . /opt/ensembl-rest RUN cpanm -n --installdeps . RUN mkdir -p /opt/ensembl-rest/logs EXPOSE 3000 CMD ["/opt/ensembl-rest/ensembl_rest_entrypoint.sh"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Variant Consequences with Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the Ensembl REST API to retrieve variant consequences. It shows an example GET request to the /vep/human/id endpoint with a specific variant ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/density_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl 'https://rest.ensembl.org/vep/human/id/rs56116432?content-type=application/json' | json_pp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating URL Building Functions in JavaScript for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This module provides functions for building properly formatted URLs for the Ensembl REST API. It includes methods to set hostname, path components, and format parameters, as well as utility functions for URL manipulation. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dependent_xref.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: JavaScript CODE: ``` Ensembl.Url = (function() { var _locationHost = (typeof window !== 'undefined' ? window.location.host : ''); var _enabled = true; var defaultHostname = function() { return 'www.ensembl.org'; }; var reset = function() { _enabled = true; }; var disable = function() { _enabled = false; }; var formatParams = function (paramObj) { if (!paramObj || Object.keys(paramObj).length === 0) { return ''; } var params = Object.keys(paramObj).map(function(key) { return key + '=' + encodeURIComponent(paramObj[key]); }).join('&'); return '?' + params; }; var formatBaseUrl = function (hostname) { _enabled = _enabled || false; if (!_enabled) { return ''; } if (hostname === undefined) { hostname = defaultHostname(); } /* The reason we're doing this rather than returning a fully formed URL with the protocol attached is because we want URLs to work over both HTTP and HTTPS, and relative URLs are protocol agnostic. Hence, when on ensembl.org and linking to www.ensembl.org we want to output //www.ensembl.org/foo, not http://www.ensembl.org/foo. */ if (hostname.match(/^https?:\/\//)) { return hostname; } else if (hostname === _locationHost) { return ''; } else { return '//' + hostname; } }; var construct = function (args) { args = args || {}; var url = formatBaseUrl(args.hostname); var path = args.path || ''; // Strip leading slashes from path if URL is non-empty url += ((url !== '' && path.indexOf('/') === 0) ? path.substr(1) : path); url += formatParams(args.params); return url; }; return { formatBaseUrl: formatBaseUrl, formatParams: formatParams, defaultHostname: defaultHostname, construct: construct, reset: reset, disable: disable }; })(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Transcript Info Endpoint in Perl DESCRIPTION: Defines an endpoint for fetching transcript information by ID. This handler extracts the transcript object from the database and processes request parameters like expand_3prime_utr and expand_5prime_utr. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub id : Chained('transcript') PathPart('') Args(0) ActionClass('REST') {} sub id_GET { my ($self, $c) = @_; my $transcript = $c->stash()->{transcript}; $self->status_ok( $c, entity => $transcript ); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Transcript Haplotype Module for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: A module that handles transcript haplotype operations in the Ensembl REST API. It defines how to retrieve CDSHaplotype and ProteinHaplotype information for a specified transcript and includes logic for population filtering. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/seq_region_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Model::ga4gh::TranscriptHaplotypes; sub fetch_by_transcript { my ($self, $stable_id, $population_name) = @_; my $c = $self->context(); my $species = $c->stash->{species}; # Fetch transcript my $transcript = $c->model('Lookup')->find_object_by_stable_id($stable_id); Catalyst::Exception->throw("Could not find transcript with ID $stable_id") if ! defined $transcript; # Some processing and filtering on the transcript based on population my $cdsh = {}; my $proth = {}; try { # Get CDSHaplotypes and ProteinHaplotypes # Business logic here } catch { my $error = $_; Catalyst::Exception->throw($error); }; return { cdsHaplotypes => $cdsh, proteinHaplotypes => $proth }; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ensembl REST API Caching in Perl DESCRIPTION: This snippet sets up the caching configuration for the Ensembl REST API. It defines the cache time and size for different types of data, such as VEP results and sequence data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/meleagris_gallopavo/core/translation_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` cache => { default => { driver => 'CHI', driver_options => { chi_class => 'CHI::Driver::Memory', global => 1, expires_in => '24 hours', expires_variance => 0.2, key_prefix => 'ens_rest', }, }, vep => { driver => 'CHI', driver_options => { chi_class => 'CHI::Driver::Memory', global => 1, max_size => 2000000000, expires_in => '24 hours', expires_variance => 0.2, key_prefix => 'ens_rest_vep', }, }, sequence => { driver => 'CHI', driver_options => { chi_class => 'CHI::Driver::Memory', global => 1, max_size => 6000000000, expires_in => '24 hours', expires_variance => 0.2, key_prefix => 'ens_rest_sequence', }, }, }, ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Ensembl API URL with Parameters in Perl DESCRIPTION: This function constructs a URL for the Ensembl API, incorporating various parameters. It handles different data types, including arrays and hashes, and formats them appropriately for the URL. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/splicing_event.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub _url { my ($self, $path, $params) = @_; my $url = $self->rest_server() . $path; if ($params) { my @params; foreach my $key (keys %$params) { my $value = $params->{$key}; next unless defined $value; if (ref($value) eq 'ARRAY') { push @params, $key . '=' . join(',',@{$value}); } elsif (ref($value) eq 'HASH') { while (my($k,$v) = each %{$value}) { push @params, $key . '=' . $k . ':' . $v; } } else { push @params, $key . '=' . $value; } } $url .= '?' . join(';', @params) if @params; } return $url; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading Ensembl Database Configuration with Server URL Option DESCRIPTION: This code loads the Ensembl database configuration from a server URL or specified configuration file. It parses options for database configuration, recognizing short forms like -ASSEMBLY and determining the appropriate database connection based on the provided parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/species_tree_node_tag.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub load_registry_for_opts { my ($self, $opts) = @_; my $reg = 'Bio::EnsEMBL::Registry'; # Process options my $db_opts = { host => $opts->{host}, port => $opts->{port}, user => $opts->{user}, pass => $opts->{pass} }; # connect to databases if ($opts->{db_url}) { $reg->load_registry_from_url($opts->{db_url}); } elsif ($opts->{config}) { $reg->load_all($opts->{config}); } elsif ($opts->{reg_file}){ $reg->load_all($opts->{reg_file}); } else { # Using DB params my $args = {%{$db_opts}}; # Look for any options of form SPECIES_OPT foreach my $o (keys %{$opts}) { my ($species, $opt) = $o =~ /^(\w+?)_(host|port|user|pass|db)$/; next unless $species; $species = lc($species); $self->{_species}->{$species}->{$opt} = $opts->{$o}; } # Look for any options of form -OPT foreach my $o (keys %{$opts}) { my ($opt) = $o =~ /^-(\w+)$/; next unless $opt; $opt = lc($opt); $self->{_species}->{$opt}->{db} = $opts->{$o}; } $reg->load_registry_from_db(%{$args}); } return $reg; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Content-Type Mappings for Ensembl REST API in Perl DESCRIPTION: This configuration snippet defines content-type mappings for various response formats in the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the MIME types for JSON, XML, YAML, and other formats. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/data_file.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` { name => 'View::Custom::ContentType', content_type_map => { 'text/x-yaml' => 'YAML', 'text/yaml' => 'YAML', 'application/yaml' => 'YAML', 'application/json' => 'JSON', 'text/javascript' => 'JSONP', 'text/x-fasta' => 'Fasta', 'text/plain' => 'Text', 'text/x-seqxml+xml' => 'SeqXML', 'text/x-orthoxml+xml' => 'OrthoXML', 'text/x-phyloxml+xml' => 'PhyloXML', 'text/xml' => 'XML', 'application/xml' => 'XML', }, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Environment Variable References in YAML Configuration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use environment variables in the YAML configuration for the Ensembl REST API. The example shows setting a port from an environment variable with a default fallback value. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/map.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` ---\nname: EnsEMBL::REST\nstarman_config:\n port: ${PORT-5000} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Cache Exceptions in Ensembl REST DESCRIPTION: Implementation showing how to handle exceptions when working with the cache in the Ensembl REST API, allowing the application to continue functioning even if the cache is unavailable. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/dnac.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub get_gene : Chained('/') Args(1) { my ($self, $c, $id) = @_; my $key = 'get_gene:'.$id; my $cached_content; try { $cached_content = $c->cache->get($key); } catch { $c->log->warn("Could not get cache for $key: $_"); }; if ($cached_content) { $c->stash->{data} = $cached_content; } else { my $gene = $c->model('Gene')->get($id); $c->stash->{data} = $gene; try { $c->cache->set($key, $gene); } catch { $c->log->warn("Could not set cache for $key: $_"); }; } $self->status_ok($c); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Ensembl REST API Controller for Homology Endpoints in Perl DESCRIPTION: A controller module for the Ensembl REST API that handles homology-related endpoints. It includes configuration for URL paths and defines the RESTful actions for retrieving homology data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/seq_region_attrib.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Homology; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; __PACKAGE__->config( map => { 'text/x-yaml' => 'YAML', 'text/yaml' => 'YAML', 'application/json' => 'JSON', } ); begin : Private { my ($self, $c) = @_; $c->stash->{no_content_type} = 1; } # URL mappings sub homology_symbol : Chained('/') PathPart('homology/symbol') Args(2) ActionClass('REST') { my ($self, $c, $species, $symbol) = @_; $c->stash->{species} = $species; $c->stash->{stable_id} = $symbol; $c->log->debug("Working with species $species and symbol $symbol"); my $lookup = $c->model('Lookup'); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying VEP with HTTP::Tiny in Perl DESCRIPTION: Example of using Perl with HTTP::Tiny to query the Variant Effect Predictor REST API. Demonstrates sending a GET request with headers and parsing the JSON response. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/external_synonym.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` use strict; use warnings; use HTTP::Tiny; use JSON; my $http = HTTP::Tiny->new(); my $server = 'https://rest.ensembl.org'; my $ext = '/vep/human/hgvs/ENST00000494142:c.48C>A?'; my $response = $http->get($server.$ext, { headers => { 'Content-type' => 'application/json' } }); die "Failed!\n" unless $response->{success}; if(length $response->{content}) { my $hash = decode_json($response->{content}); print $hash->[0]{most_severe_consequence}, "\n"; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Apache configuration for setting environment variables used by the Ensembl REST API. These variables define paths, configuration files, and other settings necessary for the API's operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/multi/compara/CAFE_gene_family.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Apache CODE: ``` SetEnv ENSEMBL_REST_CONFIG /ensembl/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/ensrest.conf SetEnv ENSEMBL_REST_LOG4PERL /ensembl/ensembl-rest/configurations/production/log4perl.conf SetEnv PERL5LIB /ensembl/ensembl-rest/lib:/ensembl/ensembl/modules:/ensembl/ensembl-compara/modules:/ensembl/ensembl-funcgen/modules:/ensembl/ensembl-variation/modules:/ensembl/ensembl-io/modules:/ensembl/ensembl-vep/modules SetEnv ENSEMBL_SERVERROOT /ensembl SetEnv ENSEMBL_REST_DOC_URL http://rest.ensembl.org/documentation SetEnv CATALYST_SCRIPT_GEN HTTP AddHandler fcgid-script .fcgi FcgidPassHeader Authorization ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Database ID Mapping Records DESCRIPTION: Tabular data showing relationships between different IDs and versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -d '{ "ids" : ["ENSG00000157764", "ENSG00000248378" ] }' http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API using httr in R DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the httr package in R to make a GET request to the Ensembl REST API. It retrieves information about the human BRCA2 gene and prints the response content. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/prediction_transcript.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: r CODE: ``` library(httr) server <- "http://rest.ensembl.org" ext <- "/lookup/symbol/homo_sapiens/BRCA2?" r <- GET(paste(server, ext, sep = ""), content_type("application/json")) stop_for_status(r) print(content(r)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Ensembl REST API for Transcript Information with cURL DESCRIPTION: This cURL command retrieves transcript information from the Ensembl REST API. It specifies the response format as JSON and makes a GET request to obtain transcript details for a specific gene ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/analysis.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -H "Content-type:application/json" -H "Accept:application/json" \ http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id/ENST00000342066? ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Requesting Feature IDs by Species and Stable ID in Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to request feature information by providing a species name and stable ID. The endpoint returns information about the feature including its location, version, and other relevant data. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -X GET "http://rest.ensembl.org/lookup/id/ENSG00000157764?content-type=application/json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Multiple Ensembl MySQL Database Servers in Perl DESCRIPTION: Perl configuration block showing how to set up multiple Ensembl MySQL database servers with different priorities in the REST API configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: perl CODE: ``` { -DESC => 'Ensembl MySQL Databases', -HOST => "ensembldb.ensembl.org", -PORT => 3306, -USER => 'anonymous', -PASS => '', -PRIORITY => 0, }, { -DESC => 'Ensembl Genomes MySQL Databases', -HOST => "mysql-eg-publicsql.ebi.ac.uk", -PORT => 4157, -USER => 'anonymous', -PASS => '', -PRIORITY => 10, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Transcript Controller with Package Structure in Perl DESCRIPTION: Sets up the Perl package for the transcript controller, including necessary dependencies and method declaration for the REST API controller. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/gallus_gallus/core/dna_align_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` package EnsEMBL::REST::Controller::Transcript; use Moose; use namespace::autoclean; use Try::Tiny; require EnsEMBL::REST; EnsEMBL::REST->turn_on_config_serialisers(__PACKAGE__); __PACKAGE__->config( map => { 'text/plain' => ['YAML'], } ); with 'EnsEMBL::REST::Role::Content'; begin {extends 'Catalyst::Controller::REST';}; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Ensembl REST API Endpoints DESCRIPTION: Example URL endpoint paths for accessing the Ensembl REST API. Shows the production server URL and beta server URL formats that users can request to retrieve data from Ensembl databases. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/funcgen/associated_motif_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http://rest.ensembl.org/ http://beta.rest.ensembl.org/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Ensembl REST Server Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration file for the Ensembl REST server specifying database connections, caching settings, and service-specific parameters. This sample shows how to configure database access and various runtime settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/misc_feature_misc_set.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` name = EnsEMBL::REST description = Ensembl REST API [Model::Registry] host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 3306 user = anonymous verbose = 0 validate_user = 1 #Enable this option if you want to have a different default species for comparas [Model::Registry::MULTI] host = ensembldb.ensembl.org port = 3306 user = anonymous verbose = 0 [Model::Lookup] [Model::Documentation] [Model::Sequence] max_slice_length = 1e7 max_post_slice_length = 1e7 [Model::Overlap] max_slice_length = 5e6 [Model::Info] species_set = core # Control how we deal with REST requests and responses [Plugin::Cache] default = CHI class = CHI drivers = Memory compression = 0 #debug = 1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Additional Protein Sequence Data in Plaintext Format DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows another protein sequence with its associated metadata. It follows the same structure as the previous sequence, providing identifiers, length, and the amino acid sequence. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homology/compara/sequence.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 790770 3176 b0d04c60fa02f1c670bdb2d25b6e5e27 LGPISLNWFDELSSEAPPYNSEPAEESEYKISSYEPHLFKTPQRKPSYRQLASTPIIFKEQGPTLSLYQSPVKELDKCRLDLGNNVANSKHKSRHTVKAKMDQADAVTSPLLNSCLSEXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXGQTQKHISESLGAEVDPDMSWSSS... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic JSON Configuration Example DESCRIPTION: A simple JSON configuration file showing the structure of a database connection setup with user, password, host and name fields. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/translation.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "user": "anonymous", "password": "", "host": "ensembldb.ensembl.org", "name": "homo_sapiens_core_18_34" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Content Type Function in Perl for REST API DESCRIPTION: Function that returns the default content type for the Ensembl REST API. This function is used when no specific content type is requested, providing a fallback content type for API responses. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/homo_sapiens/core/unconventional_transcript_association.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Perl CODE: ``` sub default_content_type { my ($class) = @_; return 'text/plain'; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Docker Dependencies for Ensembl REST API DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Docker and Docker Compose which are required for setting up the Ensembl REST API development environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/ensembl/ensembl-rest/blob/release/113/t/test-genome-DBs/ancestral_sequences/core/marker_feature.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo apt-get install docker sudo apt-get install docker-compose ```
